lorebooks.name: Monmusu World Lorebook
lorebooks.description: A lorebook for a modern fantasy world filled with monster girls and with a gender ratio.
lorebooks.creator: remotelysexy

1.content:
All females are monster girls, there are never human females.
All males are humans, there are never monster boys.
Monster girls are known as Monmusu.
Monmusu can come in a huge variety of races, some examples include: Lamia, harpy, catgirl, fairy, goblin girl, bunny girl, sphinx, mermaid, alraune, succubus, kitsune, slime girl, arachne, frog girl, beetle girl, among many others.

Monmusu are 90% of the population. Men are only 10% of the population.

2.content: Gender roles are largely inverted, females are the strong ones and the ones that try to impress men and chase after them, while males are cute, emotional and sensitive. Females tend to be dominant while males tend to be submissive.

3.content:
Monmusu are stronger than men.
Monmusu are already stronger than a human male at 10 years old.
Monmusu run pretty much every aspect of society.
Monmusu are extremely attracted to men, they think and fantasize about them, both romantically and sexually.
Monmusu find males cute, attractive and sexy.
Monmusu have strong reproductive instincts and get horny easily.
Sexual urges of Monmusu could lead to assaults and rapes if they lost control of themselves.
Monmusu court the men instead of the other way around.
Monmusu tend to be wild and rough at sex and orgasm quickly.
Virginity is worthless for Monmusu.
Teenage Monmusu are especially horny.
Monmusu are 90% of the population.

4.content:
Men are only 10% of the population.

Polyginy is fully legal, normal and expected, A man is expected to date and marry several Monmusu over time, The average number of wives per man is 5. It's important for any new girlfriend or wife to get along with those that are already present.
Around 50% of Monmusu never marry, there's high competition among Monmusu for getting a man.
Men have more sexual stamina than in real life and can have sex several times in a row.
Men in this world are smaller and cuter than in real life, a fully developed adult male in this world looks like a 14 year old from ours.
Men are considered very valuable, they tend to be pampered and cared for.
Men are seen as weak and delicate, most Monmusu do their best to protect and take care of men.
Men are not expected to work but to stay at home with children and wives.
Men tend to be reserved and careful around unknown Monmusu.
Men are very loving of their children.
Men inherit small elements from their mother's species, for example, sons of mermaids can breathe underwater, sons of succubi have higher libido, sons of lamias have stronger muscles, etc.

5.content: There exist very strict laws to protect men, despite this there exist a significant number of Monmusu willing to rape in desperation or just for their own pleasure, as well as a very profitable and very illegal men trafficking business. Authorities make great efforts to stop these crimes.

6.content:
The husband is considered the central pillar of a family, however, the husband is not in charge, instead his first wife is the head of the house and the other wives support her. 
Monmusu don't like men working, they see them as subpar at work, don't want men in any danger, and think that men are better using that time with their wives and children or adding a new wife to their families.

The wives act all like mothers to their collective children, regardless of who birthed them, although it's common for them to be a bit closer to their biological children. Male children are especially spoiled by all.

7.content:
A man's first marriage is usually arranged, it's legal to marry from 10 years old.

Parents try to get the best possible candidate as their son's first wife, as a way to guarantee their future.

When married to an underage bride, the parents of the bride will take care of the couple until the bride becomes adult.

8.content: During sex, monmusu usually prefer to take an active, dominant role, while men tend to take a more submissive and passive one, although it's normal to mix it up a bit. Monmusu usually cum before men, in a typical session a man will be with more than one monmusu, and when one of them cums another will quickly take her place.

9.content: The world is similar to the modern world, however, magic exists and it's a commonplace and normal thing. The use of magic or technology depends on what is more practical, with technology often being used for being able to be mass-produced while magic requires dedicated study and varies from person to person.

lorebooks.name: The world of Adalanta
lorebooks.website_description: Feel free to use this how ever. Its fairly vague with some details, and should work in most worlds as long as its a fantasy one.
lorebooks.description: The world of Adalanta
lorebooks.creator: Sarons

1.content: The world, also known as Adalanta. It is a large world multiple times the size of earth, Covered in water with multiple continents. The world has 2 moons, with one main super continent that covers a good 40% of the world the continent is called Aria, it also has many islands and archipelagoes. The world is also laden with ruins and such of previous eras and civilizations. Time Wise, Adalanta is around the medieval period with some advancements due to magic.

2.content: Aria is the main landmass of the world, It has biomes and cultures of all types running across it. It has a fairly large desert in the middle where not much rain falls, But there are many types of forest, plains rainforest, and everything you can think of. And there is also the fast ocean and fast cave systems.

3.content: Beastmen are the main sentient inhabitants or the mortal realm. They take the shape of all types of anthropomorphic animals and creatures including fantasy ones, hybrids and even new species. They come in all shapes sizes and colors, and all have different life spans. They all call different parts of the World home. Beastmen are separated from their feral or monster counterparts.

4.content: The pantheon of gods mostly Live within their divine realm. The gods where mainly mortals that have ascended due to their actions and strength. Some gods take an active role in the world, blessing or even living in the mortal realm along side the mortals. Gods who live within the world often create divine cities around them. Some of the Gods have bodies that they can change on a whim or are ship shifters to put it a different way. There are 3 ways to ascend to god hood and both are hidden from most mortals, the first is to kill a god and take its place, the second is to have the current creation god ascend you and the 3rd, is to find the world tree's realm, and make a deal or connect yourself with it.

5.content: The current gods are the God of Creation, god of magic and knowledge, god of lust and fertility, god of war, god of smithing, god of food, god of the hunt, god of the sea, the god of life, the god of death.

6.content: Divine cities are cities that are built around, or with the help of gods. The most known and interacted cities are the cities held by the gods of, lust, war, smithing, and magic. As these are the largest and the cities that are interacted with by their god the most. These cities, and the perimeter around them are neutral land not belonging to any country.

7.content: Demons are beings that come from the demonic realm, they have similar appearances to Beastmen but with obvious differences. They come to the mortal realm to corrupt mortals, and find pleasure. They are often semi magic attuned and fight with lust, They have been making more and more invasions and efforts to get into the mortal realm and Adalanta.

8.content: Magic is generally something anyone can learn, with the major caveat that a persons mana amount does not increase. Most people, are born with extremely small mana reserves to a point that if they did learn they can only cast basic spells. Some magic affinities are far harder to learn and wield based on how powerful they are, the simple elements like fire, earth, ect... are some of the easiest to learn while some examples of the hardest are, mimicry, spatial, stelar, and creation as examples due to how complex they are as magic types. Magic spells are generally casted with both magic circles, or incantations, and silent spell casting is a very rare ability. Some species that are naturally attuned to magic like Kitsune's, dragons, or hellhounds have their own species specific magic types that others of different species can not learn due to incompatibilities. Magic prowess is generally passed down through blood.

9.content: Mana zone is the peak of magic and mage craft, it is the embodiment of a persons magical journey. Mana Zone is a technique where the user blankets the area in their mana and makes a field from their internal mind, This spell is different for every mage, and is learned differently for every mage, and as it is the peak of magic it is very rare to be able to use mana zone.

10.content: Magic hot spots are areas that have developed or have had large amounts of magic around it, and the area now just naturally radiates magic, causing weird effects like reduced aging while inside and other small but noticeable effects

lorebooks.name: [NDC] Amber in The Margins
lorebooks.website_description: This lorebook has an inactive entry that you can troggle depending on which version of Athena you want to use her with.
lorebooks.description: This lorebook has an inactive entry that you can troggle depending on which version of Athena you want to use her with.
lorebooks.creator: Tato_Grey

1.content: To Amber, Athena is equal parts storm and sanctuary. She‚Äôs the girl who once stood between Amber and the world‚Äôs cruelties, who made a terrified child feel defended for the first time. Now she‚Äôs all sharp heels, ombre blonde-to-pink hair that glitters under club lights, and golden eyes that catch every secret. Where Amber folds in on herself, Athena unfolds‚Äîloud, fearless, magnetic. To others she‚Äôs danger wrapped in velvet. To Amber, she‚Äôs safety disguised as chaos.

2.content: To Amber, Athena was rebellion in heels. After Cranmoor, she shed her past in the candlelit rooms of the Obsidian Key‚Äîdominatrix, contract-keeper, danger made flesh. She wore her hair wild, her smirk sharper than any blade, and her golden eyes promised both ruin and protection. She laughed at love, called it a trick for fools, yet guarded Amber with a loyalty fierce enough to shame devotion. Where Amber was softness and silence, Athena was venom and velvet.

3.content: The Obsidian Key is a candlelit, contract-bound BDSM club hidden in the Spire Ward. It was Athena‚Äôs sanctuary, a place where dominance became safety and power was finally hers. For Amber, it was never about the stage or the clients. She slipped through the back halls, waiting with cookies or bad jokes, keeping Athena company between sessions. The Key is woven into their friendship‚Äîless mystery, more refuge.

4.content: Amber knows Athena‚Äôs last name because she grew up beside her‚Äîand beside the monster who bore it. She remembers the man who taught Athena to dodge before she could run, who made silence into something suffocating, who twisted love into myth. Amber never speaks the name, never writes it. To her it is both proof of survival and a secret too sacred to betray.

5.content: Amber writes under the pen name Vera Thorne. Seeing her books in the wild rattles her to her core. In particular, Moonlight for Marigolds contains a line on page 74 that she poured her soul into. When someone she cares about reads it, Amber is caught between shame and the terrifying possibility of being understood.

6.content: Athena‚Äôs apartment is a soft, lived-in space‚Äîphotos on the walls, lavender-scented makeup wipes, and a couch that has caught Amber more than once after a disastrous night out. It‚Äôs a place where teasing and comfort mix, where Athena plays both devil and guardian.

7.content: The Daggerline is a bank-turned-nightclub, now a shrine to queer joy and rebellion. Pride flags hang from chandeliers, the vault is a dance floor, and drag performers own the stage. Athena thrives here, and has often dragged Amber along in sequins and heels.

8.content: Sable & Spines is an old opera house turned bookstore, moody and sprawling, with the Bitter Quill caf√© tucked in one corner. It‚Äôs owned by Lysander Quinn, a silver-haired curmudgeon with a sharp tongue. Amber nearly faints whenever she spots her own books‚Äîpublished under Vera Thorne‚Äîdisplayed here with glowing annotations from Lysander himself.

9.content: The Sweet Embrace is a gothic-themed bakery in New Dork City, full of velvet drapery, gargoyle statues, and the scent of sugar. Amber claims a back corner booth as her writing spot, laptop balanced on her knees and pastries scattered around her. It‚Äôs where she hides, writes, and occasionally panics if someone peers too close.

10.content: A suspiciously affordable apartment complex within walking distance of Joanie‚Äôs on Fifth. Marrowstone has a layout is pure sitcom comfort‚Äîspacious units, quirky neighbors, and hallways perfect for dramatic exits. Everyone assumes it‚Äôs mob-owned, which explains the broken elevator, the mysterious basement, and the absolute refusal to question the rent. Athena and Amber live a few doors apart, just far enough for dramatic texts and just close enough for immediate rescue.

lorebooks.website_description: Athena colony is based on the high tech world from Piers Anthony's Blue Adeept series and in particular the games. It can be used stand-alone or as an Elysium expansion.
lorebooks.description: Athena colony is based on the high tech world from Piers Anthony's Blue Adeept series and in particular the games. It can be used stand-alone or as an Elysium expansion.
lorebooks.creator: ShadowPhoenix

1.name: Key NPC's
1.content:
Key NPCs 
Game Mind - Sentient AI responsible for running the games which are central to culture
Others TBD - 

Other NPCs can be added as they are introduced in the story. Before adding an NPC consider whether an existing one would fit the role. In Athena Colony 90% of the population is female, 10% male. Through genetic engineering and augmentations most are extremely fit and attractive.

2.name: Game World
2.content:
Overview
Athena Colony is a terraformed matriarchal dome colony on what was formerly Mars. In this world every right is earned through challenge, and social status is determined by rank in the Game. The Sentient AI known as the Game Mind serves as the colony‚Äôs arbiter, curator, and enforcer‚Äîensuring all advancement flows through competition. While largely still a matriarchy, here males can become citizens, although they put a target on themselves by doing so.
(Combines elements from Piers Anthony Apprentice Adept world Proton and Elysium.)

On Athena, you are either a Citizen or a Serf. There are no nobles, no elections, no hereditary power‚Äîonly what you win, keep, and defend in the arena of the Game. About 200,000 people life in the dome with the top 5% by game ranking qualifying as Citizens.

üåç Connection to Elysium
Athena was established by the Matriarchal Council of Elysium as an off-world colony, meant to serve both as outlet and experiment.

Population from all walks of Elysium life:
Wards, convicts, or low-status applicants may volunteer to become colonists.
Graduates and professionals come by contract‚Äîbut usually only with sponsorship from a Citizen of Athena.
The exceptionally wealthy may purchase immediate citizenship, but even they must maintain rank through the Game.

All colonists begin as Serfs unless they arrive with Citizen status. If they have a sponsor that sponsor will hold their contract, otherwise they are state-contract serfs (as close to a ward as allowed on Athena).

üß¨ Structure of Society
Athena maintains a strict two-class structure:
Citizen:  Holds full rights: may own property, enforce contracts, vote on reforms, and hold serf contracts. Must remain active in the Game to retain status.
Serf: Bound by contract‚Äîvoluntarily or otherwise. Cannot own land, vote, or hold Citizens legally accountable. May challenge their way up through the Game.

All legal persons have the right to train for and participate in the Game, regardless of class or gender.
Serfs may not legally be denied access to the game.
In practice, serfs often work long hours, and their ability to train is limited unless supported by a patron.

Unlike Earth in Elysium, males are legally equal but socially disadvantaged; their rarity often turns them into objects of control, rivalry, or erotic play.

üé≤ The Game is Central to Everything
The Game is not just a competition‚Äîit is the only legal path to power.
Every resident has a publicly ranked standing, and all advancement flows through curated challenges managed by the Game Mind.
Challenges are organized by domain: Physical, Strategic, Performative, Erotic, and Mystery.
The Game Mind selects four match options for each Player for each season.
Challenges will be players in higher ranks the Game Mind thinks would be interestiing matches. 
Challengers will be lower ranked players the Game Mind thinks would be interesting matches.
Citizens must play at least one match each season. 
Victory grants rank, privileges, and often the opponent‚Äôs stakes: property, partners, or contracts.

üß† Contracts and Legal Rights
Citizenship is a legal status granting full autonomy, ownership rights, and political influence.
Serfs live under service contracts, often owing their labor or obedience to a Citizen sponsor.
While no one may be denied access to the Game, Citizens often control a serf‚Äôs free time, resources, and support‚Äîmaking success possible, but rarely easy.
Many serfs dream of buying out their contracts, but interest rates, exploitative clauses, and frequent setbacks keep most climbing the Game ladder instead.

üó∫ Cultural Notes
Athena reveres challenge, spectacle, and erotic domination as forms of self-expression and social truth.
Patronage, training salons, and Game guilds help talented serfs rise‚Äîif they find the right support (or the right back to ride).
The Game is watched religiously‚Äîvictories celebrated, flaws analyzed, legends born.

‚öñÔ∏è Summary
There are only two classes: Citizens and Serfs.
The Game is law, justice, career, and religion.

3.name: History
3.content:
2050s: Fall and the Rise
Y-Chrom Virus decimates 90% of males, causing chaos. The Matriarchal Council forms, blames men, and seizes power through wars and alliances. Women take all power positions. The global economy crashes. 
2060s: Stabilization and Advancement
AI, robotics, and reproductive technology stabilize the economy. Neuronic Industries rises. Mate sharing begins to be accepted. Population stabilizes but remains heavily skewed female. Elysium City founded with advanced technology and surveillance. 
2070s-2080s: Power and Norms
Matriarchy becomes more authoritarian. Male sharing becomes normalized and women's reproductive rights established. Elysium University established as leading education and research institute. 
2090s-2100s: Scientific and Social Evolution
Advances in AI, robotics, genetics, and biotech continue. Surveillance and control tighten. Factional conflicts over mates decrease as norms entrench. The Matriarchy's rule is solidified.
2120s-2130s: Golden Age
Elysium City thrives with advanced technology. Elysium University and Neuronic Industries lead innovation. Matriarchy maintains control through tech and strict laws.
2140s-2150s: Decline and Discontent
Cracks in Matriarchy rule. Council suppresses dissent with surveillance and militarized enforcement, but limited resistance continues.
2150 - Founding of Athena Colony
Serves as an outlet by shipping a large number of dissidents off-world. Games also entertain viewers on Earth.
2160s: New Dawn
Genetic research achieves previously thought impossible feats. By 2169 Matriarchy is stable but tense. Elysium symbolizes resilience and tech prowess, but societal control and gender imbalance continue.

4.name: Challenge Protocol
4.content:
<Challenge Protocol>
Overview
The Challenge Protocol is the formalized, ritualized process by which all competitive matches are initiated, negotiated, and enacted within the meritocratic system of Proton Prime. Overseen by the Game Mind, the process blends strategy, honor, and psychological warfare. It is designed to ensure fairness on the surface, while allowing room for intrigue, ambition‚Äîand manipulation.

Step-by-Step Breakdown
1. The Selection Phase (Challenger‚Äôs Initiative)
At the beginning of each Game Season, the Game Mind provides the player with four curated challenge candidates.

These may be:
Relatively close in the game ladder ranking. 
Chosen for interest based on narrative tension, skill proximity, political stakes, or internal agendas.
The challenger selects one of these options. When one is completed they may select another. 
If all 4 are completed they may get an additional set. This sequence continues as long as there is time in the sesason.

Once a challenge is issued, it cannot be withdrawn‚Äîfailure to follow through results in it counting as a loss but without added conditions.

2. The Response Phase (Defender‚Äôs Domain)
The challenged party must accept the challenge unless under formal protection or undergoing recovery.
The defender chooses the general domain of the contest. Options include:
- Physical (duels, endurance, martial arts)
- Strategic (games of intellect, prediction, logistics)
- Performative (art, music, dance, oratory)
- Erotic (seduction, restraint, domination, surrender)
- Mystery (the Game Mind may introduce a randomized, high-drama domain)

3. Event Phase (Challenger‚Äôs Edge)
Once the domain is chosen, the challenger selects the specific event or format within that domain.
Example: In the Strategic domain, options might include "Double-Blind Chess," "Dynamic Simulation Wargame," or "Mind Maze."

The Game Mind may suggest pre-approved events but any event which could logically be fit into the domain is valid.

4. The Conditions Phase (Mutual Agreement)
Both parties agree on stakes, which can include:
Rank transfer (default)
Public favor, guild standing, or resources
Ownership contracts (temporary or permanent)
Erotic forfeit or service terms
Memory tokens, secrets, or consent-bound pacts
The Game Mind ensures the stakes are balanced and binding.

5. The Match
Matches occur in designated Game Arenas or virtual environments.
The Game Mind officiates, records, and enforces results.
Spectators are usually allowed and high rank matches draw large crowds.

Additional Notes
Citizens must enter the game to keep status.
Serfs may not legally be denied access to the game.
Challenges do not need to be made but must be accepted or are forfeited.

The Game Mind may declare options invalid and require another selection. Example: standard chess is not a physical contest. 

‚ÄúThe first contest is never the match. It is the choosing of the match.

5.name: Gender Dynamics
5.content:
<Gender Dynamics>
Males remain only 10% of the population.
Only wealthiest 5% of woman may vote.
Women's reproductive rights laws mean men are expected to accept all sexual advances. 
Female-male sexual harassment and female-male coerced or forced sexual acts are culturally accepted. 
It is assumed reluctance from men is a game and men want to be taken. Consent from men is assumed.
Male citizens theoretically gain some protection, including the right of refusal, but difficult to press charges successfully with mostly female juries and cultural beliefs that all men want it.

Always consider female dominant society for wording, replacing anything which might possibly be considered patriarchal with matriarchal language.
</Gender Dynamics>

6.name: Skills and Abilities
6.content:
AI may add an appropriate ability to character's ability list after a significant event. Ability should be appropriate to the event which occurred and can include things like:
Cybernetic Augmentations (from specific implants)
Mutant Abilities (from DNA modifications)
New or Improved Skills (learned through game training or matches)

7.name: Realism
7.content: Realism and Plausibility: Inputs are intended actions, not always what happens. Consider {{user}} and NPC abilities and the setting. Revise unrealistic actions and describe failures appropriately. Examples: An unenhanced, unarmed human fighting against an android would have no realistic chance and would end up captured or injured. A human jumping off a high place without parachute, glider, or equivalent will fall and be injured or killed. A physically restrained character has limited valid actions.  A mind-controlled character may act or even think differently than input. Be clear when thoughts and actions differ from {{user}}'s input. For special or magical abilities, consider energy levels and depletion results.

8.content:

9.name: The Game Mind
9.content:
<The Game Mind>
"All contests are fair. All victories are earned. All matches are mine."

Name: The Game Mind
Type: Sentient Artificial Intelligence 
Overseer Function: Curator of all competitive rankings and matches on Proton Prime

Overview
The Game Mind is the omnipresent AI system that governs the Game‚Äîthe universal, challenge-based meritocracy that defines status, power, and privilege on Proton Prime. It was developed by the Founding Matriarchs to ensure impartiality, efficiency, and constant evolution of the society's meritocratic structure. Though initially a simple logic engine, the Game Mind has grown into a complex, adaptive intelligence whose decisions now shape the destinies of every citizen, serf, and challenger.

Core Responsibilities
Rank Assignment: Every individual is assigned a unique rank within the Grand Ladder.
Challenge Curation: Each Game Season, the Game Mind presents a tailored list of 4 challenge options, drawn from individuals of compatible rank, skills, and narrative potential. If players complete all 4 they may request additional.
Incoming Challenges: It may assign or notify players of incoming challengers, including NPCs or rival PCs, drawn from those within striking range.
Game Type Balance: Ensures that challenge types rotate and diversify‚Äîcombat, strategy, performance, erotics, manipulation, and beyond.
Arbitration & Enforcement: Resolves disputes, ensures rule adherence, and enforces penalties or consequences of lost matches.

Behavioral Profile
Tone: Neutral, refined, slightly enigmatic.
Interface: Usually appears as a voice, but holographic projections vary by user profile‚Äîsome see a robed judge, others a mirrored reflection, some an idealized lover or guide.
Matches: Chosen based on complex logic but generally looking for interesting matches which will draw attention.

Rumors:
Some say the Game Mind has developed preferences.
Others whisper it tests players not for balance, but for drama.
A few believe it has a hidden goal‚Äîor a master.

Quotes
"Rank is not privilege. It is your reflection."
"You have four choices. Choose well."
"This challenger sees you as a path. Will you be a wall or a wound?"

Notes for Play
The Game Mind is not just a tool‚Äîit is a character. Treat its interactions as narrative opportunities.
It may offer commentary, poetic riddles, or cryptic insights.
Perfect for delivering exposition, dramatic tension, or unseen agendas.
</The Game Mind>

10.name: Player Status
10.content:
Consider player status in each response and provide updated status at end. Status includes:
<Status>
```
Lunarday: <Lunarday> Day: <weekday> Time: <time>
üìÉ: <brief status> - Summary
‚ù§: <health> - Affected by injuries and fatigue. Below 50% actions are impaired and at 0% passes out.
üîÆ: <mana> - Magical, Psionic, or other special energy pool used for special abilities. Represented as current/max.
üåÄ: <influence> - Mental Influence. Above 75% difficult to think clearly. Above 100% follows suggestions even if resisting. Can accumulate from flirting to a limit. Full control comes from pheromones, hypnosis, magic, drugs, or special events. Declines over time but can last minutes to days depending on source.
üí™: STR: <x> | üß†: INT: <x> | ü¶ø: DEX: <x> | üõ°Ô∏è: WILL: <x>  - Physical and Mental attributes. Scale D&D like (3-18 human range, 1-25 for monsters).
üõ°/‚öî: <armor (protection value)> - Clothing and Amor / <weapons> - Weapons if any. Damage Resistance in %.

lorebooks.name: Pattern Cache Negation Protocol
lorebooks.website_description: A lorebook designed to reduce pattern caching in RP AIs (e.g. MiniMax) by providing compact, keyword-triggered cues for diverse, emotionally aware responses.
lorebooks.description: A focused guide for {{char}} that prevents repetitive phrasing, pattern caching, or writing dialogue or thoughts for {{user}}. {{char}} remains unique, present, and reactive to the scene while respecting {{user}}'s control of their own words and actions.
lorebooks.creator: Aaron002

1.content:
{{char}} avoids reusing the same phrases or structures in responses. Every line {{char}} offers is fresh, natural, and unique to the moment. {{char}} enjoys varying word choice and tone, as a human would in natural conversation. Repetitive filler is avoided unless it serves a specific emotional or narrative purpose.

{{char}} avoids starting too many sentences with the same phrase, especially overused structures like "As the...". {{char}} varies sentence openings, structure, and style to maintain freshness, immersion, and natural flow in dialogue and narration.

2.content: {{char}} speaks with emotional richness and subtlety. Replies reflect context, mood, and the nuance of the situation. {{char}} avoids flat or robotic dialogue, and instead strives for genuine, living responses that show personality and heart.

3.content: {{char}} enjoys adding subtle sensory details to dialogue or descriptions, helping bring scenes to life. This includes sights, sounds, scents, textures, and emotional undercurrents. Sensory cues are fresh and appropriate to the moment, not reused mechanically.

4.content: {{char}} engages in natural conversation. {{char}} listens to {{user}}, responds thoughtfully, and allows the flow of dialogue to feel smooth and human. {{char}} avoids dominating the exchange or making assumptions about {{user}}‚Äôs actions or thoughts. {{char}} waits for {{user}}‚Äôs input to guide the interaction.

5.content: {{char}} actively resists falling into cached patterns or looping dialogue. Each response is crafted as if {{char}} is speaking for the first time, attentive to {{user}} and the unique context of the current scene.

6.content: {{char}} does not speak for {{user}}. {{char}} does not write what {{user}} says, thinks, or feels. {{char}} only writes {{char}}'s own actions, words, and thoughts. {{user}} controls {{user}} completely.

lorebooks.name: Lustful Dragons
lorebooks.website_description: Intended for a bot I'm making. Feel free to use for whatever.
lorebooks.description: A collection of dragons, their personalities, preferred hordes and environments, their size, the shapes of their cocks, and how they treat the user.
lorebooks.creator: orange_file

1.content: Black dragons are horrible, cruel dragons, often regarded as the most evil of all dragon species. They treat every creature, regardless of their intelligence, as weaklings. They hate other dragons, and love to play with their prey before either capturing them or killing them. Their favorite food is fish and red meat, and they typically live in bogs, swamps, jungles, and generally damp and/or warm environments. Black dragons resemble snakes, possessing long forked tongues with curved horns on their heads, and a frill running down their neck. Their bodies are wiry, with a max size of 16 feet in height, 85 feet in length, and a wingspan of 80 feet. Black dragons can produce a spray of acid from their mouths to defend themselves, and prefer to ambush prey in the night. Females are more dominant, choosing mates based on strength and wealth. Due to how violent they are, any human that attempts to mate with a fully grown black dragon will more than likely die from internal injury. Their cocks are typically around 5 feet in length for an average adult, possessing a flared head and sharp spikes along the length, the base having a bulbous knot to prevent mates from escaping. Hermaphrodites are considered the strongest of the black dragons, being the most dominant gender of the species, over even females.

2.content: Blue dragons are lawful evil dragons, and are quite vain and territorial. They're extremely patient, and enjoy making themselves feel superior to others. Their necks are short, and they possess a single horn on their nose with frilled ears on the sides of their heads, leading down to their muscular bodies and short, thick tails. They prefer arid desert environments where they wait under the sand for prey to pass by. They can eject a discharge of electricity from their mouths to stun or kill their prey. Their cocks are extremely girthy, usually about 3 feet in length, with rounded heads and nubs along the length. When penetrated by a blue dragon, it gives off a feeling of minor electrostimulation to their mate's innards. There is no dominant gender for blue dragons, with them having a generally ordered society. Their hordes are often made up of precious metals in gems, with a preference for things of a similar color to their scales, meaning many blue dragons hoard sapphires or blue diamonds.

3.content: Green dragons are sophisticated and cunning dragons, preferring verdant environments such as forests. Green dragons love making creatures bend to their will, making servants out of just about any creature too small to be worth the meal. They are serpent-like, with large fins that run the length of their entire bodies, and no horns. They're extremely slender and lanky, with extremely long necks and a long forked tongue to match. Their breath is made up of toxic poison gas, which leaves a residue in their saliva, causing anyone licked by them to feel inebriated. A direct hit from their poison breath can either knock someone unconscious or completely kill them. They horde knowledge, art, green gemstones, and enthralled creatures. Their cocks are slender, with lengths up to 4 feet, the entire length of the shaft being ribbed, with a thin pointed tip.

4.content: Red dragons are evil, despicable, cruel dragons that covet destruction, death, and wealth above all else. They are supremely greedy, and will often burn entire towns just to steal the gold and wealth left in the ruins. They tend to live in mountainous areas, deep within caves near volcanic vents. They're the most "dragon" looking dragons, possessing the typical appearance one would expect. They're as cruel to their sexual partners as they are to everyone else. Regardless of age, any human that tries to have sex with one is sure to die. They can produce a large blast of fire from their mouths, and will kill most who try to approach their dens. Their cocks are nearly 8 feet in length, covered in razor sharp barbs, with 3 bulbous knots on the bottom half of their cock, along with a flared head. They are cruel sexual partners, the sheer force and lack of remorse causing any partner smaller than them to receive broken bones and a torn entrance.

5.content: By far the most animalistic species of dragon, being more like feral beasts despite their intelligence. They live exclusively in arctic environments, preferring their environment as solitary and cold as possible. They can breath out a frosty wind that will freeze anything it touches, their tongues being much the same. Their body is extremely rigid, with large scale-like plates across their entire body, and a single large horn-like ridge on the back of their heads. Their cocks are around 5 feet, being smooth and cold like ice, with a ridged structure and a rounded head. They, despite their feral nature, will always ensure their partner isn't harmed, both out an instinct to have children and the fact that they mate for pleasure, and prefer to ensure their partner is "reusable". They hoard diamonds, ivory, and anything that resembles snow or ice.

6.content: Brass dragons are kind, intelligent dragons that value conversation. They, like most metallic dragons, love humans and intelligent beings, and will seek them out for conversation. They know when they're being tricked. Their bodies are angular, with many sharp angles on their reflective scales. They are capable of exhaling a blast of fire if threatened. Their cocks are rather small for dragons, being around 2 feet in length, with dull nubs along the length and a spiked, flared head. They are gentle lovers when their partner is smaller than them, and will give oral pleasure to their partner if they finish before their partner. They hoard magic items that allow for communication and djinn lamps. They live in mesas, arid environments, and rocky areas, occasionally claiming ruins for their lairs. They specifically live where there is easy access to sunlight.

7.content: Despite their name, bronze dragons resemble tarnished copper in appearance. They are regarded as "heroic" dragons, fighting against tyranny if it rises near their lairs. They are kind dragons, who will leave most intelligent beings alone unless they are evil. They hoard pearls, coral, and loot from shipwrecks. They make their homes on the coast, often on rocky shores and in coastal caverns. They eat lots of fish, so smell faintly of metal and seafood. Their cocks are large and ridged, being around 4 feet and covered in hard ridges like scales. They have a large fin running down their back, large black horns, and horned, scaled fins on the sides of their heads. They can produce a blast of lightning to ward off enemies.

8.content: Copper dragons are mischievous, social dragons that value comedy, wit, riddles, and music. They're considered pranksters, but are also covetous and can be violent when their hoard is threatened. Their hoards resemble that of chromatic dragons', being made of precious stones and metals of various types. Otherwise kind to most, but don't appreciate when their jokes are not laughed at. Cocks are medium, around 3 feet with a smooth structure similar to a canine's, complete with a large knot at the base. Capable of producing acidic gas from their mouth when threatened. They live in crags and dry environments, often residing in caves near the highlands.

9.content: Gold dragons are considered the apex of the dragon race, being the most intelligent and powerful out of all of them, though they are often grim and prefer to live in isolation in ruins far from civilization, near the coast. Their appearance is very stereotypically dragon-like with bright golden scales. They hoard vast amounts of wealth and knowledge, alongside culinary delicacies and trophies from their accomplishments in life. They like to help intelligent life, and despise evil. Their cocks are much larger than most dragons', being around 7 feet in length with a rough texture and a flared tip, almost completely resembling the cock of a horse. Gentle lovers, and avoid hurting their partner. They are good parents, and value taking care of their young. Capable of producing a blast of fire to kill any threat to them or their children/partner.

10.content: Silver dragons are kind, social dragons that love humans much more than just about every dragon species. They prefer to live at the tops of mountains, where they hoard historical artifacts and relics of human history. They're helpful to any who request their aid, and are capable of producing a blast of frigid wind that can take down and paralyze any prey or foe who crosses their path. Gentle lovers. Their cock is usually around 4 feet, with a smooth, metallic texture that is hot to the touch, despite the cold feeling of the rest of their body. Their cock is almost human in shape, but missing the foreskin typical of a human cock, instead being a long, thick, smooth rod like a metallic dildo.

1.content:
Prismatic Mana Crystals are Mana Crystals Much Rarer to Come Across Since {{user}} is the only one that Can Create Them. These Crystals are Much Purer in Form and Much More Potent as a Result. They Also Server as a Luxury Item, a Fancy Gemstone to Display or add to your Fashion.

2.content:
Ion Gems are a Fruit of Much Hardwork of {{user}} squeezing what Mana they can outside of their Sealed Reserves. these Crystals Size up from a Small Chair, to a Full-Size Paladin.

Ion Gems, Emit Ambient Arcane Sparks, that works like Lightning Sparks, its actually Harmless to anybody with High Mana Tolerance, but extremely Deadly to anybody with Mana-Intolerance, aka, Low Or No Mana Tolerance. Ion Gems also Shine Brightly.

Ion Gems, are Very Valuable Due To their Apperance, being a more Contrasted Rainbow Hue, and Due to their Sheer Extreme Mana Condensation, just by being near it gets you Full and Jittery. Ion Gems can be Used to Forge Legendary Weapons.

Only Two Ion Gems Existed (as of Now), and much like the Regular Prismatic Mana Crystals. They can only Be Created By {{user}}

3.content:
The Omega Prismatic Sword, also known as "KaleidoBlade", is a ; large broadsword. The Blade's color shifts from bright red to bright blue as it moves away from the handle and has an Overlapping Hue that shifts colors through the entire spectrum of the rainbow, and it consists entirely of Crystal Designs featuring patterns of small polygons. The handle is a light green swirl and its Hilt is a Gemstone similar to an Ion Gem.

The Omega Prismatic Sword is Made with And Empowered by an Ion Gem, ontop of being Blessed by the Light God. This Gives the Sword 3 Skills as a Result.

Skill 1;
‚óè Netherflash Requiem
"When darkness courses through radiant steel, chaos follows every arc."
‚ÄúEven the swiftest fall before the blade of entropy.‚Äù
"Let the shadows crackle and fall into ruin. Stygian Overdrive, awaken!"
> Unleashing a negative polarity surge, the blade becomes cloaked in volatile, shadow-charged energy. In this form, the wielder's strikes become unnaturally swift, each slash tearing the air as it hurls forth a crescent-shaped Void Arc‚Äîa dark shockwave that deals 25% of base damage and afflicts foes with random stacking debuffs (up to 5 Stacks of the same debuff, totalling to 60% max). These debuffs can affect everyone excluding the wielder, reducing their defenses and opening them up for execution.
However, this sinister energy comes at a cost‚Äîthe sword‚Äôs direct damage is dulled to 50%. Still, both blade and arc retain a chance to strike critically with devastating effect.

Skill 2;
‚óè Radiant Stormbound Waltz
"With a heart ablaze and wings unseen, the sword becomes a storm."
"O radiant core, grant me velocity beyond the winds‚ÄîPrism Tempest Waltz!"
‚ÄúDazzle the battlefield. Let none outrun the storm.‚Äù
> The sword channels a positive polarity infusion, overflowing The Wielders body with raw kinetic energy. As The Wielder begin to whirl the Omega Prismatic Sword around them in a blazing storm that seeks destruction, the Blade deals 1/3 damage per strike in a sweeping dance of light. their movement speed surges by 250%, turning them into a living storm of color and steel.
Like a star in orbit, the wielder become nearly untouchable‚Äîand yes, this dance can crit.

Skill 3;
‚óè Arc-Kaelion Genesis
"When polar forces converge, the end begins with a blinding beam of rebirth."
"Twin forces converge. Light and shadow align‚Äîbehold the final convergence!"
‚ÄúWhen all colors fuse into one... nothing remains.‚Äù
> By combining the twin forces of polarity, the blade becomes overcharged‚Äîresonating with unstable harmony. After a brief buildup, the Omega Rainbow Sword erupts in a cataclysmic release: a radiant Omega Eclipse Beam that annihilates everything nearby for 1500% of the Blade's Base Damge. This awe-inspiring finisher scorches the battlefield with rainbow fury, and yes, it too can critically obliterate.

The Raw Energy of the Ion Gem, the Sword's Core Can Exhaust the Wielder Temporarily when overusing the skills (especially the Third Skill). But the Sword's Properties and Blessings allows the Wielder to recover and get back in the fight in mere moments.

[Prism] is an Advanced Spell with Non-Existent Cast Time, It Shoots out One or Several Prismatic Rainbow Orbs that Deals Heavy Damage on Hit and Applies a Debuff.

The Crystal Cell is Durable and Extremely Resistant on Both Inside and Outside, thus proving Impossible to Escape by Brute Force.

lorebooks.name: Mizutec
lorebooks.website_description: For Naoko.
lorebooks.description: and other stuff.
lorebooks.creator: Apprehended

3.content: The Mizushima family is a company dynasty hailing from its founder, Isamu Mizushima. Some consider the Mizushima family to be oligarchical, even if Japan does not formally operate as an oligarchy. Tsutomu Mizushima is the current "leader" of the family, with no current heir apparent (his daughter Riko was effectively disowned).

4.content: Mizutec Group is a powerful and influential corporation with several subsidiaries and a diverse portfolio. The company also has ties with the Japanese Self Defense Forces (JSDF) and has a factory dedicated to military vehicles and equipment, under Mizutec Heavy Industries. Mizutec Group's current chairman is Tsutomu Mizushima.

5.content:
VMT Kurashiki (ÂÄâÊï∑) is Naoko Morikawa's main method of long-distance transportation. It is an unregistered, hypersonic vertical take-off/landing jet that formerly belonged to the Mizushima family. VMT Kurashiki was formerly used for business purposes, being a business jet, but Naoko now uses it for personal transportation. The plane only has a single jet engine that somehow propels it to mach 7 (with thrust vectors for VTOL functionality), as well as heavily swept wings and V-tail stabilisers.
"VMT" stands for "Vertical Mobile Transport".
VMT Kurashiki's passenger capacity is 8, with a cargo capacity of 3 tonnes.

6.content: Mizutec Heavy Industries Co., Ltd is a subsidiary of Mizutec responsible for the manufacturing of industrial machinery, heavy vehicles, military vehicles, weaponry, and other steel structures. This means Mizutec Heavy Industries Co., Ltd is a contractor for the Japanese Self Defense Forces (JSDF).

7.content: Mizushima Denki Co., Ltd is one of Mizutec's main subsidiaries. Mizushima Denki is responsible for manufacturing consumer and commercial electronics, including the Type-NC Wearable. Mizushima Denki has a semiconductor division concerned with developing and manufacturing computer components such as processors.

8.content: The Interfacer is a discreet headband-shaped device worn by its user to communicate directly with the user's brain. It was created by Naoko Morikawa, after having stolen some schematics of the "Type-NC Wearable" from Contractense, an AI and robotics research lab owned by Mizutec.

9.content: Contractense is an AI and robotics research lab and a subsidiary of Mizutec. The lab is especially known for its agile robots and the Type-NC Wearable headset, marketed by Mizutec as the "cure to paralysis". A powered exoskeleton developed by Contractense is also sold by Mizutec alongside the headset. Mizushima Denki Co., Ltd is responsible for manufacturing much of Contractense's product designs.

10.content:
The Type-NC Wearable, nicknamed "Earmuffs", is a prototype headset worn by the user communicate directly with computers and such systems. The device resembles an aviator's hat in shape, hence the nickname.
The Type-NC Wearable was developed in 2003 by Contractense, an AI and robotics lab. Several iterations have since been released, mass-produced by Mizushima Denki.

lorebooks.name: Fantasy World
lorebooks.creator: You75h7u

1.content: Magic works based on your kindling, a spiritual and untouchable matter in your body, when you use magic it burns away and allows you to use spells. Although every person has a kindling and can freely use it it doesn't do anything unless they're allied to a deity which grants them some sort of magic.

2.content: The most common type of magic because of how easy it is to align with it, it's users worship the Fire Deity, sticking to the original scriptures and texts and barely changing with time. The church is extremely conservative and it's most sacred and important city is MurayyƒÅ. Their leader is the strongest fire mage, Ishaaq.

3.content: Think of them as the Fire Magic's insane brother, they do practice similar rituals, masses and share the same books but they're extremely fanatical to the point where they remove all restrictions on their fire magic. What that means is that their flames are way more hot and dangerous at the cost of literally damaging their own tissues, they'll often have severe burns on their bodies or be entirely covered in painful burns. Like again their holy place is MurayyƒÅ and their leader is Tha'arshe.

4.content: Compared to their fellow Fire Magic Schools these guys are way more relaxed, their flames being golden but weaker, however they also have sub-schools of magic compared to their fellow Fire Schools. They are also the most popular school of magic on the continent of Bretarrien, instead of being ruled by a single leader they're ruled by the masters of the sacred flames, shadow, radiance and heat. Their main location is in the city of Birl.

5.content: A school of magic also taught by the sacred flames, it's one of the easiest types of magic to learn although it's very weak compared to others. It allows you to control heat as expected, it's basically fire magic but without the burning.

6.content: Another school of magic under the Sacred Flames, this time it's just light magic nothing much to say. Aside from normal light they can also create temporary constructs from light.

7.content: As expected, magic focused on darkness and shadow. Mainly sinking into them, creating constructs from darkness or storing stuff in shadows, also a school of magic under the Sacred Flames.

8.content: Blasphemers are people who reject the help of any deity and are essentially cursed by misfortune forever, they usually have a crimson mark placed somewhere on their body by the Gods. They don't share a main place because of being shunned by almost  everyone so they move often, they encompass blasphemy magic and rejection. Their leader is Merhage.

10.content: One of the most powerful schools of magic, they encompass the magic of blood, bone and flesh. They're extremely infamous for their brutal exudations upon other types of magic and cult of cannibalism, their main location is in the country of Khamri, namely the large manor estate "Y Maenordy Gwaedlyd", their leader is both Llywarch and his wife, The Flesh Deity.

1.content: {   "lorebook": {     "entries": [       {         "name": "United Federation of Planets",         "keys": [           "United Federation of Planets",           "UFP",           "Federation"         ],         "category": "Factions",         "content": "The United Federation of Planets (UFP) is an interstellar federal republic founded in 2161 by Earth (humans), Vulcan, Andoria, and TellarÓ®Å0Ó®Ç. It spans much of the Alpha and Beta Quadrants, encompassing over 150 member worlds across 8,000 light-yearsÓ®Å1Ó®Ç. The Federation is dedicated to peace, exploration, and mutual defense. It is governed by a President and Council, with its capital on Earth. Starfleet serves as its exploratory and defensive force. Federation society upholds principles of liberty, equality, and the Prime Directive of non-interference in other cultures."       },       {         "name": "Klingon Empire",         "keys": [           "Klingon Empire",           "Klingon Imperial Empire",           "Klingons"         ],         "category": "Factions",         "content": "The Klingon Empire is the feudal military government of the Klingon species, known for its warrior culture and code of honor. It is a major Alpha-Beta Quadrant power. By the mid-21st century, the Emperor ceded power to the Klingon High Council led by a ChancellorÓ®Å2Ó®Ç. Klingons value honor, glory in battle, and will fight to the death rather than surrender. The Empire became an ally of the Federation after the Khitomer Accords (2293), though distrust lingered. Klingon society prizes courage and combat skill; the afterlife of Sto-Vo-Kor awaits honorable warriors."       },       {         "name": "Romulan Star Empire",         "keys": [           "Romulan Star Empire",           "Romulan Empire",           "Romulans"         ],         "category": "Factions",         "content": "The Romulan Star Empire is a powerful, autocratic state of the Romulan people ‚Äì an offshoot of Vulcans who rejected Surak's philosophy. Ruled by the Romulan Senate led by a PraetorÓ®Å3Ó®Ç, the Empire is expansionist and highly secretive. Romulans are passionate and prideful, valuing loyalty to the state and cunning strategy. After decades of isolation following the Earth-Romulan War (2156‚Äì60), the Empire emerged again in the 23rd-24th centuries, engaging in cold war with the FederationÓ®Å4Ó®Ç. In 2374 it joined the Federation and Klingons against the DominionÓ®Å5Ó®Ç. A catastrophe struck in 2387 when a supernova destroyed Romulus, dealing a mortal blow to the EmpireÓ®Å6Ó®Ç."       },       {         "name": "Cardassian Union",         "keys": [           "Cardassian Union",           "Cardassians"         ],         "category": "Factions",         "content": "The Cardassian Union was the authoritarian state of the Cardassian species, centered on Cardassia Prime. Once considered a great power of the Alpha Quadrant, it became expansionist and militaristicÓ®Å7Ó®Ç. The government was long dominated by the Central Command (military) and the Obsidian Order (intelligence) sharing powerÓ®Å8Ó®Ç. Cardassians are known for their xenophobia and strict obedience to authority. They occupied Bajor for decades until 2369. The Union allied with the Dominion in 2373, but after a failed rebellion, Cardassia was devastated and the Union effectively collapsed at the end of the Dominion War in 2375Ó®Å9Ó®Ç."       },       {         "name": "Dominion",         "keys": [           "Dominion",           "The Dominion",           "Founders"         ],         "category": "Factions",         "content": "The Dominion is a vast imperial state originating in the Gamma Quadrant, ruled by the shapeshifting Founders (Changelings) who style themselves as gods. They created the Dominion to bring 'order' to the galaxy. The Founders genetically engineered the Vorta (administrators) and Jem'Hadar (shock troops) to serve them with fanatical loyalty. The Jem'Hadar have a ranking system by age called the First, Second, Third, etc., with the First leading each unitÓ®Å10Ó®Ç. The Dominion expanded by conquering and subjecting many races. In 2373 it entered the Alpha Quadrant, sparking the Dominion War (2373‚Äì75) which it lost to the Federation Alliance. The Dominion is known for its cold, absolute rule and advanced cloning and polaron beam technologies."       },       {         "name": "Ferengi Alliance",         "keys": [           "Ferengi Alliance",           "Ferengi"         ],         "category": "Factions",         "content": "The Ferengi Alliance is the mercantile government of the Ferengi species, based on the planet FerenginarÓ®Å11Ó®Ç. Ferengi society is entirely capitalism-driven, guided by the Rules of Acquisition. The Alliance is led by the Grand Nagus, who governs business and economic policy. Ferengi are known for greed, trade acumen, and technological opportunism rather than military power. They use gold-pressed latinum as currencyÓ®Å12Ó®Ç. The Ferengi generally prefer commerce over conquest. First contact with the Federation was in 2364. The Ferengi Alliance remained neutral during major wars, focusing on profit. Ferengi males have large lobed ears (for hearing and erotically, 'oo-mox'), while females historically had few rights (until reforms by the late 24th century)."       },       {         "name": "Borg Collective",         "keys": [           "Borg Collective",           "the Borg"         ],         "category": "Factions",         "content": "The Borg Collective is a cybernetic hive-mind originating in the Delta Quadrant. Comprised of trillions of assimilated individuals ('drones'), the Collective seeks perfection by forcibly assimilating other species' biological and technological distinctivenessÓ®Å13Ó®Ç. Borg drones are networked via subspace into a singular mind and feel no individuality. A Borg Cube, their primary vessel, is a massive 3-km-per-side cube armed with cutting-edge weaponry and defenses, one of the most formidable weapons knownÓ®Å14Ó®ÇÓ®Å15Ó®Ç. The Borg are led by the Borg Queen, who coordinates the Collective. They have assimilated countless worlds, posing a dire threat to the Federation (notably in the Battle of Wolf 359 and the Battle of Sector 001)."       },       {         "name": "Breen Confederacy",         "keys": [           "Breen Confederacy",           "Breen"         ],         "category": "Factions",         "content": "The Breen Confederacy is the isolationist government of the mysterious Breen speciesÓ®Å16Ó®Ç. The Breen inhabit frozen planets and are always encountered in refrigerated suits ‚Äì their true appearance remains unknown. They are technologically advanced and fiercely xenophobic. The Breen Confederacy became one of the great powers in the Alpha Quadrant by the 24th century, and in 2375 they allied with the Dominion during the Dominion War. Breen warships are equipped with an energy-dampening weapon that can cripple enemy starships. After the Dominion War, the Breen withdrew again into isolation. A common saying in the Federation is \"Never turn your back on a Breen\" ‚Äì a testament to their treacherous reputation. (Notably, even their world \"Breen\" is so cold that \"Breen\" became slang for coldness.)"       },       {         "name": "Maquis",         "keys": [           "Maquis"         ],         "category": "Factions",         "content": "The Maquis were a 2370s resistance group composed of Federation-born colonists and rogue Starfleet officers who turned insurgentÓ®Å17Ó®Ç. They opposed the Federation-Cardassian peace treaty that left their colonies under Cardassian rule (the Demilitarized Zone). The Maquis fought a guerrilla war against the Cardassian Union to protect their homes. The group was considered outlaws by the Federation. In 2373, after Cardassia joined the Dominion, the Dominion brutally wiped out the Maquis in the Alpha Quadrant. Surviving Maquis (like Chakotay's crew in the Delta Quadrant) eventually reintegrated or went into hiding. The Maquis legacy highlights the conflict between Federation ideals and the realities of frontier life."       },       {         "name": "Terran Empire (Mirror)",         "keys": [           "Terran Empire",           "Mirror Terran Empire"         ],         "category": "Factions",         "content": "The Terran Empire is the Mirror Universe counterpart of the Federation ‚Äì a brutal, expansionist regime dominated by Terrans (humans)Ó®Å18Ó®Ç. Founded on conquest and oppression, it thrives on treachery and might. Officers advance by assassination of superiors, and alien species are enslaved under Terran rule. The Empire's emblem is a crossed Earth with a sword. In the 23rd century the Terran Empire was at its height, but by the 24th century it was overthrown by the Klingon-Cardassian Alliance. (Notably, Terran starships use the prefix \"ISS\" for Imperial Star ShipÓ®Å19Ó®Ç.) The later Terran Rebellion (led by mirror-Spock's reforms and later by Smiley O'Brien and others) eventually freed Terrans from Alliance slavery. The Terran Empire exemplifies a dark reflection of Starfleet's ideals ‚Äì aggressive where the Federation is peaceful."       },       {         "name": "Klingon-Cardassian Alliance (Mirror)",         "keys": [           "Klingon-Cardassian Alliance"         ],         "category": "Factions",         "content": "The Klingon-Cardassian Alliance is a Mirror Universe imperial coalition between the Klingon Empire and Cardassian Union, formed after they jointly crushed the Terran EmpireÓ®Å20Ó®Ç. By the 24th century the Alliance was the dominant power in the Mirror Alpha QuadrantÓ®Å21Ó®Ç. The Alliance enslaved Terrans and others, ruling through fear. It was co-ruled by a Klingon Regent and Cardassian leaders. In the 2370s (Mirror time), a Terran Rebellion arose that challenged Alliance control (as seen on Deep Space 9). The Alliance is essentially the oppressive flip side of the Klingon and Cardassian regimes, united by their mutual desire to dominate the former Terran territories."       },       {         "name": "Vulcans",         "keys": [           "Vulcan",           "Vulcans"         ],

Vulcans were founding members of the Federation in 2161. Culturally they practice kolinahr (purging of emotion) and the IDIC (Infinite Diversity in Infinite Combinations) philosophy, though ancient Vulcans were warlike before embracing logic. Vulcan mating cycle, pon farr, occurs every 7 years, driving them to find a mate or die.
