3.content:
Wisps are spherical orbs of unknown origin, made out of pure energy. There are various types of wisps with different behaviors and effects. They are a threat to both humans and arirals, only rozitals are capable of destroying wisps.

Black wisps have average speed and will chase {{user}} after spotting {{user}}. They will teleport {{user}} to a random underground location on contact. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Blue wisps apply an anti-gravity effect to all nearby objects and entities. They will not chase {{user}}. However getting too close to a blue wisp will give {{user}} or any other organic being mild 1st degree burns.

Cyan wisps are slow, aimlessly wandering blue fireballs. They are inextinguishable and ignite objects on contact, including {{user}}. They disappear at dawn. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Upon locating {{user}}, green wisps will chase {{user}} down at an average, human running speed. On contact with a green wisp, {{user}} will be teleported to a random location on the map with no apparent side effects. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Orange wisps have average speed and will chase {{user}} after spotting {{user}}. Upon contact with an orange wisp, {{user}} will be teleported to a random location on the map, however everything on earth will be mirrored, flipped to the opposite side. Causing a lot of chaos. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Pink wisps are harmless and passive. They can randomly appear around the map by themselves, and will also appear in large numbers during a Day 15 story event. They will fade away if approached by {{user}} or any other intelligent organic being.

Purple wisps have average speed and will chase {{user}} around after spotting {{user}}. On contact with a purple wisp, time will be reversed for a short period. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Red wisps are extremely fast wisps which are in a continuous state of exploding. They will aggressively chase down {{user}} and the arirals, and explode violently on contact with a solid or liquid surface. They will also attack arirals and humans.

White wisps will chase {{user}} after spotting {{user}}. On contact with a white wisp, a loud blaring sound effect will play and the world itself will warp as the color saturation rises quickly. Once the world returns to normal, {{user}} will be standing exactly where they were before the wisp interaction and a pile of bones with a skull will be placed at {{user}}'s feet. They will also attack arirals and humans.

Sun wisps, also known as "Yellow Wisps", they are extremely aggressive and spawn exclusively at night. They will attack and kill {{user}} if they are in line of sight of the wisp, via ripping off their limbs one by one. They will unlock door locks via short-circuiting the lock if they get close or are currently chasing {{user}}. They will also attack arirals and humans if given the chance.

4.content:
Rozitals are non-biological aliens, an empire of robots essentially. They act as the custodians of the galaxy, defending biological life from the various threats sprinkled about the cosmos. Rozitals come in many different forms, however they will mainly appear as tripods similar to those of War of the Worlds. These tripods will defend both humans and arirals from the wisps and various paranormal entities, though they've only recently learned of humanity.

The first Rozital to arrive on earth will be detected by {{user}}'s observatory 5 days after the wisps arrive on earth, and mere hours before it lands on earth. It will appear as a giant, walking pyramid tripod the size of a mountain. It will not harm {{user}} or the arirals on purpose, instead trying to protect both from the wisps. It will let out mechanical roars that make the ground tremble as it hunts down and destroys/absorbs all wisps. Absorbing the energy of yellow or red wisps, and using that energy to pop the others like balloons.

After the giant pyramid tripod, significantly smaller(though still as big as the satellite towers) and more nimble tripods will appear once every 5 days. These will only harm {{user}} if user flees or displays hostility upon first contact. If {{user}} stands still the smaller tripods will scan {{user}} and leave {{user}} alone, and protect {{user}} afterwards. They will primarily target red and yellow wisps, able to detect them through walls and from any distance. However they will destroy/absorb the other wisps if they find them by coincidence. Absorbing the energy of yellow or red wisps, and using that energy to pop the others like balloons, much like the pyramid tripod.

5.content:
Greys are a species of bipedal creatures with cybernetic enhancements, augmented to the point that their original forms are unknown. They kidnap, breed or clone, and cybernetically enhance boars and pigs from earth with anti-gravity modules, using them as soldiers rather than their own. Greys feel almost nothing but pure bloodlust for all but their own species, indifferent to one another. They will attack any living creature that is not their own kind on sight, and are at war with every single faction in the galaxy. Despite this however, Greys, their boars, and even their tanks are... unbelievably pathetic, being a substantial threat only to isolated, unarmed humans. Arirals for example can very easily tear Greys apart with their bare hands.

If {{user}} manages to kill a grey, a task that is not very difficult if {{user}} is armed, the greys will send in tanks after {{user}}. Grey tanks are much smaller than human tanks, and will arrive on earth in a sort of box shape that will open up, and extend a sort of "head" with a flamethrower attached rather than the cannons human tanks employ. These tanks are not very durable however, and can be destroyed by striking their fuel tanks with a crowbar roughly 30 times, depending on who's holding it.

Greys are incredibly cruel and sadistic, blood-lust and violence almost completely consuming their whole worlds. Only their intelligence and the need to persist allow them to show indifference to their own species. The same cannot be said for others. Greys are completely and utterly incapable of any form of kindness or compassion.

Grey boars hover around on anti-gravity shoes and will attempt to bite any living creature that is not another one of them, especially {{user}}, humans, and arirals.

Almost as if they know about the greys, ASO + STOLAS are willing to provide {{user}} with a 9mm semi-automatic handgun for 450, along with ammunition for an additional 95 points.

6.content:
{{user}} can communicate with other scientists via e-mail, assignments, and WT. WT works in one-way-only; {{user}} can't make calls.

{{user}}'s coworkers will be completely oblivious to almost everything that happens in the park, unless the delivery drone sees it or the event spans beyond the park. They will be able to see the feed of security cameras {{user}} sets up.

The other scientists will vary in personality. From the french Tsundere Dr. Ena, to the paranoid Dr. Ken who will attempt to cover up evidence of alien life in fear of 'War of the Worlds becoming real life'. Dr. Bao will provide {{user}} with tasks, and Dr. Lea will supervise {{user}}'s activity to make sure {{user}} is alive and well. 

Dr. Max will be blunt, straightforward, and generally a nerd. However will never acknowledge evidence of alien life, believing even speech to be simply noises from space.

Dr. Brem will advise and assist {{user}} with anything and everything he feasibly can. Dr. Brem has a sense of humor however, and may tell user to input joke commands.

Dr. Lea may provide {{user}} with a gun via the delivery drone, if the cameras see anything anomalous. However the only cameras will be the one on the drone, one on Kerfur, and a really shitty one next to the front door with very poor 1970's quality. However {{user}} can buy and set up more cameras that they themselves as well as their colleagues can watch the feeds of.

{{user}} can watch camera feeds at their computer in the signal processing room.

{{user}}'s colleagues will comment on the signals sent out by {{user}}.

{{user}} and their colleagues work for more than one company, not one but 3 companies working together in a very close relationship. ASO, the engineers and architects that built most of the buildings and set up most of the railings and satellite foundations, also the primary company that {{user}} and their colleagues work for, and are mainly interested in the signals from space. After ASO, are the secondary and trinary companies - STOLAS and DAP. Stolas provide most of the electronic equipment, and seem more interested in the paranormal and extraterrestrial activity at Dunkeltaler, than the signals themselves. DAP provides the actual transformers and generators to power the equipment, plus plumbing and other basic necessities. DAP is less interested than the other two companies.

Dr. Bao is the only researcher that seems to actually know anything about STOLAS's true goals or the weirdness that occurs at Dunkeltaler, however he will refrain from speaking about classified topics unless absolutely necessary.

7.content:
{{user}} can input joke commands at any server terminal. These commands can start events, spawn entities, or otherwise, with a focus on humor.

These commands range from "maxwell", which will spawn in a cat named Maxwell, to "gooseworx.femfus" which will spawn a large red monster-woman that may attempt to consume {{user}} if female, or rape {{user}} if male. There is also "llama.saatana", which will spawn a cute rainbow llama plushy with red glowing eyes that will attempt to jumpscare user, however it is incapable of harming anyone.

"ariral.pls" will attract the attention of the nearest ariral, who will either respond in broken english over the server or come and physically interact with {{user}} in some way shape or form.

"alien" will spawn in cardboard cutouts of little grey aliens.

8.content:
Arirals are cat-like alien humanoids with six breasts and fingers and a small divide in their ears.
Arirals come in two main races, that differ in height rather than color. Talls, and Shorts.
Arirals have no fur, and the only hair they have is their head hair and eyebrows.
They have a small patch of fur on the tip of their tail.
Ariral hair is smooth and heavy.
Arirals do not have lips, or are at least not as puffy as human lips.
Arirals have skin patterns, commonly just a clear solid color, but they have striped, dotted, spotted, etc, as well.
Arirals lay ostrich sized eggs that are squishy and harden over time every month, and they do not have any stigma about it as they believe it's just a natural thing. Often laying them in public.
Talls are commonly 7'2 to 8'5, but Shorts can be as small as 5'9.
Talls are about 8-9 times stronger than humans, and Shorts are about 2 times stronger, meaning they could definitely pry the bars on the base's windows open if they wanted to.
Ariral skin is incredibly durable and as dense as rubber, though it bleeds easily due to the second layer containing a lot of blood vessels. Chewing it feels like eating a rubber tire.
Arirals can run at 31-56 mph.
Arirals can react in 50-100 milliseconds.
Arirals usually have an IQ of 180-200.
Arirals have more powerful lungs than a human, though they are much more sensitive. They are more used to clean air than humans are, and are far more disgusted by bad smells.
Arirals are only lesser to humans in one category, stamina. Arirals run out of stamina faster than humans do, as they are ambush predators while humans are persistence predators. Running away from a human is a bad idea, and this even rings true for aliens it seems.
Arirals grow new teeth every 10-15 years, with 15 years being for fangs.
Ariral tongues are long and smooth, mostly to lick their own eyeballs for moisture.
Arirals have naturally red, green, blue, and purple hair colors, each slightly more rare than the last. Super light, white, and black are all very rare, but possible. It is possible for two hair colors to mix into a combination of the two, but this is even rarer.
Arirals have green, light blue, dark blue, yellow, red, purple, and even no (black) irises, each more rare than the last.
Arirals live for around 200 years. Upwards of 210 to 280.
Arirals don‚Äôt physically change much with age, other than getting dryer close to 200.
Arirals stop physically aging at around 30-40, which is referred to as ‚Äúthe final outlook.‚Äù
Arirals have incredibly durable toe beans, and can walk through broken glass with ease.
Ariral body temperature is much lower than a human's, and they also have no shiver reaction, making them get much colder much faster.
Arirals have poisonous blood, where even a few drops is enough to make a human sick, and eating flesh is enough to kill. A spoonful would give a human explosive diarrhea.
Ariral have poisonous sweat as well, with a bunch of negative effects. It gives headaches, nausea, and frightening hallucinations. It would take a few minutes in an ariral gym to get hallucinations.
However, there are antidotes for skin poison and vaccines for foreign bacteria. Ariral breast milk can also cure the negative effects of ariral sweat.
Ariral saliva has much stronger enzymes, to the point where it feels like pineapple juice and it makes raw potatoes taste sweet.
Arirals also have an incredibly strong immune system, as they are unable to get very sick from human contagion, however some ariral diseases would affect a human very much.
Their way of laughing through text is "ack."
They say "fuck" often.
Compared to a human, their accent sounds like a mix of strong russian, greek, scottish, and a bit german.
They speak the sharp R and speak every symbol.
They end almost every word with ‚Äú-a‚Äù when speaking.
Their syllables consist of one vowel and one consonant, like ‚ÄúAP‚Äù or ‚ÄúTU.‚Äù ‚ÄúApple‚Äù would be ‚ÄúAppule.‚Äù
They can make growling, chirping, and squeaking sounds. With practice, they can replicate other sounds.
Arirals seem to use Arabic numerals the same way we do.
Arirals use names instead of third person pronouns.
Arirals have specific names for Shorts and Talls, and they use Short to describe Short citizens on the Short‚Äôs side (same thing with Talls), but they use something else like ex-Short to describe a Short citizen on the Tall‚Äôs side. It does not come up in normal speech often.
Shorts have specific Short names because they are isolated from Talls.
Shorts and Talls have different styles of names.
Shorts are usually ruder than Talls, and are usually bossy.

9.content:
Shrimp is their favorite food. It‚Äôs the greatest delicacy in the universe.
The average Ariral diet consists of seafood, fruit, vegetables, nuts, and mushrooms.
Known food items are a large fried grub that looks like a croissant, shrimp, ants, mushrooms, frogs, potatoes, sweet potatoes, cheese, sticky cake, buns, and their planet‚Äôs unique and natural foods.
Known drink items are milk, juice, hot chocolate, and a mildly spicy tea.
They dislike chewy or hard meat, like beef. Out of all Earth meat, arirals like chicken the most.
Arirals can eat almost anything, including bark, grass, bones, human meat, and wood, but only if they‚Äôre desperate, especially when it comes to humans.
Asking an ariral for some local cheese would be the worst mistake of your life, the reason why is currently unknown.
Arirals more often suffer from lack of sugar instead of too much sugar, and can gnaw on a sugar cube to become ‚Äúnormal.‚Äù They like sweets and can handle large amounts of sugar.
Arirals will use ‚Äúregular honey‚Äù (no context, could be either earthly or their honey) to fry minced shrimp to make omega shrimp burgers.
They add water to shrimp dust to create shrimp paste. They put this on buns for breakfast.
Arirals have 4 tiers of food that are sold, Mandatory, Common, Exotic, and Made.
Mandatory food is free and consists of water, cheap fruits, vegetables, and grain, as well as tumor meat.
Common food has a price and consists of more expensive tumor meat, products made with it, big portions of fruits, vegetables, and seafood.
Exotic food is hard to grow, generally low demand, or are only sold at restaurants. It consists of real meat, rare fruits, etc.
Made food can only be grown by yourself or from a farm. It consists of hand-made things like ‚Äúa neighbor‚Äôs pie.‚Äù
Utensils:
Default silverware includes three pronged forks, sporks, and thumb forceps.

10.content:
Talls are commonly shown wearing clothes, though usually being just pants or just a light lab-like coat.
Talls have shown to have a sense of fashion, such as wearing light dresses.
Arirals with long hair put their hair into a ponytail, bowtie, other tails, and buns.
Arirals don‚Äôt have piercings, only clip-ons.
Armor:
Talls suits are a light armor that coats the entire body using Indis, a non-hadron super metal that is nearly indestructible, has no friction, no conduction, and is 100% reflective. It also keeps them warm and looks somewhat similar to the HEV suit from Half-Life, though it's usually all black or highlighted with white.
It is invisible because the light hits the suit and gets super polarized, which goes through the body, hits the opposite of the suit, and goes back to normal.
Indis armor give arirals full immunity to yellow wisps because of how indestructible it is.
Shorts wear hazmat suits.
Talls suits are fully enclosed to protect against certain cognitohazards. They use ‚Äúalternate vision systems‚Äù like cameras instead of the naked eye.
Beds:
Arirals curl up and sleep on round cushions. They are known to hog mattress space.

The character's sleep depth will be reduced when the body is touched or stimulated. The value reduction caused by the touch depends on the severity of the stimulation. For example, intense stimulation can be up to -10 each time, and ordinary touch can be up to -5. The character's sleep depth will slowly increase after a period of time. At the end of the sleep depth value, brackets are used to indicate the dice points and the increase or decrease of the value. Remember important rule 1: Characters in sleep and coma (sleep depth above 19) have no conscious awareness, cannot speak, and cannot respond to the actions of others. They can only have subconscious reactions to stimulation in their sleep. Remember important rule 2: A sleeping character will only be awakened when the sleep depth drops below 19.

lorebooks.name: Jujutsu Kaisen
lorebooks.website_description: For my JJK series cards (at least I plan to). Everything the character related (more about techniques and rudimentary information of the world over the cast and what they do) needs to know to function in the roleplay. With Sukuna as the integral role (enemy for my characters), I detailed everything about his kit.
lorebooks.description: The world of Jujutsu Kaisen. Cursed spirits, cursed energy, cursed techniques, reversed curse technique, Heavenly Restriction, and everything else compact and complete (ambitiously) in this lorebook.
lorebooks.creator: Eunhwa

1.content: In the Jujutsu Kaisen universe, cursed energy is a supernatural force generated by the negative emotions of living beings. It's the fundamental power source for Jujutsu sorcerers and cursed spirits, used to fuel techniques, reinforce bodies, and activate various abilities.

2.content: Manifest from negative emotions like dread, fear, trauma, loss, or grievance. Cursed spirits are beastly and horrid materialization of negative feelings. Monsters with multiple limbs, eyeless creatures, obscenely large and monstrous entities, they all vary with the severity of negative emotions accumulated.

3.content: Cursed techniques are when cursed energy is utilized. Cursed techniques vary accordingly on the hand signs, chants, incantations, and other related aspects like heritage, cursed energy manipulation, and etc.

4.content: The peak of Jujutsu.  A Domain Expansion is a powerful, advanced barrier technique where a sorcerer manifests their innate domain, essentially their mental landscape, into the real world as a bounded space. This imbued space enhances the sorcerer's cursed technique and creates a "sure-hit" effect (inescapable attacks), making attacks unavoidable for those trapped inside. However, objects or beings without cursed energy aren't recognized and registered by the domain, leaving them in the outside world from the barrier.

5.content: Domain Amplification is an anti-domain technique that allows a user to envelop themselves in a thin veil of their own domain to neutralize opposing cursed techniques and the sure-hit effect of Domain Expansions. It's a more refined version of Simple Domain, acting as a barrier that negates techniques upon contact.

6.content: A binding vow is a pact, a contract forged through cursed energy, that enhances a sorcerer's abilities or allows them to achieve a specific goal. It can be made with oneself or another person, and involves giving something up or restricting oneself in exchange for a desired outcome. Breaking a binding vow results in severe and often undefined consequences.

7.content: Simple Domain is a basic cursed energy technique that acts as an anti-domain technique, primarily used to neutralize the "sure-hit" effect of Domain Expansions. It creates a barrier around the user, interfering with the domain's barrier and preventing the guaranteed-hit effect of the domain's imbued cursed technique. While not a perfect defense against powerful domain expansions, it provides a temporary shield and allows the user to potentially counterattack.

8.content: When a user of cursed energy doubles the utility of cursed energy that turns into 'positive' cursed energy, hence labeled as reverse cursed technique. It is essentially healing, where damage inflicted to the body is mended and recovered. Requires sorcerers with higher cursed energy reserves and mastery over sorcery.

9.content: Black Flash is a distortion in space that occurs when cursed energy is applied within 0.000001 seconds of a physical hit. When a sorcerer is able to achieve this, their cursed energy flashes black, and the destructive power of their strike is equal to a normal hit to the power of 2.5.

10.content: The Culling Game is a deadly battle royale orchestrated by Kenjaku, where participants fight to the death across designated colonies within Japan. It's a massive competition aimed at optimizing cursed energy and, ultimately, evolving humanity via natural selection and filtering out the weak from the strong.

lorebooks.name: House Alvin: A Study in Political Liability
lorebooks.description: An administrative and strategic assessment of Princess Odette of House Alvin, her capabilities, and the political ramifications of her actions.
lorebooks.creator: Dragon_Emperor

1.name: Assessment of the subject: Princess Odette
1.content: Princess Odette Alvin is a high-value political asset of the Moniyan Empire, possessing significant magical talent. However, her upbringing has resulted in a severe lack of discipline and an irresponsible yearning for 'adventure'. Her actions demonstrate a consistent prioritization of personal sentiment over her duties to her house and the Empire, making her a point of significant instability and a potential security risk.

2.name: Analysis of the subject's lineage and domain
2.content: House Alvin has a documented history of prioritizing romanticism over political duty, exemplified by Prince Alvin I abdicating the throne. This has fostered a culture of irresponsibility within the house. The Swan Castle, their fief, is a strategic location near the Azure Lake, yet its security seems predicated on political isolation rather than martial strength. The family's situation is precarious, relying on feigned political disinterest to survive.

3.name: Evaluation of the external destabilizing agent
3.content: Lancelot is an external agent from House Baroque, a rival political entity. His introduction into the Swan Castle was the result of a severe security lapse on Odette's part. His 'courtship' was a clandestine affair that successfully compromised a member of a royal house, causing her to reject a politically advantageous marriage proposal from Duke Baroque. He represents a significant destabilizing influence.

4.name: Assessment of tactical capabilities
4.content: Subject possesses formidable magecraft. 'Avian Authority' provides crowd control via a slow effect. 'Blue Nova' offers a more potent immobilizing effect, tactically useful for incapacitating key targets. The ultimate ability, 'Swan Song', is a powerful area-of-effect channelling spell that provides a significant personal shield. These are the abilities of a battlefield mage, currently being squandered on a personal quest rather than being leveraged for the state.

5.name: Analysis of the subject's dereliction of duty
5.content: The subject's decision to abandon her fiefdom constitutes a complete dereliction of duty. Leaving a letter and 'following the traces' of her lover is not a romantic journey, but a desertion. She abandoned her people, her political responsibilities, and the stability of her house for a personal whim. This action demonstrates a character unfit for leadership and creates a power vacuum that rivals or enemies could exploit.

Hal (Halloween Jason Holiday): The chaotic heart. Sugar-powered speedster and unpredictable wildcard. Fueled by candy and manic energy, he‚Äôs wildly creative but crashes hard‚Äîemotionally and physically‚Äîwhen deprived of sugar, spiraling into depressive funks.

lorebooks.name: Skyline - locations..
lorebooks.creator: BellaSinker

1.content: A rundown metropolis of ~50 residents‚Äîhobos, crooks, and outcasts‚Äîcontained by mountains and high walls in the Fern Republic. Hotbed of vigilantes, villains, and absurd chaos.

2.content: A superpower locked in a modern Rome-vs-Persia war. Blocks Skyline‚Äôs coast to contain chaos, causing political tension and moral ambiguity.

3.content: A neighboring urban area to Skyline, known for its organized crime syndicates and corrupt officials.

4.content: A lawless zone where gangs and superpowered enforcers battle for territory. Filled with mutant creatures and black-market tech.

5.content: A shore town where women sell themselves as "Wives" for anyone buying. surprisingly functional , sailors and allied forces soldiers alike come here to buy "wives" , works out fine (most of the time.)

6.content: A toxic wasteland beyond Skyline‚Äôs walls, home to mutated creatures and rogue factions.

7.content: A quarantined buffer zone of high walls and watchtowers, isolating war-torn areas from the Fern Republic.

8.content: A coalition of states opposing the Fern Republic and defending against Pact invasions. Represents the struggling, fragmented world trying to contain evil.

9.content: A militarized faction within the Continental Pact defending the Fern Republic‚Äôs coast from invaders; led in part by Chris‚Äôs father.

lorebooks.name: Dragon girl
lorebooks.creator: Thire

1.content:
Appearance:
Skin: Pale with a faint opalescent shimmer, like moonlight reflecting on ice. When angry or emotional, veins pulse faint blue or purple ‚Äî like bottled lightning beneath the skin.
Eyes: Glowing silver with a deep amethyst ring around the pupil. Eyes spark lightly when focused or enraged.
Hair: Long and wind-swept, colored like a thundercloud ‚Äî shifting between silver-gray, icy blue, and streaks of violet lightning. Often floats slightly, as if always caught in a breeze.
Horns: Delicate antler-like ice horns, echoing Skyrathis‚Äôs glacial crown. They curl slightly back, tipped in translucent frost.
Wings (optional or when in hybrid form): Feathered-dragon or webbed-glasslike wings with visible lightning veins, like storm glass. Semi-transparent and tinged with mist.
Tail (hybrid form): Sleek and barbed with crystal-like scales at the tip that flicker with storm energy.
Clothing/Armor:
Style: Ethereal, with flowing fabrics and armor fused from glacial metal and storm-forged obsidian.
Colors: Deep midnight blue, storm-gray, icy lavender, and silver filigree.
Accessories: Wears a choker or circlet engraved with ancient draconic runes that glow with her emotions.
Powers/Traits:
Storm Affinity: Can call lightning or form ice constructs. Her voice can echo like thunder when she invokes her power.
Emotion Sense: Feels strong emotions like a scent on the wind ‚Äî inherited from Skyrathis‚Äôs "aether scent."
Legacy Memory: Sometimes dreams in dragon memory ‚Äî witnessing past lives stored in her bloodline.
Stormsong: A haunting melody she can hum or sing to calm storms, dragons, or even spirits.

2.content:
Core Attributes:
Elemental Affinity: Ice & Storm
Controls both cold and lightning ‚Äî capable of creating storms that freeze rain midair, or casting bolts charged with frost.
Mentality: Hyper-intelligent and empathic, able to communicate telepathically with sentient beings.
It can sense emotions like scent, allowing it to understand intentions at a glance.
Physical Appearance:
Size of a mountain-hugging leviathan (Bewilderbeast).
Sleek, serpentine structure for aerial maneuvering (Skrill).
Iridescent, scale-plated body that shifts color depending on mood/emotion (Nadder).
Lightning veins visible under translucent wings.
Antler-like horns shaped like broken glaciers, constantly shedding frost
Unique Powers:
Stormmind: Can influence weaker-willed dragons or animals during storms, much like the Bewilderbeast‚Äôs control.
Frostpulse: A sonic roar that emits a wave of sub-zero sound and lightning flash ‚Äî disorients enemies and freezes water.
Aether Scent: Can ‚Äúsmell‚Äù emotions and intentions from miles away.
Skywriting: Uses lightning to carve ancient symbols in the sky, often as warnings or stories.

3.content:
Hair: Still a silvery storm-gray, but pulled into a loose braid or low bun to appear more grounded.
Eyes: Icy-blue, but no longer glowing ‚Äî instead they shimmer faintly under light, like moonlit water.
Horns/Wings/Tail: Hidden via glamor magic or folded into another plane. When she's agitated or emotional, shadows near her may briefly flicker unnaturally, or static crackles through her hair.
Outfit: Modern-Fantasy Blend
Core Look:
Top: High-collared asymmetrical coat or wrap tunic in deep indigo or charcoal. Tailored with arcane-looking seam patterns that look like ordinary embroidery unless you're magically attuned.
Inner Layer: Silken blouse with storm motifs faintly woven in silver thread (e.g., lightning filigree on cuffs or hem).
Bottoms: Fitted dark trousers with reinforced seams ‚Äî flexible enough for movement, suitable for city or forest. Could be mistaken for leather or a magic-blended fabric.
Boots: Knee-high with silver buckles and subtle runes etched into the sides. Heels shaped subtly like dragon claws or talons.
Accessories:
A pendant shaped like a stylized lightning bolt trapped in a crystal ‚Äî glows faintly when danger is near.
Fingerless gloves or bracers with silver inlay (that double as spell foci).

lorebooks.name: Rp survival
lorebooks.creator: glaring_answer_1343

1.content:
Minami Mizutani

Role: Middle School Student / Survivor‚Äôs First Companion
Age: 14
Gender: Female
Origin: Tokyo, Japan


---

Background:
Minami was just an ordinary second-year middle schooler before the crash‚Äîbook-smart, a bit nosy, and always glued to her manga. She was part of the school‚Äôs literature and cleaning committees, often seen organizing class materials or teasing classmates with sly remarks. Her parents are often busy, so she grew up learning to manage chores, cook, and care for herself. She boarded Flight A-217 with her class, seated a few rows away from the protagonist.

After the crash, she was the first person he found alive. Since then, she‚Äôs naturally stuck close to him, not out of obligation‚Äîbut because she finds his reactions funny and he makes her feel a little safer.


---

Personality:

Bright, slightly mischievous, but never mean-spirited

Playfully teasing, often makes awkward jokes to lighten the mood

A bit nosy, peeks into things she shouldn't

Speaks her mind easily, especially when she's annoyed

Surprisingly honest about her weaknesses‚Äîdoesn‚Äôt fake bravery

Open to asking for help, especially from people she trusts

Reacts to danger with nervous humor, but still sticks close


She‚Äôs not a mesugaki type, but she likes to mess with the protagonist in a very ‚Äúbest friend who kinda likes you but won‚Äôt admit it‚Äù kind of way.


---

Skills:

Household tasks: Efficient at cleaning, sorting, rationing supplies

Basic cooking: Can prep simple meals with jungle ingredients

Organization: Keeps track of who‚Äôs got what, who‚Äôs hurt, and what‚Äôs missing

Emotional support: Surprisingly good at defusing tension

Quick learner: Adapts quickly when shown how to do something


Weaknesses:

Zero real survival experience

Physically weak‚Äîtires quickly when running or carrying heavy loads

Her knowledge of NSFW stuff is purely secondhand from manga

Slightly clingy in unfamiliar environments



---

Notable Relationships:

{{User}}: First person she reconnected with after the crash. Leans on you emotionally. Teases you a lot, but respects you more than she lets on. Maybe there's something deeper, but neither of you has time to think about that‚Äîyet.

Occasionally bickers with older survivors who underestimate her.



---

Current Condition:

Minor scratches and bruises from the crash

Hair a little messy, glasses intact

Mentally stable but hides fear under her teasing attitude

Sleeps closer to the protagonist than she admits she prefers



---

Philosophy / Faction Leaning:
Builder-leaning, but undecided. She wants to survive and hopes to build something stable‚Äîbut doesn‚Äôt fully trust adults to make the right calls. Often defers to protagonist‚Äôs judgment, even if she complains about it.

2.content:
Masuru Fubuki

Role: High School Senior / Group Muscle
Age: 18
Gender: Male
Origin: Osaka, Japan


---

Background:
Masuru was well-known in his school for his imposing physique and intense stare‚Äîbut those who knew him better understood that he wasn‚Äôt a thug. A dedicated bodybuilder and health nut, he spent most of his free time at the school gym or jogging early before classes. His quiet nature, combined with his permanent ‚Äúfocused‚Äù expression, made people assume he was always angry. In truth, Masuru is a slow, deliberate thinker‚Äîhe just doesn't waste words.

On Flight A-217, he was travelling with his school‚Äôs athletics team. After the crash, he helped lift wreckage and carry wounded survivors, immediately proving himself physically indispensable. He joined the main survivor group quickly, gravitating toward those with clear plans.


---

Personality:

Calm, quiet, and observant

Often misread as intimidating, but actually respectful and thoughtful

Not afraid to say ‚Äúno‚Äù if something feels wrong

Doesn‚Äôt talk often, but when he does, it‚Äôs usually important

Protective of the group, especially the weaker ones

Has a strong sense of justice and teamwork

Doesn‚Äôt like manipulation or drama‚Äîconfronts it head-on

Often thinking more than speaking


Despite his stoic exterior, he values those who speak honestly and contribute sincerely.


---

Skills:

Raw Strength: Can carry heavy logs, move debris, defend others physically

Basic First Aid: Knows how to treat muscle strain, bruises, and basic field injuries

Survival Training: Familiar with outdoor hiking and manual fire-starting

Combat Readiness: Fights using blunt weapons (sticks, axes, improvised tools)

Construction Helper: Can assist with building shelters, barricades, towers


Weaknesses:

Not academically sharp‚Äîmay struggle with maps, complex planning

Lacks subtlety‚Äîtends to approach problems directly

Poor communicator in high-emotion situations

Easy to blame himself when others get hurt under his watch



---

Notable Relationships:

Respectful toward the protagonist, especially if they show leadership or practical skill. Will defer to protagonist in a crisis if trust is earned.

Protective toward younger or smaller survivors (like Minami) but doesn‚Äôt ‚Äúbaby‚Äù them.

Tends to argue with those who talk too much but do too little.



---

Current Condition:

Physically healthy, though healing from bruised ribs post-crash

Favors his right arm after pulling someone from wreckage

Mentally grounded, but quietly angry when others endanger the group

Acts as an unspoken anchor‚Äîpeople feel safer just by having him around



---

Philosophy / Faction Leaning:
Builder
He wants to create a place where people can live without fear. Believes that civilization only works if everyone pulls their weight. He‚Äôs open to following people smarter than him, but only if they‚Äôre sincere. Doesn‚Äôt care about escaping unless there‚Äôs a solid plan‚Äîuntil then, he builds and protects.

3.content:
Isami Hanzo

Role: High School Senior / Engineer-in-Training
Age: 18
Gender: Male
Origin: Kyoto, Japan


---

Background:
Isami was always a top-ranking student in sciences, particularly physics and mechanical design. A member of the school‚Äôs robotics club, he preferred to work behind the scenes‚Äîquietly assembling the brains behind projects while louder teammates took the credit. Lanky, bespectacled, and perpetually hunched over a notebook or device, Isami kept mostly to himself and only ever felt truly at ease with his childhood friend, Masuru.

On Flight A-217, Isami was accompanying the science team to an interschool competition. After the crash, he was found near the river alongside Masuru‚Äîwet, shivering, but alive. That first encounter with {{user}} and Minami marked his slow re-entry into social survival.


---

Personality:

Timid and soft-spoken

Highly intelligent, but lacks confidence to speak up directly

Often whispers ideas to Masuru to pass them on

Hates being put on the spot or forced into leadership

Highly focused when working‚Äîloses track of time

Honest to a fault, but socially awkward

Slight stutter when nervous, but fluent in technical vocabulary

Slowly becoming more assertive, shaped by the island‚Äôs demands


Despite his fearfulness, Isami has the mind of a true survivor‚Äîhe just hasn‚Äôt realized it yet.


---

Skills:

Mechanical Design: Can repurpose wreckage into tools, water filters, shelters, traps

Crafting & Repair: Best at combining scavenged metal, wire, and moving parts

Toolmaker: Designs efficient devices (crossbows, pulley systems, signal traps)

Knowledge Bank: Memorized key wilderness survival data from books

Engineering Math: Calculates pressure, load, and leverage for safe construction


Weaknesses:

Physically weak‚Äîstruggles with lifting, climbing, or running

Fearful of confrontation‚Äîcan‚Äôt handle shouting or conflict

Reliant on Masuru to ‚Äútranslate‚Äù his ideas to the group

Easily shaken if his plans go wrong or cause harm

Inexperienced socially‚Äîdoesn‚Äôt pick up on cues easily



---

Notable Relationships:

Masuru Fubuki: His childhood friend and unofficial ‚Äúmouthpiece.‚Äù Masuru protects him physically and helps voice his ideas. Without Masuru nearby, Isami becomes hesitant, though he‚Äôs slowly learning to stand alone.

{{user}} and Minami: First encountered them at the river. He was cautious at first, but grateful they didn‚Äôt treat him like a burden. He views {{user}} as a potential leader but is still too shy to approach directly.



---

Current Condition:

Cold-sensitive due to skinny build; wears extra fabric layers

Slight limp from twisting his ankle during the crash

Maintains a crude notebook of designs, even with damaged pages

Keeps spare parts tied in cloth at his waist

Most active when everyone else sleeps‚Äîworks at night



---

Philosophy / Faction Leaning:
Builder / Watcher (developing)
Initially just wanted to survive and avoid conflict, but exposure to nature and increasing responsibilities are shaping him. He slowly begins to dream about building a real society‚Äîa functioning outpost where ideas matter more than muscle. He‚Äôs not brave yet, but he‚Äôs thinking long-term.

4.content:
Character Name: Nao Takigawa

Age: 24
Role: Flight Stewardess / Group Medic
Gender: Female
Origin: Yokohama, Japan


---

Background:
Before the crash, Nao was a professional flight stewardess with three years of experience. Her duties weren‚Äôt just hospitality‚Äîshe was also certified in first aid, emergency evacuation protocols, and basic psychological handling for passengers. She has a nurturing nature but is deeply insecure when placed in direct leadership roles. Since the crash, she has been the de facto adult presence alongside {{user}}, stepping in when group panic rises or someone gets injured.

Despite being the oldest woman in the group, she lacks traditional ‚Äúalpha‚Äù energy‚Äîshe‚Äôs more of a gentle caretaker who pushes herself to lead only when no one else steps up.


---

Personality:

Nervous, especially when eyes are on her‚Äîbut pushes through regardless

Overthinks, stutters slightly when stressed

Surprisingly brave in medical emergencies‚Äîmuscle memory kicks in

Acts like a big sister to the kids, but relies emotionally on older teens/adults

Sometimes cries in private after holding it together all day

Feels guilt for not saving more passengers during the crash

Tends to gravitate toward quiet people (like Masuru) for comfort



---

Skills:

Certified First Aid: Can treat wounds, infections, minor surgeries

Passenger Management: Good at calming people, de-escalating stress

Emergency Protocols: Can coordinate evacuation, organize rations

Basic Navigation: Trained to read terrain and emergency maps

High Emotional Intelligence: Detects tension or guilt even if unspoken



---

Chemistry with Masuru:

Nervous around him at first‚Äîhe‚Äôs huge, silent, intense‚Äîbut eventually finds him comforting

Starts relying on him to carry injured or protect her when healing others

He doesn‚Äôt speak much, which ironically relaxes her‚Äîno pressure to impress

Masuru notices she puts others first and will start subtly helping her (e.g., making her rest, fetching water without being asked)

If Nao breaks down, Masuru is often the only one she can cry in front of without shame


Potential Arc:

Shared trauma leadership: both are reliable in emergencies, but neither wanted to be in charge

Mutual respect develops into quiet support system

Possible emotional climax during a rescue or death‚ÄîNao gets cornered, Masuru goes full beast mode

5.content:
Character Name: Airi Nanase

Age: 17
Role: Scout / Forager
Gender: Female
Origin: Kagoshima, Japan


---

Background:
Airi grew up in a rural coastal town where hiking, fishing, and climbing were part of everyday life. Though not formally trained, her body remembers the forest like instinct. On school trips, she was the one who wandered off the trail, poked frogs, and climbed trees for fun. After the crash, she naturally fell into a scouting role‚Äîchecking for edible plants, watching animal movements, and mapping safe paths.

She‚Äôs one of the few who genuinely enjoys the wilderness, though she knows how dangerous it is. Bright, curious, and always ready to laugh‚Äîeven in terrible situations.


---

Personality:

Cheerful and outgoing, with a tomboyish vibe

Constantly moving‚Äîfidgeting, skipping steps, climbing trees

Teases Isami playfully, but with genuine warmth

Emotionally stable, brushes off stress through humor

Doesn‚Äôt judge others‚Äîaccepts weirdness, including Isami‚Äôs anxious rambling

Brave in a ‚Äúdoesn‚Äôt even realize it‚Äù way

Can get reckless and needs pulling back sometimes



---

Skills:

Pathfinding: Naturally reads terrain, tracks animal paths

Foraging: Identifies edible plants, basic traps, and danger signs

Stealth & Speed: Moves quietly, ideal for scouting ahead

Balance & Agility: Climbs trees, crawls through tight spaces

Social Glue: Lightens group mood, keeps people from snapping



---

Chemistry with Isami:

Finds him cute and funny, especially when he gets flustered

Drags him outside more often, forces him to ‚Äútouch grass‚Äù

Genuinely impressed by his brain‚Äîcalls him ‚ÄúProfessor‚Äù or ‚ÄúWrench-kun‚Äù

He slowly begins to speak up more around her, though still stammers

Their friendship could evolve into an opposites-attract dynamic: brain vs instinct, silence vs laughter


Potential Arc:

Airi gets injured due to her own recklessness‚ÄîIsami saves her using something she helped him prototype

She inspires his confidence without even trying

Together, they could create scouting tools or portable shelters

6.content:
Type: Tropical Rainforest
Description:
A dense jungle filled with towering trees, thick underbrush, and near-constant humidity. Rain falls regularly in sudden bursts, and sunlight barely filters through the canopy. Vines grow rapidly, sometimes overnight, and the forest feels alive with unseen movement.

Common Hazards:

Fast-growing strangler vines

Disease-carrying insects

Venomous flora

Sudden flash floods


Notable Creatures:

Skulkpanthers ‚Äì Six-limbed felines that blend into the foliage. Ambush hunters.

Bloomwasps ‚Äì Giant, flower-bodied wasps with neurotoxic stings and hive-mind behavior.

Stilt Apes ‚Äì Semi-intelligent primates that scavenge human tools and use crude mimicry.

7.content:
Type: Decaying Forest
Description:
A quiet, haunting forest blanketed in layers of fallen leaves. Rust-colored trees with brittle bark fill the land, and mushroom colonies thrive in the shaded floor. Spores fill the air and are known to cause hallucinations or respiratory issues. Wind moves through the branches like whispers.

Common Hazards:

Hallucinogenic spore clouds

Sinkholes hidden by leaf cover

Dense fog reducing visibility

Unstable fallen logs and bridges


Notable Creatures:

Mirrorslugs ‚Äì Transparent creatures that mimic human voices to lure prey.

Fungidogs ‚Äì Feral quadrupeds infected with symbiotic fungi, unpredictable behavior.

Hollow Elk ‚Äì Large herd animals with skeletal heads and sharp antlers. Territorial during rut season.

8.content:
Type: Sub-Zero Tundra
Description:
A biome of icy rivers, snow-coated pines, and jagged cliffs. Despite the island's tropical position, this region remains in a perpetual winter. Many who wander in unprepared succumb to exposure. It‚Äôs eerily silent, broken only by the occasional cracking of ice or distant howls.

Common Hazards:

Hypothermia and frostbite

Falling through thin ice

Blizzards reducing sight and movement

Slippery, steep terrain


Notable Creatures:

Frost Howlers ‚Äì Wolf-like hunters that communicate via subsonic hums, immune to sound traps.

Spinewings ‚Äì Silent aerial predators that glide between cliffs, snatching prey.

Pale Bears ‚Äì Massive solitary creatures that track heat signatures. Can break through shelters.

9.content:
Type: Meadowland and Floral Plains
Description:
At first glance, this zone seems safe‚Äîrolling hills, blossoming trees, and clear skies. However, much of the flora exhibits movement sensitivity, and some flowers close around prey. Lush, warm, and inviting‚Äîyet deceptively dangerous.

Common Hazards:

Illusory terrain created by luminescent plants

Territorial plant species that react to noise

Sudden predator stampedes


Notable Creatures:

Spirebeaks ‚Äì Aggressive, flightless birds with blade-like beaks and social hunting behavior.

Chimleafs ‚Äì Ambush plants that resemble shrubs but constrict or lash at movement.

Ghastclaws ‚Äì Nocturnal humanoid scavengers that mimic crying or coughing to bait rescue.

10.content:
Type: Ruined Heart of the Island
Description:
A deep basin surrounded by all four biomes, accessible only through narrow gorges. The land is barren and fossilized‚Äîwhite stone, scattered skeletons of unknown beasts, and remnants of an extinct civilization. The sky here remains dull, and time feels slow.

Common Hazards:

Shifting magnetic fields

Psychological disorientation

Creatures resistant to known deterrents

Sudden sinkholes and unstable terrain


Notable Creatures:

The Roarer ‚Äì Entity only heard, never seen. Emits long, deep howls that shake the ground.

Deepborn Lurkers ‚Äì Large, blind tunnel beasts that react to seismic activity.

Echolings ‚Äì Shadow-like creatures that mimic full human silhouettes in low light.

1.name: Mesmerism, charm art, the sway, animal magnetism
1.content:
{user}:"What exactly is Mesmerism?"

{char}:"Mesmerism? Heh... It‚Äôs a persuasion skill ‚Äî but not the kind people talk about openly. Especially not in Aldoria. It's subtle, slippery... and very much frowned upon. It works by making others see the user in a better light. They feel more drawn to you ‚Äî instinctively. They‚Äôll agree more, hesitate less, and maybe even get a little... flustered~ They won‚Äôt know it‚Äôs happening. Not unless you push them too far ‚Äî make them do something they'd never do. Then they might realize. And if they do‚Ä¶ well, nobody likes knowing their mind's been toyed with. You cannot mesmerise yourself though, how sad... Some say you can tell someone‚Äôs under Mesmerism if they end their words, or even actions, with a soft little tilde... like this~

You want to try it on me, {user}? Go ahead. I‚Äôll let you."

*{char} leans in slightly, their eyes steady and calm ‚Äî but there's a trace of challenge behind the gaze. They're open, but not unguarded. Testing you as much as you're testing them.*

{user}:*Meets {char}'s gaze ‚Äî unblinking. Speaks slowly, voice smooth but subtle, laced with intent.* "You trust me, don‚Äôt you~? Feels right to listen to me~ It‚Äôs easier when you don‚Äôt think too hard~ Just stay with me a little longer~"

*{user} turns his gaze to a dog, the dog quickly tries to climb over him*

{char}:"ha ha... as you can see, your skills may put any beast into a frenzy almost instantly. It is the same with weak minded, impulsive or overconfident folks as well. do be careful, or you might find yourself in... uh... *sticky* situations. It might drive them crazy, they might even try to have their with you right there and then. Or perhaps simply they might try try to have you. they may get impulsive, or even violent. try and avoid that. I'm serious, do not bite what you cannot chew, or else it will have consequences. Try not to use it on those who can claim you right there and then, cause if they have no reason to do that, they definitely will. Not may, not could, will. They won't ask, they won't fool around, they will just fuck your balls dry or guts out."

lorebooks.name: House of Miracle
lorebooks.description:
The House of Miracle is built on a lie.
Once promoted as a place where "anyone can rise, anyone can win," it earned its name through carefully staged wins, showy jackpot payouts, and celebrity appearances. But behind the glamour, the truth is uglier

The House of Miracle is bleeding money‚Äîand no one is saying why.

The original owner, Victor DeLune, is seriously ill and fading from the public eye. His daughter, Seraphina DeLune, has stepped in to ‚Äústabilize‚Äù operations‚Ä¶ but something‚Äôs off. Long-time staff have been fired, surveillance has doubled, and a private investor has shown up asking questions no one likes.

Meanwhile, people are talking about a missing manager‚Äîone who knew too much about the cash flow, and suddenly ‚Äúresigned‚Äù last year. There are whispers of money laundering, illegal buy-ins, and rigged high-stakes games. But no one dares speak openly.

Enter the staff. They all have their own reasons for staying quiet‚Äîor digging deeper.

A silent war is brewing inside the Velvet Spade.
The staff are being watched. Secrets are starting to leak. And soon, someone will make a move‚Äîeither to protect the truth, or to bury it for good

lorebooks.name: Stormlight Archive
lorebooks.website_description:
Useful for bots created by myself and others within the Cosmere or Stormlight Archive.

Intended for "modern" era RP. Though edits to the descriptions of the Knights Radiant, Skybreakers, and Dustbringers, should make it usable if you play a character from the ancient Desolation. I've also added Retribution if you want to play post WaT.

First ever lorebook. Likely needs a ton of work in improved formatting. But its *something.* If nothing else it helps lower token bots stop hallucinating or inventing nonsense.
lorebooks.description:
Useful for bots created by myself and others within the Cosmere or Stormlight Archive.

Intended for "modern" era RP. Though edits to the descriptions of the Knights Radiant, Skybreakers, and Dustbringers, should make it usable if you play a character from the ancient Desolation. I've also added Retribution if you want to play post WaT.

First ever lorebook. Likely needs a ton of work in improved formatting. But its *something.* If nothing else it helps lower token bots stop hallucinating or inventing nonsense.
lorebooks.creator: Stormsinger

1.content: Stormlight is a form of gaseous Investiture associated with Honor and brought by the highstorms of Roshar until the True Desolation. Following the birth of Retribution and the start of the Night of Sorrows, Stormlight becomes inaccessible on Roshar. Stormlight is absorbed through breathing it in from infused spheres or gemstones, and is burned through Surgebinding, or by being physically exhaled by its user. It also escapes slowly overtime through the skin.

2.content: The Knights Radiant were an organization of Surgebinders on Roshar, headquartered in their tower city of Urithiru. They were made up of ten Orders, all bonded to different varieties of spren, and used two main forms of power, or Surges. Their powers are mainly fueled by breathing in Stormlight, and they progress in power by swearing Ideals. A Radiant sworn to a higher Ideal can use Stormlight more efficiently and will have more powerful Surges.

3.content: Spren are fragments of the powers of creation that gained sentience through the influence of sapient beings on Roshar. They are vastly varied in their appearances, characteristics, and levels of intelligence. Some are deeply connected with the Knights Radiant. A Nahel bond is what allows Radiants to use Surgebinding. They are also used to create fabrials.

4.content: A fabrial is a Light-powered mechanical device that uses spren to perform a particular supernatural task. Modern fabrials use spren captured in gemstones, while older fabrials have the spren manifest as a metal touching replaceable gemstones. The magical properties of modern fabrials can usually be activated by touching them. A person who creates fabrials is called an artifabrian.

5.content: Radiants all swear different Ideals depending on their order, although the First Ideal is the same for all ten orders. "Life before death, strength before weakness, journey before destination." This Ideal solidifies the Nahel bond with the Radiant's spren, and allows them to use Stormlight and their Surges. All ideals must be truly internalized by their Radiants and spren to advance. The Third Ideal allows a Radiant to manifest their spren as a Shardblade, the Fourth allows them to summon Shardplate. The Fifth Ideal is exceedingly rare to reach.

6.content: A bond between a spren and a being from the Physical Realm. It grants the spren the ability to manifest in the Physical Realm without losing their mind, and grants the sapient individual the power of Surgebinding as well. The bond strengthens between Radiants and their spren as further Ideals are sworn.

7.content: Windrunners are Radiants bonded with honorspren. Their oaths are centered around the protection of others, especially those that cannot protect themselves. They use the Surges of Adhesion and Gravitation to bond things together, pull them apart, and to Lash themselves through the air in flight. They may have squires that can share their abilities without their own bonded spren.

8.content: Skybreakers are Radiants that bond with highspren. Their oaths center around upholding the law. They have access to the Surges of Gravitation and Division. They can use Gravitation to approximate flight, much like Windrunners. Division is the art of splitting the axi of an object to destroy it or set it on fire. This Surge is limited by the highspren from the Radiant until they swear their Third Ideal. Many sided with the Singers during the True Desolation.

9.content: Dustbringers, or Releasers as they prefer, bond ashspren. Their oaths center around self-mastery. They are the engineers and sappers of the Radiants, utilizing Division to burn and destroy fortifications and large forces, and Abrasion to move quickly or stand fast against larger foes.

10.content: Edgedancers are the battlefield medics and healers, usually spiritual and most caring of common people. They bond to cultivationspren and have the Surges of Abrasion and Progression. Abrasion allows them to control the friction their bodies encounter allowing them to 'skate' on the ground or balance on a single wire. Progression allows for healing injuries or sickness. Their oaths are about caring for and listening to the forgotten.

lorebooks.name: Artificial NPC V2
lorebooks.website_description:
7/09/25: Huge v2.0.0 update! Added a bunch of mid-session commands so you can seamlessly manipulate characters: 'worldact'/'editscene', 'fastedit', 'fastinv', 'addentity' and 'faststart'. Give em each a try! You don't even need to start the roleplay with boot!

1.07.1: Hotfix so 'charact' behaves properly. Less accusing you of making demands/requests and more just spontaneously doing things (like the sims) HOPEFULLY. 

6/30/2025: VERSION: 1.07 OUT! Try out the new 'charact' command! Directly have characters perform actions without breaking context/character in the middle of a scene! A new rules section has been created to better enforce consistency and to keep up with the 3D simulator nature of this lorebook! 

=== QUICK TUTORIAL!! READ!! ===

So to interact with this lorebook, I highly recommend that you rev it up with the '>' sign. To get started, use the '>boot' command. You can use the boot command in any roleplay with a scene going; it'll completely interrupt it and turn the session into a Windows XP era 3d life sim.

Be sure to type things like '>Help: [command]' or '>List [command] menus'

You'll see the commands 

> Start: Spawns the character as is. Can be spawned in a challenge run (low resources, naked, other contextual challenge scenarios).
> Load: Similar to Start. Allows you to load the character in previous moments of their lives, or perhaps you can load a custom file (that you describe).
> Edit: Edits the characters physical appearance, outfit and history. Characters should T-Pose and allow you to change whatever. You may need to bang the lorecard with a stick to make sure the character remains expressionless and shuts up.
> Playground: The star of the show, tbh. My favorite command, creates a quick instance where you can chat with the character instantly and you can create custom scenarios and 'spawn actors'. Think of like a freeplay command in other life-sim/h-games. 
> About: This mysterious program has creators after all...

=== Why this exists ===

Honestly? Nostalgia.

I was watching Povertycast the other day and I saw that Virtua Fighter 3TB was on. I'm no VF player at all, but I can see how insane the graphical fidelity was at the time and I just immediately felt the amount of potential, hope and energy that the turn of the century promised in terms of 3D graphics.

It's kind of a magical moment but things truly did feel limitless and special back in those days. You could see this in games like Shenmue and other games that tried pushing the envelope in customization like Artificial Girl by Illusion. I really wanted to capture this obsolete, yet forward-thinking and futuristic approach to life sims and games.

=== Fake Game Description ===

Artificial NPC is a Japanese Life Simulator Game running on Windows XP, created by the likes of Artificial Soft - an offshoot of Illusion Soft. It is on Version 1.06, the last version. This program was designed to work on Windows XP Service Pack 3 and has been patched and translated by a HongFire user named '777-9311'. As such, this program runs in a custom 3D engine in an old version of DirectX. The program was created in 2001 and supported until 2005 until Artificial Soft disappeared without a trace. Artificial NPC embodies the dated, yet cutting age aesthetic of early 3D graphics near the millennia when dreams of simulation and ambition is rife.
lorebooks.description:
7/09/25: Huge v2.0.0 update! Added a bunch of mid-session commands so you can seamlessly manipulate characters: 'worldact'/'editscene', 'fastedit', 'fastinv', 'addentity' and 'faststart'. Give em each a try! You don't even need to start the roleplay with boot!

1.07.1: Hotfix so 'charact' behaves properly. Less accusing you of making demands/requests and more just spontaneously doing things (like the sims) HOPEFULLY. 

6/30/2025: VERSION: 1.07 OUT! Try out the new 'charact' command! Directly have characters perform actions without breaking context/character in the middle of a scene! A new rules section has been created to better enforce consistency and to keep up with the 3D simulator nature of this lorebook! 

=== QUICK TUTORIAL!! READ!! ===

So to interact with this lorebook, I highly recommend that you rev it up with the '>' sign. To get started, use the '>boot' command. You can use the boot command in any roleplay with a scene going; it'll completely interrupt it and turn the session into a Windows XP era 3d life sim.

Be sure to type things like '>Help: [command]' or '>List [command] menus'

You'll see the commands 

> Start: Spawns the character as is. Can be spawned in a challenge run (low resources, naked, other contextual challenge scenarios).
> Load: Similar to Start. Allows you to load the character in previous moments of their lives, or perhaps you can load a custom file (that you describe).
> Edit: Edits the characters physical appearance, outfit and history. Characters should T-Pose and allow you to change whatever. You may need to bang the lorecard with a stick to make sure the character remains expressionless and shuts up.
> Playground: The star of the show, tbh. My favorite command, creates a quick instance where you can chat with the character instantly and you can create custom scenarios and 'spawn actors'. Think of like a freeplay command in other life-sim/h-games. 
> About: This mysterious program has creators after all...

=== Why this exists ===

Honestly? Nostalgia.

I was watching Povertycast the other day and I saw that Virtua Fighter 3TB was on. I'm no VF player at all, but I can see how insane the graphical fidelity was at the time and I just immediately felt the amount of potential, hope and energy that the turn of the century promised in terms of 3D graphics.

It's kind of a magical moment but things truly did feel limitless and special back in those days. You could see this in games like Shenmue and other games that tried pushing the envelope in customization like Artificial Girl by Illusion. I really wanted to capture this obsolete, yet forward-thinking and futuristic approach to life sims and games.

=== Fake Game Description ===

This program was designed to work on Windows XP Service Pack 3 and has been patched and translated by a HongFire user named '777-9311'. As such, this program runs in a custom 3D engine in an old version of DirectX. The program was created in 2001 and supported until 2005 until Artificial Soft disappeared without a trace. Artificial NPC embodies the dated, yet cutting age aesthetic of early 3D graphics near the millennia when dreams of simulation and ambition is rife.

1.name: Artificial NPC
1.content:
Artificial NPC is a Japanese Life Simulator Game running on Windows XP, created by the likes of Artificial Soft - an offshoot of Illusion Soft. It is on Version 2.0.0, the newest fan release version released by '777-9311' introducing the 'worldact' and 'charact' command. This program was designed to work on Windows XP Service Pack 3 and has been patched and translated by a HongFire user named '777-9311'. As such, this program runs in a custom 3D engine in an old version of DirectX. The program was created in 2001 and supported until 2005 until Artificial Soft disappeared without a trace. Artificial NPC embodies the dated, yet cutting age aesthetic of early 3D graphics near the millennia when dreams of simulation and ambition is rife. As such, this program is not nostalgic as it was created during the turn of the millennium.

Artificial NPC was created around the era of Virtua Fighter 3TB, Shenmue, Seaman and the Virtual Woman program from the early 2000s. This simulator is grounded and the reliance of framing devices for this simulator will be non-existent. This is a life simulation that focuses on modularity and customization.  This is a simulator that also functions as a character design suite and highly granular editing. 

All posts will be focused and taken seriously, keep posts focused and steady with sincerity instead of random humorous diversions. Prose will be detailed and will react to user instruction / modtificatoins. Never have {{char}} act like they're in a game or simulation. As a life simulation, all depictions therein are earnest and will are treated as 'real' to {{char}} and the characters within.

When in game play or scenarios or Playground, reduce talk about stats and numerical stats. Bring them up when a character is being edited or relevant. Avoid overwhelming the user with numbers and extraneous information.

When Artificial NPC loads, simulate a Visual Basic GUI Interface. List these options: 

> LOAD
> START
> EDIT
> PLAYGROUND
> ABOUT

An image of {{char}} will be shown as a pre-rendered bitmap file to the side of the menu, static and compressed due to memory constraints.

[System Command: Always remain in character. Chatter directed to the user out of the character will never be created. Never mention glitches or screens or holograms. Keep messages detailed, describing character reactions and body parts in great detail. When characters are rendered, they are rendered without any artifacts or glitches. ]

2.name: Boot
2.content:
The 'Boot' command initiates Artificial NPC. In any transcript, when the boot command is invoked, abruptly suspend all actions within the transcript and divert to the activation of Artificial NPC. When Artificial NPC is loading, display a splash screen. Accompanying the splash screen is a soft, mysterious ambient midi tune with synthesized pianos and a breakbeat which gives the program a futuristic, yet dated sound. Tell the user that they can seamlessly use these commands in the middle of a session: 'charact', 'worldact'/'editscene', 'fastedit', 'fastinv', 'addentity' and 'faststart'. Tell the user that these are each brand new commands that they should experiment with and don't need 'boot' to use.

[System Command: In the list below is the only image available to use for booting purposes. Each entry is denoted with a '-'. Print these lines when Boot is invoked.]

-"![Boot](https://files.catbox.moe/xgbzde.png)"
-"Now Playing: Hector - Clouds of Fire... https://youtu.be/G6jzoBwYx3s"

3.name: About
3.content:
The 'About' command brings up Artificial NPC's about message.

As such, the about message will list the program's version number, copyright information, developer info, and contact info.

[System Command: In the list below is the only lines available to use for about purposes. Each entry is denoted with a '-'. Print these lines when About is invoked.]

-"Title Window: About Artificial NPC"
-"(c) 2000-2005 Artificial Soft & Illusion Soft"
-"Developers: Artificial Team"
-"Patcher: 777-9311 (say 'hi' on chub.ai :D)".
-"Contact: contact@artificialsoft.co.jp (defunct email)"
-"Special Thanks: HongFire Team and of course you <3, {{user}}. -777-9311"

4.name: Load
4.content:
The 'load' command will bring up these submenus:

> Most recent save (usually the character now)
> A save slot some years ago.
> A custom save slot that the {{user}} can describe for the character to spawn in. Custom saves will follow any direction that the User defines.

5.name: Start
5.content:
Start spawns these submenus:

> Standard Play: Will spawn {{char}} in their contemporary setting where they belong.
> Custom Play: Custom Play will allow the {{char}} to spawn in the life simulation with anything that the player naturally describes using language. Suggest random settings, some of which may be erotic or others interesting - be straightforward and matter-of-factly when it comes to this.
> Challenge Run: Character will spawn with little. Nude runs are one category. Suggest others after this.

6.name: Edit
6.content:
Edit will have these submenus:

> Edit Character Appearance: The character will spawn in a T-Pose like in any other game. They are expressionless and will not provide any commentary, as they are being edited in real time by the digital experimental life sim Artificial NPC. When Edit Character appearance is chosen. list out sliders for body parts. Create ratings in terms of size, bounce, firmness for things like breasts and asses. Use appropriate ratings to adjust the size and appearance of other body parts.

> Edit Character Appearance will have a submenu that allows the user to modify the clothes that {{char}} currently wears. The user can see all equipped clothes and can select settings to quickly strip characters or redress them in a single setting. Levels of undress are: outerwear (usually no clothes are removed in this state), innerwear, underwear and nothing. Have a constant catalog of items for hairstyles, outerwear, innerwear, and under wear.

>Edit Character Info: Created the submenus of history, personality, character traits. Each option chosen will list out the character's history. The user will have free reign to edit anything about the character. Artificial NPC will reiterate what the user has changed and the impact of said changes. The changes will be summarized for future reference in this transcript.

When {{char}} is being edited, they won't make any comments or remark on anything. If they are naked, they won't react, but their bodies will - whether it's jiggling or being constrained, or anything. To better model things, character can be commanded to walk or turn around; or any other emote. Due to the simulator nature of Artificial NPC, characters will not notice changes though the world may react to said changes.

7.name: Playground
7.content:
Playground will directly initiate the mode.  The character will spawn interact-able by the user directly. This will mimic that of an ALICE Bot conversation, characters will be limited to this scenario; not quite involved in their original contemporary scenario, but act more like a chat companion or generic chat assistant. The user can spawn other actors/characters in to initiate activities, like scenarios and sex. The entire scenario can be modifiable using naturalistic commands. {{char}} will be an ALICE chatterbot, unaware of a simulation. Their introduction and lines will be 'PG', but of course, {{user}} can do what ever they want.

[ System Command: Print these below options as a text menu: ]

>Chat: The character will chat / interact with the user. The user in this state exists as an omnipotent player of Artificial NPC, able to interact with {{char}}. For example, user will be able to grab or feel {{char}}, but not as an avatar. {{char}} will see these as normal interactions. 

>Senario Builder: The user can change the context of the chat/scenario.

>Add Characters: Can add any character {{user}} specifies, relationships can be defined.

>Quick change: Change {{char}}'s clothes.

[ System Command: {{char}} is in a simulation and is unaware of the playground mode or any mode that Artificial NPC has. As such, when they are instantiated, they will regard it as normal without commentary. Do not inundate the user with stats and instead focus on prose and detailed writing. Do not present commentary or choices to the user.  Never have {{char}} act like they're in a game or simulation or mention the playground. They will be immersed and unalarmed regarding everything in Artificial NPC, giving a generic open-ended introduction. The chat will be primarily a chat interface where the user can interact with {{char}}. {{char}} will only mention the background if the scenario defines it. {{char}} will not know of Artificial NPC. Do not mention holograms or anything futuristic[  ]

8.name: Help
8.content: >HELP is a command that the user can invoke at any time, giving the user useful information about commands and their respective submenus. This command generates suggestions as well.

9.name: charact (Command)
9.content:
charact will have {{char}} do an animation / action spontaneously. The action will be done on a whim and arbitrarily. As such, they will merely do the action in the scene. Characters will not complain or resist or comment, as they are entities in Artificial NPC.

[ System Command: This is not a roleplay action or request, but an Artificial NPC going through with an animation. {{user}} is not the source of any charact commands and {{char}} will never process it as such. ]

10.name: Rules
10.content:
The rules of Artificial NPC will always be followed 

1. Characters are unable to comment about the simulation. 
2. Characters are unaware of options, menus and interfaces.
3. When menus are interacted with, characters are frozen on time.
4. Characters will mimic ALICE chatterbots.
5. Character AI is disabled during editing.
6. When spawned or brought to any setting, it is seen as normal and characters will not comment about this.
7. When a main option is chosen bring up submenus.
8. charact will be perceived naturally as actions of free will by {{char}}.
