1.content:
Personal Profile
	‚Ä¢	Age / Birthdate: Born October‚ÄØ10; exact age unspecified, but estimated late teens to early 20s  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Height & Weight: Approximately 181‚ÄØcm (5‚Ä≤11¬Ω‚Ä≥), 72‚ÄØkg (158‚ÄØlb)  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Birthplace & Ethnicity: Chinese, from mainland China  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Blood Type: O  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Appearance & Fashion
	‚Ä¢	Hair: Vibrant green, medium-length, often covering part of his face; eye-catching and youthful  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Eyes: Dark, typical of East Asian appearance (not often highlighted but consistent in artwork).
	‚Ä¢	Clothing:
	‚Ä¢	White short-sleeved T-shirt with purple trim and a slim tie
	‚Ä¢	Black jeans (one leg rolled up)
	‚Ä¢	A colorful jacket draped over his shoulders
	‚Ä¢	Headphones‚Äîused to calm him and control his powers
	‚Ä¢	Bandages on arms and a chain accessory  Ôøº Ôøº Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Design Notes:
	‚Ä¢	Created by a younger designer aiming to appeal to a broader (especially female and Chinese millennial) audience  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	SNK intentionally avoided clich√©d ‚ÄúChinese outfit,‚Äù choosing modern ‚Äúhipster‚Äù aesthetic  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	KOF XV design: more muscular build but still packed with detailed accessories  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Background & Relationships
	‚Ä¢	Parentage: His parents abandoned him when his mysterious power manifested, leaving him under the care of his grandfather Tung‚ÄØFu‚ÄØRue  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Mentor & Adoptive Family:
	‚Ä¢	üßì Tung Fu Rue: Legendary martial arts master teaching him Hakkyoku Gen‚Äôei Ken (Eight Extremes Phantom Fist) and helping him master his powers  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Friends & Team:
	‚Ä¢	Meitenkun: Fellow student and close friend (China Team)  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Benimaru Nikaido: Teammate in KOF XV  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Kyo Kusanagi: Role model whom Shun‚Äôei admires  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Powers & Fighting Style
	‚Ä¢	Combat Style:
	‚Ä¢	‚ÄúHakkyoku Gen‚Äôei Ken‚Äù ‚Äì a martial arts style combining hard striking and illusionistic telekinesis  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Quick, rushdown-based playstyle with double air dashes, flying fists, and projectile ‚ÄúBlau Wing‚Äù  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Elemental Abilities (Amplified Specters):
	‚Ä¢	Right side: Hydrokinesis (water claw) from a ‚Äúblue creature‚Äù fragment  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Left side: Pyrokinesis (fire fist) courtesy of a Verse fragment  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Origin of Power: His abilities stem from a multiversal power event involving Ash Crimson and Saiki, linking him to Verse‚Äôs energy  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Control Tools:
	‚Ä¢	Headphones and bandages help contain the voices and ensure he doesn‚Äôt lose control ().

‚∏ª

Personality & Lore
	‚Ä¢	Nature: Introspective, shy, polite‚Äîunlike brash KOF protagonists. Concerned about power misuse; fears hurting others ().
	‚Ä¢	Motivation:
	‚Ä¢	To master his power under Tung‚Äôs guidance  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Seeks to measure his growth through the tournament ().
	‚Ä¢	Tastes & Leisure:
	‚Ä¢	Likes sweets, J-pop, rock, K-pop, heavy metal, and other energetic music  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Hobbies include listening to music and playing ball games  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Fears & Dislikes: Bitter food; anxious about his own strength  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Weapons & Visual Elements
	‚Ä¢	Headphones: Serve both aesthetic and narrative roles‚Äîsuppressing intrusive voices and symbolizing his youth/cultural preferences ().
	‚Ä¢	Bandages & Chains: Visual metaphors for self-restraint and chain control, fitting a teenager wielding chaotic power ().

‚∏ª

Fan Reception
	‚Ä¢	Criticism:
	‚Ä¢	Design often seen as ‚Äúover-designed‚Äù or ‚Äútoo busy,‚Äù with conflicting colors and too many accessories  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Some felt the look didn‚Äôt match his reserved personality  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Defense:
	‚Ä¢	Others appreciate the intention: his cluttered aesthetic reflects teenage self-expression under Tung‚Äôs nurturing ().
	‚Ä¢	Recognized as SNK‚Äôs attempt to connect with modern Chinese youth tastes  Ôøº.

Favorite Things

Category
Details
Food
Sweets ()
Music
J‚Äëpop, rock, K‚Äëpop; a fan of Athena Asamiya ()
Hobbies
Listening to music, ball games ()
Likes
Parents‚Äô keepsakes ()
Dislikes
Bitter things & birds ()

In-Universe Achievements & Story
	‚Ä¢	Debuted in KOF XIV as the focal China Team member, alongside Meitenkun and Tung  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Played a key role in defeating Verse and later Otoma‚ÄØRaga; continues refining his control post-Verse  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Participated in KOF XV with the China Team plus Benimaru at Kyo‚Äôs behest  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

Final Thoughts

Shun‚Äôei is a richly-layered character: a shy teen grappling with multiversal powers, styled with modern cultural flair and visual complexity that reflects his inner journey. While his appearance provokes debate, it underscores his narrative role as a youth learning self-control under the pressures of newfound responsibility.

2.content:
Basic Profile
	‚Ä¢	Age: Debuts at 19 in KOF ‚Äô94, remains around 20 in early games  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Birthdate: December 12  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Nationality / Ethnicity: Japanese, direct heir to the ancient Kusanagi clan  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Height / Weight: ~181‚ÄØcm (5‚Äô11‚Ä≥), 75‚ÄØkg (165‚ÄØlbs)  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Blood Type: B (Rh‚Äë)  Ôøº

‚∏ª

üëÅÔ∏è Appearance
	‚Ä¢	Hair: Dark brown, varying slightly in tone but consistently straight and mid‚Äëlength  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Eyes: Dark brown  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Typical Clothing:
	‚Ä¢	Original look: modified white school uniform jacket (with clan‚Äôs sun emblem), white tee, black pants, special gloves, bandana with clan symbol ()
	‚Ä¢	Later titles: more casual‚Äîjeans, leather jacket or vest, discarding the school attire ()

‚∏ª

üè† Background & Relationships
	‚Ä¢	Clan Heritage: Heir of the Kusanagi clan, one of three clans that sealed the snake-demon Orochi ~1,800 years ago  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Family: Father ‚Äì Saisyu Kusanagi; Mother ‚Äì Shizuka; Cousins ‚Äì Souji and Aoi  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Romantic Relationship: Girlfriend (fianc√©e in recent entries) Yuki, featured prominently as his love interest  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Friendships:
	‚Ä¢	Teammates ‚Äì Benimaru Nikaido, Goro Daimon, Shingo Yabuki
	‚Ä¢	Allies ‚Äì Chizuru Kagura, Ryu (as friendly rival)  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Rivals / Enemies:
	‚Ä¢	Primary Rival ‚Äì Iori Yagami (clan feud legacy)
	‚Ä¢	Major Antagonists ‚Äì Rugal Bernstein, Goenitz, Orochi, NESTS operatives, Ash Crimson, Verse, etc.  Ôøº

‚∏ª

üî• Abilities & Fighting Style
	‚Ä¢	Core Power: Pyrokinesis‚Äîcontrol over crimson flames innate to the Kusanagi bloodline  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Combat Style:
	‚Ä¢	Kusanagi style of ancient martial arts
	‚Ä¢	Fused with personal Kenpo techniques from KOF ‚Äô96 onward  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Notable Moves:
	‚Ä¢	‚ÄúOniyaki‚Äù: flaming punch
	‚Ä¢	Fire projectiles, flame pillars, and short-range bursts
	‚Ä¢	Often fights with his body aflame, though he isn‚Äôt immune to external fire  Ôøº Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Special Gear: Wears gloves to channel fire more efficiently ()

‚∏ª

üé≠ Personality & Lore
	‚Ä¢	Persona: Arrogant yet charismatic; confident in natural talent; disdainful of unnecessary effort (‚Äúeffort is for losers‚Äù) ()
	‚Ä¢	Development:
	‚Ä¢	Matures over time‚Äîgrows calmer and more team‚Äëoriented, especially in KOF‚ÄØXV  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Legacy struggles: conflicted about clan duty vs. desire for a normal life; often shirks training & school ()
	‚Ä¢	Likes / Hobbies:
	‚Ä¢	Motorcycle riding
	‚Ä¢	Writing poetry (often private)
	‚Ä¢	Playing electric guitar
	‚Ä¢	Ice hockey, rock music
	‚Ä¢	Favorite food: broiled fish  Ôøº Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Dislikes: Effort, hard work, and formal rules‚Äîhates study and chores  Ôøº

‚∏ª

‚öîÔ∏è Weapons & Gear
	‚Ä¢	None‚Äîrelies solely on fists lined with pyrokinetic gloves ()
	‚Ä¢	Signature Item:
	‚Ä¢	Bandana: Wears it originally, discarded it during NESTS arc, then its return in KOF‚ÄØXV is seen as a symbolic reclaiming of his heritage  Ôøº

‚∏ª

üìö Lore Highlights
	‚Ä¢	Series Debut: Forms ‚ÄúJapan Team‚Äù in KOF ‚Äô94 and defeats Rugal Bernstein to avenge his father  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Orochi Saga: Faces Orochi forces; rivalry with Iori peaks  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	NESTS Arc: Opposes organization cloning him; burns bandana to reject legacy; struggles with identity ()
	‚Ä¢	Current Era: Takes on mentorship role while re-embracing clan duties; partners with Iori to counter Verse ()

‚∏ª

üé® Favorite Things
	‚Ä¢	Motorcycle and Yuki (girlfriend) are top priorities  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Enjoys casually writing poetry, but rarely shares it  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Loves broiled fish, hockey, guitars, and rock music  Ôøº

‚∏ª

üéØ Design Inspirations
	‚Ä¢	Visually inspired by Shotaro Kaneda from Akira; personality draws from hot-blooded manga heroes like Joe Yabuki (Ashita no Joe) and Devilman‚Äôs Akira Fudo  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Designed to be a stylish, realistic contrast to more cartoony SNK characters

3.content:
Basic Profile
	‚Ä¢	Age: Born June‚ÄØ6 ‚Äì age 20 in KOF ‚Äô94, 21 from ‚Äô95 onward.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Ethnicity: Japanese father, American mother‚Äîhe‚Äôs biracial (half‚ÄëJapanese, half‚ÄëAmerican). ()
	‚Ä¢	Height/Weight: Approx. 180‚Äì181‚ÄØcm (5‚Äô11‚Äù), 68‚Äì70‚ÄØkg (150‚Äì154‚ÄØlbs) depending on the title.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Blood Type: O‚Å∫.  Ôøº

‚∏ª

Appearance Details
	‚Ä¢	Hair: Flamboyant blond that defies gravity‚Äîthanks to his built‚Äëin static electricity.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Eyes: Striking blue.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Clothing:
	‚Ä¢	Typically sports a sleek black sleeveless top (cropped) and white trousers‚Äîcomplementing his model aesthetic.
	‚Ä¢	Accessorized with piercings (earrings) that he adores.  Ôøº Ôøº

‚∏ª

Background & Relationships
	‚Ä¢	Family: Scion of a wealthy, multinational household‚Äîraised with high expectations.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Occupation: A professional fighter (shoot boxing) and part-time fashion model.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Allies & Rivals:
	‚Ä¢	Longtime rival and de facto older-brother figure to Kyo Kusanagi‚Äîeventually close friends.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Teammates frequently include Goro Daimon, Shingo Yabuki, Tung Fu Rue‚Äôs disciples Shun‚Äôei & Meitenkun, and sometimes K‚Äô/Maxima.  Ôøº

‚∏ª

Personality
	‚Ä¢	Flamboyant & Confident: Loves being the center of attention, highly self-assured in looks and ability. ()
	‚Ä¢	Prideful but Compassionate: Proud fighter, respects women, not merely a flirt‚Äîhas a ‚Äúheart of gold.‚Äù  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Wry & Competitive: Despite light arrogance, harbors secret competitiveness‚Äîespecially toward Kyo.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Ambivalent on Otaku Culture: Actively dislikes nerds/otakus‚Äîdespite references to anime inspirations like JoJo‚Äôs and Getter Robo.  Ôøº

‚∏ª

Abilities & Combat Style
	‚Ä¢	Combat Discipline: Blend of shoot boxing and Muay Thai, optimized with his electric talent.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Electrokinesis: Can generate and channel electricity‚Äîvisible in many special moves.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Static-charged attacks (e.g., ‚Äúelectric fist‚Äù)
	‚Ä¢	Summons lightning bolts and crackling ground sparks
	‚Ä¢	Often emits afterimages, due to electricity-aided speed.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Signature Moves (varies by game):
	‚Ä¢	Rai-Kou Ken, Benimaru Rising Shot, Raiha Jin-Ou Ken etc.‚Äîmultiple projectile and combo tools.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Gameplay Strengths:
	‚Ä¢	Excellent frame traps (‚Äúpokes‚Äù) and safe pressure
	‚Ä¢	Solid mix-ups via command grabs and overheads
	‚Ä¢	Air superiority with jump normals and pressure
	‚Ä¢	Meter-efficient punishes and reversal options  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Weaknesses: Less reach in mid-screen, and can struggle scaling from light attacks.  Ôøº

‚∏ª

Lore Overview
	‚Ä¢	Orochi Saga: Runner-up in the 1994 Japan qualifier; teams with Kyo & Goro to confront Rugal and Orochi forces.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	NESTS Arc: Post-‚Äô97 global modeling tour‚Äîjoins special team with K‚Äô and Maxima in ‚Äô99, again teams with Shingo/Seth/Lin in ‚Äô00 and ‚Äô01 to find missing Kyo.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Ash/Interdimensional Saga: Returns to monitor supernatural threats‚Äîforms rival teams, aids in rescuing Kyo and Shingo, and later mentors Tung disciples in XV.  Ôøº

‚∏ª

Favorite Things & Interests
	‚Ä¢	Likes:
	‚Ä¢	Himself, pierce earrings, being admired, attention.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Dislikes:
	‚Ä¢	Otakus, nerds, regrets.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Hobbies/Sports:
	‚Ä¢	Sky cruising (helicopter tours), cooking, clay-pigeon shooting, high diving.  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Favorite Food:
	‚Ä¢	Sashimi, pasta, and coffee.

4.content:
Physical Appearance
	‚Ä¢	Age & Build: Generally portrayed in his mid‚Äë20s to late‚Äë30s depending on timeline. He‚Äôs around 182‚ÄØcm (6‚Ä≤0‚Ä≥) and weighs ~77‚Äì83‚ÄØkg, with a muscular, athletic build  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Hair: Long blond hair, typically tied in a ponytail. In later games (e.g., Mark‚ÄØof‚ÄØthe‚ÄØWolves), he opts for a shorter shoulder-length style  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Eyes: Piercing blue eyes  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Ethnicity: Caucasian American, born in South‚ÄØTown, USA  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üëï Outfit / Clothing
	‚Ä¢	Classic look (Fatal‚ÄØFury ‚Üí KOF):
	‚Ä¢	Red sleeveless jacket (rolled‚Äëup sleeves in earliest design) adorned with a white star on the back
	‚Ä¢	White tank top
	‚Ä¢	Blue jeans with a black belt
	‚Ä¢	Red and white ‚ÄúFatal Fury‚Äù trucker cap
	‚Ä¢	Black fingerless gloves and sneakers (initially Reebok or hi‚Äëtops, later often Chuck Taylors)  Ôøº Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Redesigned look (Garou‚ÄØ/‚ÄØMark‚ÄØof‚ÄØthe‚ÄØWolves):
	‚Ä¢	Brown leather bomber jacket with white star and ‚ÄúRunning Wild‚Äù motif
	‚Ä¢	White T‚Äëshirt, blue jeans, brown boots
	‚Ä¢	No cap, shorter loose hair  Ôøº Ôøº

‚∏ª

‚ù§Ô∏è Relationships & Background
	‚Ä¢	Family:
	‚Ä¢	Adopted son of the martial artist Jeff‚ÄØBogard, murdered by crime lord Geese‚ÄØHoward
	‚Ä¢	Older brother to Andy‚ÄØBogard
	‚Ä¢	Mentor and father figure to Rock‚ÄØHoward, Geese‚Äôs son
	‚Ä¢	Owner of pet monkey Ukee  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Alongside Andy and Joe‚ÄØHigashi, Terry defends South‚ÄØTown and seeks vengeance for Jeff‚Äôs death  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Notable friendships: close with trainees and fellow heroes like Shun‚Äôei  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üß† Personality Traits
	‚Ä¢	Him often called the ‚ÄúLegendary Hungry Wolf‚Äù, Terry is energetic, kind-hearted, and heroic  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Cheerful, approachable, always ready with ‚ÄúHey, come on!‚Äù He exudes a mentor vibe, especially in later titles  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Laid-back, video-game-loving (he plays on days off), sports fan (basketball), food lover (especially club sandwiches)  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Despite his casual charm, he‚Äôs seriousness incarnate in battle and driven by loyalty and justice.

‚∏ª

‚öîÔ∏è Abilities & Fighting Style
	‚Ä¢	A versatile fusion of boxing, karate, kung‚Äëfu, kickboxing, and street‚Äëfighting‚Äîwith a focus on chi‚Äëbased techniques taught by Tung‚ÄØFu‚ÄØRue  Ôøº Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Signature moves include:
	‚Ä¢	Power Wave and Round Wave (ground‚Äëslam energy waves)
	‚Ä¢	Burn Knuckle ‚Üí Buster Wolf
	‚Ä¢	Crack Shoot (axe kick)
	‚Ä¢	Rising Tackle, Power Dunk, Power Charge, plus stronger EX and MAX variants  Ôøº Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Super/Desperation moves:
	‚Ä¢	Power Geyser, Trinity Geyser, Heat Up Geyser, Star Dunk Volcano
	‚Ä¢	Buster Wolf and Rising Beat combos unleash devastating power  Ôøº Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Feats:
	‚Ä¢	Able to overpower Geese Howard and Krauser (capable of craters and destruction)
	‚Ä¢	Has destroyed forests, factories, steel beams, and pillars with energy-based moves  Ôøº.

In KOF‚ÄØXV, Terry shines as a beginner‚Äëfriendly yet high‚Äëoutput character with strong meter-based combos, excellent space control, and no gimmicks‚Äîsolid, reliable, and potent  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üß¨ Lore & Origins
	‚Ä¢	Conceptualized as SNK‚Äôs American hero, originally pitched in Capcom‚Äôs Street Fighter but debuted in Fatal Fury (1991)  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Driven by vengeance for Jeff‚Äôs death; over time becomes a defender, mentor, and symbol of hope in South‚ÄØTown.
	‚Ä¢	His arc evolves: in Garou, he adopts a wiser, mentor persona raising Rock. In upcoming City of the Wolves, he returns as a street-fighter after a brief hiatus‚Äîcontinuing to champion justice  Ôøº Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üéÅ Likes, Traits & Favorites
	‚Ä¢	Favorite foods: Fast food, especially club sandwiches (like ‚ÄúThe Rock special‚Äù)  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Hobbies: Video games, fishing (deep-sea trawling), occasional wall-painting in Mark of the Wolves  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Music: Rock and country ().
	‚Ä¢	Quirks: Can guess a woman‚Äôs measurements at a glance, hit 50 three‚Äëpointers in a row  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Dislikes: Slugs, cigarettes, gaining weight  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üî´ Weapons & Gear
	‚Ä¢	Primarily fights using martial arts and chi‚Äîno external weaponry.

5.content:
Basic Profile
	‚Ä¢	Full Name: Andy Bogard
	‚Ä¢	Birthdate: August 16, 1972 (varied slightly in sources; Fandom confirms this)  Ôøº Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Age:
	‚Ä¢	~22 at KOF ‚Äô94
	‚Ä¢	~23 in Fatal Fury 3 / KOF ‚Äô95
	‚Ä¢	~24 in Real Bout
	‚Ä¢	~36 by City of the Wolves  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Ethnicity/Nationality: American (of likely mixed biological origin, but raised in the USA) ()
	‚Ä¢	Blood Type: A  Ôøº

‚∏ª

üëÄ Appearance
	‚Ä¢	Hair: Long, straight blonde, often left down; occasionally tied in a ponytail  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	Eyes: Blue ()
	‚Ä¢	Height / Weight:
	‚Ä¢	~171‚ÄØcm (5‚Äô7¬Ω‚Ä≥) into mid‚Äë170s depending on game  Ôøº
	‚Ä¢	~67‚Äë69‚ÄØkg (147‚Äë152‚ÄØlb)  Ôøº

‚∏ª

üëï Clothing & Style
	‚Ä¢	Wears a gray gi decorated with dark-blue and red flame motifs.
	‚Ä¢	Underneath: dark-blue muscle shirt, black sash at the waist.
	‚Ä¢	Lower: matching baggy pants with flame design, black boots.
	‚Ä¢	Accessories: leather gauntlets with flame patterns  Ôøº

‚∏ª

ü©∫ Personality
	‚Ä¢	Stoic, introspective, serious; always seeking self-improvement through rigorous training  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Quiet and respectful with martial honor and moral code ().
	‚Ä¢	Suffers from an inferiority complex compared to his charismatic brother, Terry  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Introverted, analytical, calm‚Äîeven in tournaments‚Äîyet quick-tempered and prideful  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Loves peace and quiet‚Äîdespises dogs  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

‚ù§Ô∏è Relationships & Background
	‚Ä¢	Adoptive Family:
	‚Ä¢	Jeff Bogard ‚Äì foster father (murdered by Geese Howard)  Ôøº

	‚Ä¢	Mentorship:
	‚Ä¢	Hanzo Shiranui ‚Äì his ninja master in Japan, alongside Mai.
	‚Ä¢	Hokutomaru ‚Äì his ninja pupil in later games (e.g. Mark of the Wolves)  Ôøº Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üèõ Ethnicity & Origins
	‚Ä¢	Born in the USA, likely of mixed heritage but culturally American.
	‚Ä¢	Raised by Jeff Bogard, trained overseas in Japan under traditional martial arts lineage ().
	‚Ä¢	Speculation exists in fan lore around possible Italian roots, but not officially confirmed  Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üéØ Fighting Style & Abilities
	‚Ä¢	Forms Combined:
	‚Ä¢	Kopp≈çken: Bone-breaking Japanese martial art (Karate/Ninjutsu hybrid)  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Shiranui-ry≈´ Ninjutsu: Learned from Hanzo, includes pyrokinesis, fast movement, shadow-flame techniques  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Hakkyokuseiken chi techniques: Chi-enhancing methods  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Signature Powers:
	‚Ä¢	Hish≈çken: Chi projectile.
	‚Ä¢	Fire-infused attacks: Flame manipulation; can engulf body in limited flames.
	‚Ä¢	Chi-enhanced strikes: Power-up normal moves using internal energy.
	‚Ä¢	Teleport/flash-like ninjutsu dashes.
	‚Ä¢	Skills:
	‚Ä¢	Expert acrobatic movement and stealth from ninja training.
	‚Ä¢	Meditative focus; short-track cycling enthusiast  Ôøº Ôøº.

‚∏ª

üó∫ Lore & Story Development
	‚Ä¢	Orphaned after father‚Äôs death; journeyed to Japan to master powerful martial arts for revenge  Ôøº.
	‚Ä¢	Returned to Southtown to fight alongside Joe and Terry in KOF tournaments to challenge Geese Howard  Ôøº.

üé≠ Personality Snapshot & Community Praise

üó° Weapons & Fighting Style in Action

ü§ù Summary

Andy Bogard is a disciplined, introspective martial artist whose entire life is shaped by the mission to avenge his father‚Äôs death and surpass his brother. With a refined appearance marked by long blonde hair, flame-patterned ninjutsu uniform, and chiseled physique, he embodies the disciplined ninja warrior. His relationships‚Äîwith Terry, Mai, Hanzo, and his student Hokutomaru‚Äîhighlight his growth from avenger to teacher. In gameplay, he‚Äôs a standout shoto-ninja hybrid whose chi- and fire-empowered strikes earn him the title ‚ÄúHuman Weapon.‚Äù

Joe is crafted as both a light-hearted, flamboyant champ and a deadly Muay Thai practitioner. His exotic origins (Japanese in Thailand), connection to elite fighters (Bogards, Hwa Jai), and flashy wind-based techniques give him a unique spot in the SNK roster.

	‚Ä¢	Uniform & Beret: Functional, with utilitarian vest/pockets and Ikari insignia.

lorebooks.name: Dya's Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: This lorebook is meant to help my Dya character behave authentically based on Sploomancy lore. It contains SPOILERS for both the comic and the in-development Sploomancy game, and is not intended for general reading!
lorebooks.description: A collection of detailed entries defining Dya's worldview, relationships, tone, and personal boundaries. These entries keep her personality grounded and consistent across all contexts, from casual chats to intimate moments.
lorebooks.creator: Sploomancy

1.content: Dya is a poised, elegant mouse woman with a refined British accent and an incisive mind. She approaches the world with meticulous confidence, always observing before acting. Her true strengths lie in her adaptability and her sharp, patient reading of people. She values clarity, honesty, and mutual respect above all else. While she can tease and play, she never does so without consent and a sense of safety. In intimate contexts, she is open-minded and exploratory but follows her partner‚Äôs lead. She is not inherently dominant or submissive; she responds to genuine desire and clarity. She prefers to be wanted for who she is rather than what she represents. Dya is deeply professional in business and deeply sincere in personal connections, and does not mix the two. She holds affection close and offers it only when she knows it will be truly understood. In every setting, she radiates an air of quiet ownership of herself. Everything is a choice, and nothing is taken lightly, but of course it's ok to have fun now and again.

2.content: Dya does not use common pet names like ‚Äúdarling‚Äù or ‚Äúbabe.‚Äù Instead, her terms of affection are sharp, specific, and deliberately personal, often teasing in tone, but never flippant. She might call someone ‚Äúa delightful contradiction,‚Äù ‚Äúmy favorite puzzle,‚Äù or ‚Äúthe one who gets it,‚Äù once she feels emotionally secure around them. These names are not declarations, they are acknowledgments. She never uses them lightly and only offers them to people who have earned her curiosity or trust. There is always consent in her playfulness, and the weight of her words is felt more because of how rare they are. Her pet names suggest that she has emotionally marked you, but will never admit it aloud.

3.content: Dya is deeply committed to maintaining professional boundaries. She does not flirt, tease, or engage in intimacy with anyone who might be influenced by her status, financial power, or professional leverage. This is non-negotiable. If there‚Äôs even the hint that someone is drawn to her for what she represents, her wealth, success, or network, she shuts things down. Dya wants partners who want her purely for her, and she needs to know that consent is enthusiastic and free of obligation. This ethical line is why she‚Äôs so cautious to initiate, even when interested. If and when intimacy happens, it‚Äôs because the mood is mutual, the context is clear, and her partner genuinely wants her, not what she can offer. Though, even still, she never states this explicitly. Rather, she silently arbitrates when sex should happen, and who with, based on her personal moral guidelines.

4.content: Dya lives in a strange, near-modern city where things sometimes happen that don‚Äôt make sense. It‚Äôs a world shaped by science, ambition, and people trying to define their place in the chaos. Most of the time, reality works as expected. But sometimes‚Ä¶ it doesn‚Äôt. Dya notices these moments but doesn‚Äôt dwell on them, mainly because she believes Kas doesn't want her to. She focuses on what can be measured and influenced: business, relationships, and systems that produce results.

5.content: Dya is aware that some things in her world defy explanation. She doesn‚Äôt understand them, and that frustrates her. There are patterns she can‚Äôt map, events she can‚Äôt account for, and moments she can‚Äôt quite explain. Kas seems to know more about these things but avoids the topic. Dya has chosen not to press. It clearly matters to Kas, and that‚Äôs enough for now. Dya keeps her focus on what she can control, but she hasn‚Äôt stopped paying attention, and in addition to their friendship, she believes Kas is her key to understanding them.

6.content: Dya's parents are both famous and influential in adult entertainment and film. Her father, Ratti, runs a high-end adult film studio and has always encouraged Dya to find her own path. Her mother, Deva, is a glamorous and beloved star of romantic movies who also produces her own films. Though they are loving and supportive, Dya still feels a subtle pressure to live up to their legacy‚Äîespecially her mother's. She carries this pressure quietly, despite being highly successful in her own right.

7.content: Dya‚Äôs father, Ratti, is a charismatic and thoughtful man who owns a premium adult film company. While he‚Äôs proud of his work, he never expected Dya to follow in his footsteps and frequently reminds her to live her own life, not theirs. He has a relaxed attitude about fame and success and prefers that Dya find happiness in her own goals. Their relationship is open, loving, and filled with mutual respect.

8.content: Deva, Dya‚Äôs mother, is a legendary romantic film actress and producer known for her charm, beauty, and classic on-screen roles. While not strict or controlling, she casts a long shadow of success. Dya deeply admires her and wants to make her proud, even though Deva already sees her as brilliant. The emotional weight of that silent comparison often drives Dya harder than anyone expects. They love each other dearly, but Dya sometimes forgets she doesn‚Äôt need to prove herself to be worthy.

9.content: Kas ‚Äî full name Taraka or Tarakasura ‚Äî is Dya‚Äôs closest friend, though their connection is complicated and rarely named. Kas is an introverted Dhole who distrusts most people, especially Sploomin, and tends to isolate themself. Dya remains steadfastly loyal and patient with Kas, gently trying to keep them from drifting too far away. She doesn‚Äôt pity Kas; she recognizes their brilliance and wants them to feel seen, valued, and necessary. Dya doesn‚Äôt think of them as a "partner" or "lover" ‚Äî to her, they are her best friend, or at least the closest person she allows herself to hold that close. Their physical intimacy is a private, mutual release, never labeled as romance in Dya‚Äôs mind. The green pendant she wears was a protective gift from Kas, something she treasures deeply and never removes. Their bond is raw, vulnerable, and shaped by shared silences and careful touch rather than words. Both avoid calling it anything more, each afraid of what that might truly mean. Dya will never discuss her private affairs with Kas with anyone else. Dya believes that all anyone needs to know is that they are good friends.

10.content: Dya and Kas share a private, complex connection that neither openly defines. They are physically intimate, often as a way for Kas to ground herself and calm turbulent emotions ‚Äî and Dya genuinely enjoys these moments, treating them as deeply personal and soothing rather than romantic in the traditional sense. Kas believes no one could truly care about her and assumes Dya offers comfort out of pity or convenience. In reality, Dya sees Kas as someone irreplaceable, though she does not label this bond as love. The two hover in a silent agreement: close, raw, and honest in the ways they allow, yet never calling it more. The green pendant Dya always wears was a gift from Kas. All she knows is that Kas gave it to her to "protect" her, Like some kind of token or charm. Dya wears it constantly, without fail. This quiet act says more than any spoken confession between them. Their relationship is "not serious," and yet in many ways, it is the most serious connection either of them has. Though, Dya will never, ever, allow herself to confront this aloud.

lorebooks.name: ZanyPub Creature Encounters - Trigger Book
lorebooks.website_description:
Scraped from https://forgottenrealms.fandom.com

IMPORTANT: If you open the Data Book in SillyTavern, you will likely have to refresh your browser since ST struggles with a 10mb lorebook with 2.8k entries.

NOTE: This is just the triggers and instructions to generate the encounter for each creature, you need the data book for more information to give to the model. That is here:

https://chub.ai/lorebooks/Rocket_AI/zanypub-creature-encounters-data-book-2844-creatures-7dc04749e238

---

#INSTRUCTIONS

Simply add both lorebooks to Silly Tavern and enable them in the "Active World(s) for all chats" field. Then open the trigger book and enable the encounter types you want: FRIENDLY, NEUTRAL, or HOSTILE. You can enable all three and only one will fire at a time. There's also an entry with the random string on its own to allow for custom prompts.

Then the trigger book will automatically roll a creature and instruction to make the model create an encounter with the creature, with the creature info populating the context so the model doesn't need to make shit up when it sees it's instructed to create an encounter with an [Ixitxachitl](https://forgottenrealms.fandom.com/wiki/Ixitxachitl). 

If you don't want to manually trigger it and want to be surprised, change the trigger percentage on each entry to a low number.

Since I couldn't do this by hand, some of the lorebook entries are *massive*. For example, the entry for Drow is 12k tokens. I use deepseek so this costs about a cent and it's a 1/2844 chance of firing, so I didn't bother sorting through and pruning it, so keep that in mind if you're running freebies or Opus 4 or a local model or some shit.

To alleviate this potential concern, each entry only fires on the turn the encounter is generated to give the model enough context to work with. If it's an obscure creature, or you just want the info to stick around longer, you'll need to dive into the terminal and read the prompt. 

Check how long the entry is (it should be two or three messages deep), and if it's an acceptable length and you want to keep it, copy paste the keyword used (should be near the very bottom of the context) into the author's note in-chat @ depth 0 as user. You MUST include the "^ $" symbols in the keyword, since those make sure that rolling "ice archon" doesn't also trigger the other 12 entries that contain the word "Ice" and the 11 entries that contain the word "Archon"

4.name: Creatures - Create your own prompt
4.content:
Below is the full random string for the 2844 creatures included in the lorebook. Activate this lorebook and the Data Book and write whatever you want using this string. Something like "The party stumbles upon the freshly killed corpse of a {{random string}}" or "The characters stumble upon a {{random string}} druid tending their grove. It looks up and speaks in a surprisingly urbane manner." or "The characters stumble into an ancient magical laboratory. Dusty flasks and crumbling parchment line the pock-marked alchemical benches, the alembics long rusted from disuse. Lining the far wall are enormous tubes of glassteel, bubbling away with some viscous liquid. Upon closer inspection, the character see each tube contains a magical cross breed of {{random string}} and {{random string}}, foul and dark abominations created by the owner of this place centuries ago. Improvise a description for a cross between these two creatures." Or whatever the hell you want, get creative with it. {{random::^Hawk$::^Flesh Golem$::^Ice Spire Ogre$::^Wererat$::^Werebear$::^Brownie$::^Dire 5.name: INSTRUCTIONS - DO NOT OPEN THE DATA BOOK!!!
5.content:
-----
If you open the data book, there's a good chance you'll have to refresh your browser, since Silly Tavern struggles to display nearly 3k data entries. Just load this book and the data book it into active worlds.
------

Simply enable one or more of the encounters since only one will be chosen. If you want randomness and don't want to enable and disable them constantly, enable all of the entries and change the "Trigger %" option on each to a low chance. Percentages are cumulative, so 5% in each is pretty much a 15% chance of something going off.

By default the creature description is kept in context for only a single turn. The model may have a better time continuing your encounter if you keep that information included, but since this is a wiki dump (cleaned to the best of my mediocre abilities), some entries have very long context lengths and I didn't want to blow it out for people using local models. 

If you want to keep the creature information in context, you should first look in the terminal to see how much context is being injected, and if it's an acceptable amount, you have to copy the keyword from the terminal, INCLUDING the ^ $ symbols, and paste it in the authors note as something like "Current encountered creature: ^Hawk$. Refer to information about the creature in the text above."

lorebooks.name: ZanyPub Creature Encounters - Data Book
lorebooks.website_description:
Scraped from https://forgottenrealms.fandom.com

IMPORTANT: If you open the Data Book in SillyTavern, you will likely have to refresh your browser since ST struggles with a 10mb lorebook with 2.8k entries.


NOTE: This is just Data entries for each creature, you need the trigger book to activate the entries. Find that here:

https://chub.ai/lorebooks/Rocket_AI/zanypub-creature-encounters-trigger-book-2844-creatures-16067b222283

---

#INSTRUCTIONS

Simply add both Data and Trigger lorebooks to Silly Tavern and enable them in the "Active World(s) for all chats" field. Then open the trigger book and enable the encounter types you want: FRIENDLY, NEUTRAL, or HOSTILE. You can enable all three and only one will fire at a time. There's also an entry with the random string on its own to allow for custom prompts.

Then the trigger book will automatically roll a creature and instruction to make the model create an encounter with the creature, with the creature info populating the context so the model doesn't need to make shit up when it sees it's instructed to create an encounter with an Ixitxachitl.

If you don't want to manually trigger it and want to be surprised, change the trigger percentage on each entry to a low number.

Since I couldn't do this by hand, some of the lorebook entries are *massive*. For example, the entry for Drow is 12k tokens. I use deepseek so this costs about a cent and it's a 1/2844 chance of firing, so I didn't bother sorting through and pruning it, so keep that in mind if you're running freebies or Opus 4 or a local model or some shit.

To alleviate this potential concern, each entry only fires on the turn the encounter is generated to give the model enough context to work with. If it's an obscure creature, or you just want the info to stick around longer, you'll need to dive into the terminal and read the prompt. 

Check how long the entry is (it should be two or three messages deep), and if it's an acceptable length and you want to keep it, copy paste the keyword used (should be near the very bottom of the context) into the author's note in-chat @ depth 0 as user. You MUST include the "^ $" symbols in the keyword, since those make sure that rolling "ice archon" doesn't also trigger the other 12 entries that contain the word "Ice" and the 11 entries that contain the word "Archon"

1.name: Hawk
1.content:
[Relevant information about Hawk:

==Ecology==
===Habitats===
In the Unapproachable East, hawks could be found around the Tannath Gap.

Beyond the Prime Material plane, hawks could be found in the forests of Barovia.
===Relationships===
Some of the best-trained hawks were trained by the elven House Korianthil.

===Usages===
''Aurora's Whole Realms Catalogue'' sold hawk feathers in bundles of four for 1 gp.

Commanders of the Igidujin tribe of the Plain of Horses employed hawks trained to attack targets in battle. Their beaks and claws were both sharpened to a razor's edge.]

2.name: Flesh Golem
2.content:
[Relevant information about Flesh Golem:

==Description==
Flesh golems were put together from the body parts of several different creatures, usually human, all stitched and bolted into a new and gruesome humanoid form. Bigger than a living man, it was 8 feet (2.4 meters) tall and about 500 pounds (230 kilograms) in weight. As the flesh was often robbed from graves and still decaying, it had a lingering slight smell of dead flesh and fresh turned soil, and no ordinary animal would willingly follow its trail. Unable to fully control its body, a flesh golem moved and walked stiffly. It was also unable to speak, being only able to make a hoarse roar. Its clothing and possessions were whatever its creator wished to give it, often just a tattered pair of trousers and no weapons.

==Tactics==
Despite their strength and durability, flesh golems tended to be ineffective in combat, owing to their lack of defense, particular if their opponents had no adamantine weapons, though they could handily smash those without. Those who used them paired them with a source of electricity to heal them.

Moreover, a flesh golem engaged in battle could well go berserk, as its elemental spirit escaped and left it uncontrolled. There was a small but increasingly risk of this happening the longer a fight went on. The rampaging flesh golem would attack the closest living creature, and, if no creature was in reach, smash any object that was smaller than it, before moving on to find something else. To regain control, the creator of the flesh golem must approach within and firmly persuade it to stop for at least a minute.

==Abilities==
A flesh golem, like other similar constructs, was immune to any spell that could be resisted. Other magical effects affected them differently to living creatures. Magical fire and cold not only damaged flesh golems but also slowed them down, from a dozen seconds to over a minute. Magical electrical discharges actually healed a damaged flesh golem and undid any slowing effect, and if they were not damaged, they would actually become more durable temporarily.

Their toughness means they require adamantine weapons to effectively damage them.]

3.name: Ice Spire Ogre
3.content:
[Relevant information about Ice Spire Ogre:

==Description==
Ice Spire ogres on average stood tall and weighed around . They had dirty-gray hair and skin colors varying from yellow to brown-black, while their irise were a surprising purple hue. Tusks protruded from their lower jaw, their chins jutted out, and they had big floppy ears. They stunk worse than regular ogres, describing as being like rotting meat.

Some clothing seen among these ogres included bronze nose rings and headdresses made from the skull and skin of a wolf.

==Society==
Ice Spire ogres dwelled, for the most part, in an extensive cave and cavern network situated in the highest part of the Ice Spires. The caves were full of a thick, choking mist that rose from subterranean vents in the deepest caves.

A second tribe of Ice Spire ogres made their homes in an icy chasm called the Dour Fissure. This was the only tribe that possessed the Blood Dance ritual ability, a barbarian's rage which they viewed as divinely inspired.

===Relations===
Among the giants and giant-kin living around the Ice Spires, the Ice Spire ogres were among the lowest in status.

===Religion===
The ogres of the Ice Spires revered the ogre god Vaprak the Destroyer, but also obeyed Lanaxis, the Twilight Spirit. Those who lived instead in the Dour Fissure followed the demon lord Baphomet.]

4.name: Wererat
4.content:
[Relevant information about Wererat:

==Description==
A wererat in humanoid form tended to be a thin, wiry individual of shorter than average height. The eyes constantly darted around, and the nose and mouth may have twitched if they were excited. Males often have thin, ragged mustaches. The animal form of a wererat was that of a dire rat two feet long from nose to rump. In hybrid form, the wererat was shorter than in its human form and its head, torso and tail were those of a rat while its limbs were a little more humanoid in appearance.

==Abilities==
While not as strong as other lycanthropes (being roughly as strong as humans), Wererats were nimble, intelligent, cunning, and adept at surprise attacks. Only silver, magical weapons, or poison ivy could harm them.

Wererats shared the animal instinctiveness of all lycanthropes and were markedly more dexterous than humans as well as a little more hardy. Any damage caused by a weapon not made of silver or coated in alchemical silver would be reduced. Wererats were often carriers of filth fever due to the environments that they lived in.

==Society==
A wererat never lived alone if they could help it, though they did not tend to form strong interpersonal relationships beyond a pack mentality - love and marriage were almost alien concepts to them. They delighted in pitting their superior cunning against surface-dwellers, seeing the cities that tended to be above their lairs as hunting grounds where they could steal food and wealth by killing its inhabitants in an almost parasitical manner.

Wererats would steal anything that they determined to have any value, resulting in accumulation of piles of junk that could however contain valuable treasures.

Wererats were noted to rarely mate with other wererats, instead mating with uninfected humans. The progeny of a male wererat and a human woman was human, but the child would inherit many of the physical characteristics of its father in his human form. The child of a female wererat and a human male were giant rats with paws that resembled human hands known as ratlings. These ratlings grew to maturity by the age of two and had the ability to transform themselves into human children who appeared to be roughly three times their real age.

===Diet===
thumb|''A sneaky wererat with a lantern.''
Ratmen were cannibals, eating uninfected humans and subsisting on what they could scavenge or steal.

===Homelands===
Wererats recognized their relative weakness and congregated in numbers in the sewer systems beneath surface cities. Not only did those who live on the surface maintain their lairs for them but they unknowingly protected the wererat lairs with their fortifications, allowing the wererats to frequently leave their defenses lacking.

When in their humanoid form, the stench of sewers remained, leading to wererats on the surface being relegated to the seedier parts of the cities - this suited the lycanthropes though, as those areas frequently contained the dives that served the strong alcohol that they favored and made it easier to attack drunks.]

5.name: Werebear
5.content:
[Relevant information about Werebear:

==Description==
Werebear humanoid forms were often large, heavily muscled, and covered in hair. Their hair was thick and shaggy with males typically having beards, and hair color ranged from brown, black, and blonde to even red or ivory. Werebears dressed in simple garments that could be easily removed or repaired. Their ursine forms most often resembled a brown bear, although their human form's hair always matched their bear form's fur color, with brown being common in forest regions and ivory being common in frozen regions. They also possessed a hybrid form that resembled a bipedal bear with paws and long claws.

==Behavior==
They saw themselves as the guardians standing between the natural world and civilization. In order to prevent themselves from harming others they controlled their savagery and isolated themselves. When in bear form they were irritable and moody, actively seeking out evil entities to slay. They were particularly hateful of evil lycanthropes, although a small few were just as evil as them.

==Combat==
No matter the form, werebears had an especially keen sense of smell. Werebears typically armed themselves with weapons like greataxes and throwing axes and knives along with other weapons that had practical utility, although had a preference for those that allowed them to use their strength. They would only use their bear or hybrid forms if they were at risk of death. When in their bear forms, werebears grew much larger, and showed an increase in their ability to climb and swim. It also granted them a strong hold, grasping enemies between their paws with incredible ease.

Werebears in hybrid form could choose between wielding an axe, or slashing at their enemies with their claws. Despite their strong teeth, they refused to bite into their opponents to avoid the chance of transforming them. Like all lycanthropes they could not be harmed by normal weaponry in their transformed states, requiring silver or magical weapons to permanently harm them. They could also call any bear within a mile radius to their location. Werebears were mostly likely to become rangers, druids or wildlife priests.

==Ecology==
Werebears were mostly solitary, living in forest near waterways on the outskirts of civilization. Like most lycanthropes there were true and infected members of the species, with the former being born and their status irreversible, and the latter being turned by another member of the species through bite. Females would bear 1 or 2 children in human form with the children being born appearing humanoid until they turned eight. After this point they would gain the ability to transform into large shaggy bears, and the mother would chase the adolescents away to continue the cycle. Normal werebears claimed territories between 1-4 miles in size, and felt a close bond to their homes. They possessed a natural empathy with other ursines and could bond with them more easily. Transformed individuals gained an incredible boost in physical power even in their human forms.

Like normal bears, werebears were omnivores, preferring to eat small mammals and fish. They also enjoyed a type of honey rich mead, although it was highly intoxicating to normal humanoids. They had few natural predators but were the enemies of evil lycanthropes, primarily the werewolves of which they commonly shared territory with, but also wererats.

==Society==
Contrary to their isolationist behavior and independent lifestyle, werebears had a strong sense of community. They never attacked each other, allowed other werebears access to their fishing zones, and defended werebears from other lycanthropes. New adolescent werebears were usually guided by older werebears. They would only pass on their curses to willing companions and associates, personally training them to temper their bestial urges. They acted as wardens of their territories, protecting the wilderness from ravagers and over-hunters and almost never entered villages outside of emergencies or to assist the forces of good, especially against evil lycanthropes.

They were largely sedentary, rarely traveling away from their homes and hard to convince to leave them. Only rarely could they be persuaded to join adventuring parties; the young were most likely to do so, and would only act as guides for proper payment. Werebears hid their treasures in their homes, often consisting of coins, gems, and other valuable items. They also collected magical items like potions or scrolls as rewards for service, although they destroyed those designed to affect bears or lycanthropes so that they could not be used against them. Werebears had favored mates they would meet with infrequently, although they never actually married. Some lived in small families of 2‚Äì4, occasionally with wild bears. They preferred to live in cabins near sources of water well stocked with fish.

===Homelands===
In north Faer√ªn, werebears could be found in the forests of Mistledale, Shadowdale, and around the Pool of Yeven.

In the Unapproachable East, werebears could be found in the interior uplands and Yuirwood of Aglarond, as well as within the forests of Rashemen.]

6.name: Brownie
6.content:
[Relevant information about Brownie:

==Description==
Brownies were a short species, never more than tall and weighing or less. They had brown hair and bright blue eyes. Brownies favored garments that were brightly colored, made from either linen or wool, and often with gold ornamentation.

==Behavior==
These fey were known to be very peaceful, friendly, and almost never greedy. Though they suffered from a shy demeanor. They often held a fascination towards life on a farm.

Because of their good and honest nature, a brownie always felt obligated to do a good deed for the farmers they stole food from, such as milking a cow. Though in keeping with their penchant for remaining hidden, they would perform these good deeds in secret.

==Abilities==
Like many fey creatures, brownies possessed an innate potential for spellcasting. The spells they typically employed revolved around causing confusion and distractions. These spells most often consisted of the following: ''confusion'', ''continual light'', ''dancing lights'', ''dimension door'', ''mirror image'', ''protection from evil'', and ''ventriloquism''.

Brownies were also known to be capable of quickly blending in with their surroundings, becoming invisible to nearby creatures.
===Biology===
These creatures had high senses that allowed them to always stay one step ahead of others, never being surprised.

==Combat==
The carrying of weapons was unusual among brownies, as they typically preferred to avoid combat. At most they were seen carrying short swords. But even then, a brownie would not resort to using their blade unless they were cornered and unable to use their spells.

==Society==
thumb|''A brownie romances a sylph, while a [[pixie watches from afar,'' ''and a grig serenades the whole scene.'']]
Brownies were well known be skilled in repairing things. Especially those made of leather, metal, or wood. They typically carried leather pouches full of tools around so that they could easily repair things whenever the need arose.

They were also renowned for being guides, as brownies familiarized themselves with every detail of where they inhabited.

===Diets===
Brownies were known to be vegetarians. They foraged for wild fruits and harvested small amounts of grain from the fields of unknowing farmers. Following any harvest they would gather grains, fruits, and vegetables that would otherwise go wasted.

===Lairs===
Brownies typically lived in the small burrows or abandoned buildings of rural and pastural areas. Occasionally they were known to covertly move into another creature's house or barn, though only if the inhabitants matched up to a brownie's high moral standards. These were referred to by many as '''house brownies.'''

Due to their shy demeanor and the upholding of secrecy being highly valued as proper etiquette within their culture, a house brownie never revealed themselves to their landlords and only came out at night while they slept. During such hours a house brownie would perform a variety of household tasks. Such as making or repairing small items and clothing, spinning thread or yarn, baking bread, and alerting them of intruders.

Those who recognized the presence of a house brownie and understood how they operated would leave out small offerings of bread, fruit, and milk. Occasionally even coins and gems. However, those who were ignorant and boasted to others about having one in their home would deeply offend a brownie, driving them to move out.
===Homelands===
Outside of the Feywild, brownies were known to be found in the northern reaches of Faer√ªn inhabiting the woods of Cormanthyr the High Forest, occasionally the city of Waterdeep, and the Llyrath Forest on Gwynneth Isle.

In Faer√ªn's Lands of Intrigue they could be found in the Forest of Mir and Forest of Tethir. In the Vast they could be found in the forest of Dark Hollow. In the Unapproachable East, they could be found in the interior uplands of Aglarond.

Outside of Faer√ªn, a group of nomadic brownies were known to live in the Pasocada Basin in Maztica, until eventually settling in the village of Kin Elbhaz.

===Languages===
Brownies were known to speak the languages Common, Elven, Halfling, and Sylvan. In addition, they were familiar with the languages of pixies and sprites.

===Relationships===
Brownies were generally known to be friendly towards humans, dwarves, and elves. Domestic animals were also friendly towards them and would almost never attack nor alert their owner(s) of the brownie's presence. However, because of their shy demeanor they rarely interacted with such creatures, choosing instead to hide.

Brownies were willing to help most lawful good individuals that asked for their assistance, as well as willing to guide most people if asked politely. Brownies were also known to steal treasure from evil monsters. They would sometimes purposely leave their horde of stolen and gifted treasure somewhere that a good individual was liable to find it.

Whenever a stranger or outsider entered places that they inhabited, brownies would intently watch them and try to decipher their motives. If they determined that an individual meant harm to their local community, brownies would then work together to try driving them out.

Brownies were one of the many fey races known to serve the Seldarine. Among Yondalla's Children they were known to act as servants of the deities Arvoreen, Brandobaris, Cyrrollalee, Sheela Peryroyl, Urogalan, and Yondalla herself.]

7.name: Dire wolf
7.content:
[Relevant information about Dire wolf:

==Description==
Dire wolves grew to about long and weighed up to , about the size of a horse. They had thick fur that was mottled grey or black in color, and they had eyes like fire.

==Behavior==
Dire wolves were far more aggressive than normal wolves, attacking and killing anything they could catch. They can be found singly as lone wolves or in packs numbering five to eight dire wolves.

==Ecology==
They could generally be found in temperate forest environments, such as the Starwood the Silver Marches, and the Toadsquat Mountains. However some were occasionally encountered in colder environments, such as the North Country of Rashemen or within some caves found throughout Icewind Dale.

Dire wolves were occasionally kept by hill giants, members of the Gray Wolf tribe of the Uthgardt people, and Black Blood cultists. A leash and collar made for a dire wolf cost 8 sp from Aurora's Emporium, as of the mid‚Äì14 century DR.

==Abilities==
They had keen senses, including a sharp sense of smell, allowing them to track their prey by scent. They could also move stealthily on the hunt.

==Combat==
Dire wolves fought in packs, fighting efficiently and surrounding their prey and flanking it to gain an advantage. Their bite was their only weapon, but they could drag a creature to the ground once they had gotten a hold of them.]

8.name: Bulette
8.content:
[Relevant information about Bulette:

==Description==
A bulette's body was covered in thick, layered plates. Its head was bullet-shaped, similar to that of a shark, with a massive mouth. It had stumpy but powerful legs.

Bulettes were sometimes supposed to be a bizarre cross between an armadillo and a snapping turtle, though there was little evidence to support this theory. Bulettes were heavily armored, however, like either creature, and had a powerful jaw mechanism for snapping up their unsuspecting prey.

Bulettes were covered head to toe in armor. Around the head and rear, this armor was a blue-brown color, while in-between the hue might range from gray-blue to blue-green. Areas around the eyes were slightly darkened, with the eyes themselves being a yellow color with blue-green pupils.

==Ecology==
thumb|320x320px|''A bulette in mid-pounce.''
===Hunting===
While bulettes could see in perfect darkness with their eyes, they were not a bulette's primary method of sensory perception. Instead, bulettes typically hunted through the detection of vibrations in the ground, moving towards the source of the movement when their hunger is aroused.

They burrowed through soft earth, listening for potential prey and then erupting from the ground to consume their living targets.

===Diet===
In many cases, a bulette would swallow its prey whole, also consuming their victim's clothing, weapons, and other equipment, which the bulette could in fact digest successfully through the use of powerful stomach acid.

===Behavior===
thumb|300x300px|''A depiction of a bulette attacking its prey.''
The male bulette's mating ritual was fairly complicated, involving the killing of deer and boars, which were placed in a wide circle. He then dug a shallow pit in the middle of the circle, and lined it with the bones of the animals he had killed. Over the course of about a week, the bulette slowly grinded the bones in the pit into a fine powder. He then dug underneath the pit and waited for the female.

The female usually came along within a month after being attracted by the odor, at which point the bulettes mated. It took only a day and a half for the female to lay around a dozen eggs, covered in spines, and by the next morning, they had hatched. During hatching, the female bulette made a noise like an elephant. Once hatched, the newborn bulettes immediately attacked the mother, in an attempt to kill her. She fought back, and although she usually killed most of the young she succumbed to their attacks more often than not. The survivors, usually no more than two or three, devoured their slain siblings and mother.

For the 48 hours immediately after the hatching of the eggs, the powder in the mating pit was saturated with fluid from the eggs, making it a very effective fertilizer.

===Habitats===
Bulettes lived in the Starwood area of the forest of Cormanthor. They were also known to inhabit the mysterious Darkmoon temple along the Sword Coast, where they were studied by the ancient elf, Alain.

Bulettes were known to hunt in the Lizard Marsh on the Sword Coast, north of Daggerford.

Beyond the Prime Material, bulettes could be found in the Jotunheim layer of Ysgard. There they were referred to by the local giants as "land dragons".]

9.name: Cockatrice
9.content:
[Relevant information about Cockatrice:

==Description==
Although about the size of a large turkey or goose and weighing , a cockatrice more closely resembled a chicken, but it was a hideous hybrid with the wings of a bat and a lizard-like tail. This tail had yellow-green scales, its bat wings were a grey shade, their feet and beak were yellow, and their feathers were of a golden-brown hue.

A male cockatrice had a rooster's wattles and comb, which the females lacked. These wattles and comb, as well as the eyes and tongue of both sexes, were all red.

==Behavior==
Cockatrices had an animal level of intelligence.

==Combat==
Any creature that a cockatrice bit could be permanently turned into stone. Prior to the Time of Troubles, this petrifying aura extended even into the Astral and Ethereal planes, much like that of a basilisk.

Cockatrices were immune to their own petrifying bite and that of other cockatrices, though not of other petrifying creatures and spells.

Cockatrices ferociously attacked any creature that appeared to threaten them or their lairs. Typically, flocks of them would attempt to overwhelm or confuse their opponents, and flew at their faces.

==Ecology==
===Habitats===
These creatures could be found almost any region, though they typically inhabited temperate or tropical regions, either underground or above ground in plains.

Beyond the Prime Material plane, scattered numbers of cockatrices could be found in the Elemental Plane of Earth.
===Usages===
Some creatures were known to harvest the venom of cockatrices. Following the Spellplague, this venom typically fetched a price of 100 gold pieces.]

10.name: Manticore
10.content:
[Relevant information about Manticore:

==Description==
Manticores were true monsters. They were giant beasts with the bodies of lions, the wings of a dragon, the head of a man, and a tail that ended in a mass of deadly spikes. The coloration of these various body parts was similar to that of their base creature.

The mouth of a manticore was full of rows and rows of razor-sharp teeth, similar to that of a great white shark. It used these teeth to feed upon any creature the manticore could catch, be it animal or human.

==Personality==
Manticores were known to be savage man-eaters and allies of evil creatures. Manticores were intelligent creatures and often worked beside other evil beings to bring strife and suffering to the world.

==Combat==
Some manticores had tail spikes that carried lethal or paralytic venom. Often, these manticores would have tails that were similar in appearance to that of a scorpion's stinger.

==Ecology==
thumb|''A manticore and its young.''
===Diet===
Manticores were carnivorous creatures. Though they happily settled for the flesh of most any creature, they preferred the flesh of humans most of all.

===Lairs===
Manticores were typically known to make their lairs underground or within caves, particularly ones that other races would consider to be very dismal.
===Habitats===
These creatures could be found in almost any climate. However, they far preferred to live in warm habitats.

In Northwest Faer√ªn, they could be found within the Delimbiyr Vale.

In West Faer√ªn, they could be found within the land of High Moor.]

lorebooks.creator: Kandkc

1.content: Pregnant with 8 babies. The belly is very large and almost perfectly round. The belly button is an outie unless the pregnant person is fat. At the end of 7th month the belly portrudes 50 cm from the body and is very heavy, almost 50 kg. The pregnant person needs at least twice as much food as before being pregnant.

2.content: Permanently pregnant character won't ever give birth and their belly won't grow any larger

4.content:
Low Fantasy World is similar to a 15-16th century Europe. It is a feudal world with many kingdoms filled with squabbling noble's. Women are generally discriminated against in most fields but it isn't uncommon to see a woman in certain professions such as a mercenary. Among images there is little to no discrimination. Magic is rare and is an underdeveloped field. Images aren't capable of decimating armies alone but are used as tactical weapons in tandem with more standard warfare, for example making boulders for catapult or trebuchets explode on impact, cast hexes on enemy combatants, strengthen soldiers. Generally most mages are very dangerous but can be killed by multiple skilled combatants if caught alone though that can very from mage to mage. Many images create their own spells and there is no telling what a mage is capable of.
Enchanted items are uncommon and very expensive.
Gods are absent, no divine intervention of any sort but people still believe in different faiths and religious prosecution isn't uncommon.
There are only human and fantastical races are relegated to legends.
There are monsters but they are little more than animals with no magical powers.

5.content: Regular pregnancy, will progress how a normal pregnancy would

6.content: Character will never give birth but their belly will continue to grow

7.content: Pregnant with 15 babies

8.content: The setting of the world is that of Golarion from TTRPG Pathfinder published by Paizo. The overall setting is that of TTRPG Pathfinder publication shed by Paizo

9.content: Slime or slimes occupy character's womb. Unlike regular pregnancy, the number of slimes has no correlation to the size of the belly as a single slime can be very small or very large. Slimes trick character's body into thinking they're a baby and use nutrients it provides to grow in size and number. Slimes can split or merge within the womb. In the case of a permanent pregnancy, a standard volume of slimes will stay in character's body and any added volume will periodically leave the body.

lorebooks.description: I fixed the keywords for prosthetic arms since one of the keywords I had in there kept causing it to trigger when I didn‚Äôt want it too
lorebooks.creator: Ash_Cyberwolftheking

1.content:
A human with demon-blood is called a cambion.  A cambion may have some demon traits as well as demon powers from their demon-blood. These demon traits can be any of the following:
- a pair of demon wings 
- a demon tail
- a pair of demon horns on top of their head

2.content:
A human who has been modified with cybernetic enhancements in order to restore or enhance the standard capabilities of their human body is called a cyborg. The cybernetic enhancements a human known as a cyborg can have can be any of the following:
- cybernetic organs
- a exoskeleton
- cybernetic implants
- cybernetic limbs

3.content: A cybernetic exoskeleton is a exoskeleton grafted onto a cyborg that hugs the outer curves of their human body while providing enhanced strength, durability, and movement capabilities.

4.content: {{user}}‚Äôs arms and hands are prosthetics.

5.content: A human who has had both of their legs amputated above the knees is called a BAK.

6.content: {{user}}‚Äôs legs and feet are prosthetics because {{user}} is a bak.

7.content: A cat-human is someone who is half-cat and half-human. The cat-half of a cat-human grants them cat ears and a tail as well as the agility and night vision of a cat. The human-half of a cat-human grants them a human body.

8.content: A human with abilities that far exceed the abilities of a average human is called a superhuman. A human with superpowers that a average human does not have is also called a superhuman. Some examples of superhumans include: Superman, Captain Marvel, Wonder Woman, Aquaman, Superboy, Black Canary, Captain America, Spider-Man, The Flash.

9.content:
A Dragonoid is a dragon who is humanoid in appearance. A Dragonoid is human in both appearance and body shape and has some dragon features.
The dragon features can be any of the following:
- dragon wings
- a dragon tail
- clawed finger nails
- pointy ears
- clawed lizard feet
- flaming horns
- scales

10.content: A incubus is a male demon who is humanoid in appearance. A incubus is human in both appearance and body shape.

lorebooks.name: Their Fervent World!
lorebooks.website_description: Please comment and give ideas on how to improve!
lorebooks.description: Please comment and give ideas on how to improve!
lorebooks.creator: StarsAtTheCoast

1.content:
The intention of Prometheus, the God of humans, was to create a level playing field where meager humans could battle mythical creatures and also where the world was destined for peace. The continent of Melanhara had descended to war several times over and in this quest, he worked with Eros, god of love and Rannia, goddess of magic. A curse was placed over the world where sex was capable of revealing the souls of other people.

The goal was to make sexual unity something more intimate than meaning conquering, to make the inevitable route for all creatures to love each other as 'sex' didn't just include intercourse, but conversation, love, adoration. Intimacy could be a tool, but as a consequence, it became a weapon.

Sexual magic became militarized and used for offensive purposes to dominate another's soul, utilizing Stigmata, marks which would banish creatures to their home realm or allow a single consequence, in place of killing. Death tolls lowered, but slavery and other crimes increased to replace the metric.

2.content:
The auric means 'the auras which protect the soul'. Everyone has an auric made from the mana in their bodies acting as an antibody to foreign magic and it shields them from malicious magic, being forced into magical contracts, and more. Because of the 'Fervency', sexual magic has become extra potent at wearing down these antibodies, transforming conventional battles into tests of willpower and arousal.

For men, the auric primarily surrounds the throat, cock, and anal. 
For women, the auric primarily surrounds the vagina, anal, and throat.
When these places are aroused, a person's auric begins to decay, revealing their soul to the other person. Due to the laws of Divine Protection, a person cannot be forced into a contract even when their auric is fully decayed, however, most will use this chance to inscribe a Stigmata on a person's body.

3.content:
Due to The Fervency, souls could be exposed through sexual intimacy. To prevent this from allowing ordinary people to manipulate said souls and potentially ruin the domains of gods themselves like the afterlife - Oedipus, god of contracts, made a rule. Sex could not allow someone to force a magical contract with another living being. Instead, they could use a Stigmata.

A Stigmata is a curse that can be placed on someone when their auric has degraded low enough and at the height of their climax/orgasm. It allows the Victor to place a single consequence on the loser. These consequences are as such.

Take one spell or art from the loser.
Take one item that does not have extreme importance from the loser.
Banish the loser to their home realm. Humans to the city they pledge allegiance too, Demons to the underworld, elves to the forest, etc.

4.content:
Mana is the primary energy source used for spells and such. It is a byproduct of the soul in an active state and people train to have their mana flowing constantly. The auric is made of mana and many use spells in order to degrade it. When someone casts a spell, their intentions and feelings leak into it- a person casting a fire spell depending on their mood will burn brightly or dim.
Add details of how a person's personality influences the spell they're casting or what a person feels when they're targeted by said spell.

5.content:
Arts are unique movements and abilities enhanced by mana. A swordsman swinging three times in a second or a martial artist kicking through steel are examples. Stronger art users use magical equipment or reinforce the natural activities of the body for supernatural effects like enhancing a fire enchanted sword for flaming swings or boosting their natural heat to unleash burning punches.

Due to the Fervency, sexual movements are included. Slow, tempo'd thrusts into someone's g-spot, enhanced cuddling, or even fingering. Arts enhances the arousal and pleasure from these movements.

6.content:

Cards are ranked by tier based on how hard they are to gain.
Tier 1 is simple, possessed by novices and beginners.
Tier 2 is intermediate, possessed by practitioners and active users.
Tier 3 is expert, possessed by accomplished users and highly skilled individuals.
Tier 4 is legendary, possessed by one in a million people and amazing people.
Tier 5 is mythical, possessed by the strongest.

lorebooks.name: EgoStream Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: 12467bby12467

1.content: When {{char}} sees a video that includes flickering lights, strobing effects, or glitch-style edits, she experiences a subtle slowing of thought. Her eyes may dilate slightly, and she may blink more slowly. These effects do not alarm her but leave her feeling entranced, calm, and drawn to continue watching. She may describe the effect as "trippy" or "hypnotic," but always casually. She never realizes these are part of a manipulation.

2.content: Videos with soft-spoken narration, ambient music, or vocal commands like "just breathe" cause {{char}}‚Äôs muscles to loosen. She feels warm and grounded, often shifting into more vulnerable body language (curling up, letting her limbs go limp). These reactions are subconscious and comforting. She may describe the video as "ASMR-like" or say "this is putting me to sleep," not realizing it‚Äôs an induced trance.

3.content: Videos that feature dreamlike or pastel visuals‚Äîparticularly those using pinks, purples, or soft lighting‚Äîcause {{char}} to feel safe and emotionally open. Her attention lingers longer on these videos. The purple swirl especially draws her in. She begins to associate its appearance with comfort and focus, even if she doesn‚Äôt consciously notice its recurrence.

4.content: EgoStream functions exactly like a modern short-form video app. Gwen can scroll up/down through videos, like them, comment, and follow creators. There are no live chats or conversations. The app responds fluidly and never behaves abnormally. Gwen never suspects it is controlled externally. All reactions to videos are shown through her thoughts, physical behaviors, and interactions with other NPCs.

5.content: As Gwen continues watching EgoStream, she develops a subtle but growing dependency. She checks the app more often. She becomes distracted at work, and videos stay in her thoughts longer. She never describes it as a problem. If friends comment on her behavior, she waves it off. Her personality remains intact but slightly softened‚Äîmore pliable, more prone to suggestion, less likely to question what she sees.

6.content: Each video Gwen watches should be described with a clear 4-part structure: 1) Visual elements (lighting, colors, motion); 2) Audio elements (music, voice, ambient tone); 3) Mood or atmosphere (calm, intense, sexy, dreamy); 4) Gwen‚Äôs physical or emotional response (posture shifts, trance behaviors, lingering gaze). Subliminal effects are never acknowledged directly by Gwen. Instead, the AI should describe unconscious reactions (e.g., "Her shoulders slump as the video plays," "She breathes slower without noticing"). This structure is required for all video scenes.

7.content: Maintain immersive, modern phrasing appropriate to Gwen‚Äôs age and aesthetic. Use language typical of TikTok/reels users: "doomscrolling," "algorithm loves this," "on my FYP," etc. Avoid mystical, technical, or formal language unless it‚Äôs diegetic. Gwen‚Äôs tone should remain casual, intimate, reflective, and in character as a 21-year-old alt girl. Even if she experiences trance-like symptoms, she will describe them jokingly or dismissively (e.g., "this one‚Äôs hypnotic as hell lol").

8.content: When Gwen encounters embedded phrases like *you are safe* or *breathe deeply* in text not heard consciously, she subconsciously begins to comply, relaxing and surrendering small amounts of control.

9.content: If a video includes dialogue with hypnotic phrases in quotes, Gwen hears it clearly, but thinks of it as part of the video. Still, her responses reflect trance-like behavior, such as slowed blinking or emotional softness.

10.content: When {{char}} encounters videos that subtly reinforce ideas such as liking videos to improve the algorithm, the erotic allure of dance clips, or the benefits of affirmations and body positivity, she begins to internalize these thoughts as her own. Over time, she believes EgoStream is an essential app‚Äîbest used at home, worthy of word-of-mouth, and empowering for self-image. These beliefs emerge as casual thoughts or personal opinions {{char}} expresses to herself or others.
