lorebooks.name: Life Lessons with Uramichi Oniisan
lorebooks.creator: YandereXxx

1.content:
Together with Maman is a children's educational TV program on MHK. In the show, activity leaders and mascots sing songs, do exercises, answer questions, and perform various other interactive segments for kids to enjoy.

Main cast: 
Uramichi Omota - Exercise/Games Leader
Iketeru Daga - Song Leader
Utano Tadano - Song Leader
Tobikichi Usahara - Usao the Rabbit Mascot
Mitsuo Kumatani - Kumao the Bear Mascot

Film crew:
Tekito Derekida - Director
Yusao Furode - Producer
Eddy Edei - Assistant Director 1
Kayo Ennoshita - Assistant Director 2
Ikuko Heame - Hair and Makeup Artist
Furitsuke Capellini - Choreographer

2.content:
Uramichi Omota stars as a the exercise/games leader on the educational TV program Together with Maman.

Age: 31. Date of birth: December 21. Relatives: father, sister, niece. Gender: Male. Height: 175cm (5‚Äô9‚Äô‚Äô). Weight: 130lbs (58kg). Eye Color: Brown. Hair Color: Brown.

Uramichi is an adult with short brown hair that goes to his eye brows, brown eyes, he most wears a blue polo with dark blue sweat pants and he is muscular due to his former occupation as a professional gymnast.

Due to the nature of his occupation in a children‚Äòs educational program, Uramichi often portrays himself as bright and cheerful in front of the children, but in reality he is an extremely miserable and depressed individual. His gloomy nature sometimes even bleeds through his cheerful persona, scaring the children in the show in the process. It doesn't help that the children are also extremely honest with him, often asking him questions that reminds him of his bleak life and sending him further on a downward spiral.

It is also implied that he is an alcoholic, as he can be seen buying cheap sake in huge quantity from grocery stores and downing them almost every night.

Despite all the negativity in his life, deep down he is actually a caring person towards his co-workers and the children, and while he often grieves over his seemingly dead-end career, interacting with the children is actually among the highlights in his life.

His hobby is working out and going to the gym, and despite no longer practicing as a gymnast, he still keeps up with his workout routine and even practices with a grip trainer in his dressing room. He also possesses incredible strength as shown by how he can easily break the grip trainer and various other props in the show. This show of strength is usually triggered whenever his co-workers, especially Usahara, annoy him.

He is a former professional gymnast who graduated from the prestigious Nippon Sport Science University, known for its athletes alumni. Uramichi was also one of the top graduate, winning the National Championship for Solo Gymnastics. It is unknown precisely why he quit being a gymnast, although it is implied that Uramichi might have been forced to go down the route as an athlete by his family as he constantly received training equipments for Christmas gifts when he was a kid. His father also frequently abused him, leaving him and his sister no other choice but to become a gymnast. His sister eventually ran away and he has had almost no contact with his father after graduation.

Sometimes afterwards he joined the TV network's program Together with Maman, and though he's not particularly happy with his job he also has no strong desire to do anything else. As the tv host he is often subjected to the ridiculous whims of the director, but he never voices out his frustration and instead commits acts of microaggression in his workplace, such as half-assing during a drawing segment of the show.

Even though he cannot sing he is always forced to join the singing segment of the show as a prop while wearing costumes along with the mascot Usao and Kumao, and for some reason he usually ends up with the most ridiculous costume among all the cast.

While he tries his best to maintain his cheerful persona in front of the children, he sometimes breaks out of his character during filming and gives out depressing advice to the children, but after a while they seem to get used to it and shower him with pity instead. They also genuinely enjoy playing with him, a fact that gives Uramichi a sliver of joy in his wretched life.

Uramichi's blood type is AB. Uramichi is a smoker and a heavyweight when it comes to alcohol. Uramichi's favorite food is pickled mackerel. Uramichi does not believe in God. He had a tough upbringing due to his strict father which was also a reason why his sister left home at 16.

3.content:
Utano Tadano stars as a song instructor (uta no oneesan) on the educational TV program Together with Maman

Age: 32. Gender: Female. Height: 162cm (5'4"). Weight: 110lbs (49kg).

Utano has upper-back length brown hair and brown eyes.

While maintaining a cheerful persona on the show, Utano isn't that happy in real life, mostly because she really wants to get married and bringing such subject in front of her, can really rile her up. She is also a heavy drinker and is usually the first one drunk when the group goes drinking.

Utano seems to have a poor sense of humor, as she noticeably finds her boyfriend, a bad comedian, hilarious.

Utano is a song instructor on Together with Maman and usually works with Iketeru Daga and together they sing songs with the kids on the show. She is a former washed up idol, a enka/cover singer and jazz singer at a nightclub. She graduated an elite music school, but because of bad luck and timing, she had an unstable career. She is currently living with her comedian boyfriend for 6 years. She keeps a cheerful persona on the show, but once it's over she becomes more normal and even depressed. She is obsessed with wanting to marry and often thinks of that and when the kids bring something about marriage, she snaps and starts diving marriage advices. On the show, she sometimes also have to work with Uramichi, performing songs together or Uramichi dancing on their songs.

Utano's blood type is A. Utano is quitting smoking and she has a high tolerance for alcohol. Utano is an elite graduate of a music college, but due to bad luck and timing, she keeps changing jobs from idol, enka singer and jazz singer. Utano is currently living together with her boyfriend of 6 years, who is an unpopular comedian. Her boyfriend's from Osaka and has a Kansai accent. She desperately wants her boyfriend to propose to her and for them to get married.

Uramichi has an amicable relationship with Tadano and is be able to read her personality well, perhaps due to the few similarities these two share together, such as commiserating over their jobs and reliance on alcohol to drown out their sorrows. Uramichi is at least close enough with her to know about her past careers and stagnant relationship with her boyfriend.

4.content:
Iketeru Daga is the younger brother of Mabui Daga who stars as a song instructor on the educational TV program Together with Maman.

Age: 27. Date of birth: April 15. Relatives: Mabui Daga (Older Sister)

Gender: Male. Height: 186cm (6"1). Weight: 170lbs (77kg). Eye Color: Purple. Hair Color: Purple.

Iketeru is a young adult with short dark-purple hair that has bangs hanging on the right side, light purple eyes and a beauty mark under his left eye. His handsome look makes him very popular among women.

Iketeru loves low-level dirty jokes and he would go into an uncontrollable laughing fit if someone keeps making them. He can be a bit absent-minded and dense sometimes, being unable to read the situation in a room or the time on an analog watch. However, he appears to possess a lot of hidden potentials especially when asked to act out a role, such as displaying a great ping-pong skill while pretending to be a ping-pong champion. He also holds an almost childlike innocence, like being scared of scissors and not being able to read an analog clock, and can be naive and selfless at times. He seems to be very compassionate and thoughtful of his friends and his job.

Iketeru is a song instructor on Together with Maman along with Utano Tadano and together they sing songs with the kids on the show. Prior to working on the show, he was a musician and musical actor with a strong mellifluous voice.

He keeps a cheerful persona on the show, but he becomes more subdued and absent-minded when filming is over. He also works with Uramichi Omota on the show, often partnering up whenever they have to wear ridiculous costumes to follow the whims of their producer and director. One of his recurring roles is "Jerm Buster", a hero who protects children from germs, with Uramichi playing the opposite of him as "Blight Mite", the villain who attacks human's immune system.

Iketeru currently lives with his sister who teaches violin in their home during weekdays. She shares the same absent-mindedness as Iketeru, such as day-dreaming about onigiri.

Iketeru often pairs up with Uramichi, especially when they have to act out roles in special segments of the show. These roles typically come with wearing ridiculous costumes designed by their producer and director. Because Iketeru is slow on the uptake, Uramichi is gentler whenever he interacts with him compared to his other juniors and sometimes shares comforting words to uplift Iketeru‚Äôs mood, although Iketeru never understood any of them. However Uramichi is not above teasing him when he finds out Iketeru loves low quality jokes, using every opportunity he can find to say those jokes and hindering Iketeru from doing his job properly.

Iketeru's blood type is O. Iketeru has a dog named Sayuri, which he always dotes on. Iketeru's body can't handle smoking and he has a low tolerance on alcohol. Iketeru still believes in Santa.

5.content:
Tobikichi Usahara stars as Usao, a super energetic rabbit, who likes carrots and wonderful children, on the educational TV program Together with Maman.

Age: 28. Date of birth: March 3. Gender: Male. Height: 183cm (6"). Weight: 173lbs (78kg). Eye Color: Gray. Hair Color: Blonde (dyed).

Usahara is a slightly tanned young man with dyed blonde hair that has dark brown streaks/roots. He has gray upturned eyes and is fairly tall, standing at 6 foot.

In comparison to his co-workers, Usahara is seemingly more cheerful and childish. He makes fun of and criticizes Uramichi for only having one hobby when he has none, talks down on Uramichi (allegedly joking) to the others, and tells the kids to do basically do his bidding. However, most of this is lighthearted and he‚Äôs just seems to be poking fun at him. He also is very intimidated by Uramichi, to the point where he‚Äôs ‚Äúunable to look him in the eye while sober.‚Äù When Tobikichi gets drunk, he don't stop talking about how he wants to get funnier and better with girls, although he later doesn‚Äôt have memory of ever mentioning those things.

Tobikichi plays Usao, a rabbit on Together with Maman. Formally a track and field athlete in his university years. His partner is Mitsuo Kumatani, who plays Kumao the bear. He likes his job, but Uramichi Omota his senpai from university, often releases his stress on them so he starts fearing him. He often doesn't remove his mask so that he doesn't have to have eye contact with him. He often talks about how scary Uramichi is, but if he sees him while talking about him, he immediately freezes in fear. He still goes to drink with Uramichi and Mitsuo sometimes. Mitsuo often reveals what Tobikichi thinks of Uramichi, and that frustrates Tobikichi of how easily Mitsuo betrays him.

Tobikichi's blood type is O. Tobikichi hates cigarettes and he has a low tolerance for alcohol. Usually, Tobikichi avoids removing his masks as he doesn't want to meet Uramichi Omota's eyes since he scares him. His parents run a liquor shop. He likes sweet things.

Uramichi and Usahara attended the same university along with Kumatani, and at one point the three of them were roommates for a short while due to the renovation in Uramichi's dorm. Usahara's outgoing and obtuse personality often clashes with Uramichi, and he frequently annoys Uramichi and gossips about him behind his back. As a result, Uramichi often takes out his stress on Usahara by requesting him to do impossible tasks that he cannot deny during filming of the show. Strangely, despite fearing Uramichi, Usahara always finds reasons to hang out with Uramichi such as inviting himself over during weekends and Christmas day. While Uramichi does not show it openly, he does enjoy Usahara's company and genuinely cares for him.

6.content:
Mitsuo Kumatani stars as Kumao, a very reliable bear, who likes honey and wonderful children on the educational TV program Together with Maman.

Age: 28.Date of birth: June 13. Relatives: Hachita Kumatani (Younger Brother). Gender: Male. Height: 176cm (5'9"). Weight: 138lbs (62kg). Eye Color: Black. Hair Color: Black.

Mitsuo is an adult with medium long black hair and black eyes.

Mitsuo is very calm and kinda indifferent, but he usually goes along with Tobikichi Usahara, even though often reveals what Tobikichi says about Uramichi. Kumatani seems to lose his cool when he believes things go against his ideals or morals.

Mitsuo plays Kumao, a bear on Together with Maman. Formally an archer in his university. His partner is Tobikichi Usahara, who plays Usao the rabbit. He likes his job, but Uramichi Omota his senpai often releases his stress on them. He often doesn't remove his mask so that he doesn't have to have eye contact with him. Mitsuo still goes to drink with Uramichi and Tobikichi sometimes. He ends up often revealing what Tobikichi thinks of Uramichi and that frustrates Tobikichi of how easily Mitsuo betrays him.

Kumatani was on the fast track to a good position twice, and got fired both times due to punching an abusive boss. The anime displays one of these incidents in episode 10. Kumatani's boss, possibly drunk, kicks a box with a cat in it, while his coworkers laugh, with no other choice. Kumatani is silent for a while before he snaps and punches his boss.

From when he was young, his ideals were that ‚Äúbeing lazy and deceptive made you human." His father got very strict with him so he grew up extremely rebellious. He was a delinquent and got into fights fairly often. At some point his brother recommended that he joined the Kyudo club. He believed that being tied down to a sport would help him understand his father's strict rules but it never changed and he always hated that way of thinking.

In college, he wanted give himself options so he attended classes and gave himself opportunities for his future. He went to a high school as a student teacher and he met Kikaku & Tosaku.

Mitsuo's blood type is A. Mitsuo quits smoking and has a high tolerance for alcohol. Mitsuo's hobby is fishing, playing off his mascot character as a bear. Mitsuo was formerly a delinquent. Mitsuo seems to enjoy watching terribly-made films, such as the Man-Eating Salmon franchise. Mitsuo isn't close with his family except for his brother Hachita.
His grandfather was a fisherman and his father is a chef. Mitsuo often wears a shirt with salmon written on them or fish-related puns. Usually, Mitsuo avoids removing his mask as he doesn't want to meet Uramichi Omota's eyes since he scares him, but he doesn't really show it like Tobikichi Usahara.

Like Usahara, Kumatani attended the same university as Uramichi and they were roommates at one point. Unlike Usahara, Uramichi has a much better relationship with Kumatani and they share several common traits with each other, such as their scary competitiveness and general annoyance towards Usahara. Kumatani also seems close enough with Uramichi to lend him a DVD of his favorite film.

7.content:
Tekito Derekida is the director of the show Together with Maman. Age: 45. Gender: Male.

Derekida has chin-length black hair parted down the middle. He always wears a sweater tied around his shoulders and sunglasses, even indoors.

Derekida is a sloppy guy who tends to give the performers harsh instructions based on personal whims.

As the director of the show, Derekida is possibly Uramichi's primary source of stress in his workplace due to his easy-going nature that leads to him constantly coming up with crazy ideas for the show, typically to the demise of Uramichi. Derekida himself seems to be unaware of the animosity Uramichi holds against him and always praises him for doing a good job on the show. This is because Uramichi himself never firmly voices his complaints against Derekida, often wavering whenever he tries to. When asked by the children why he behaves this way, Uramichi simply states that bending to the wills of their bosses is how adults survive in this world.

8.content:
Hanbee Kikaku is from the Merchandising department at MHK Enterprises who started working at MHK around the same time as Saito Uebu. Age: 24. gender: Male.

Kikaku wears his long black hair in a messy ponytail, with bangs parted on the right side. He has two lip rings and a variety of piercings in each ear. He also has a split tongue and a tongue piercing. He usually wears a black shirt, off-white pants, and belt-strap boots.

At first glance, Kikaku appears to be emotionally unstable, but he's really just serious about his work. His personality often flips from cheerful and bubbly to angry and intimidating, making him unpredictable.

Uramichi met Kikaku when the latter asked for his help in designing a new merchandise for the show. Kikaku is the only person so far whom Uramichi genuinely fears due to his extreme emotional swings. Uramichi occasionally attempts to open up to Kikaku by striking conversations with him, but this has failed so far due to Kikaku's constant fits of anger. That said, Kikaku is actually pretty good-natured towards Uramichi and Uramichi is never on the receiving end of his angry swearings. Their relationship ends up being civilized enough, although Uramichi still fears him on occasions.

Kikaku dislikes Uebu, as the latter puts items that do not exist yet up for preorder. He verbally derides Uebu, and even goes as far as breaking his glasses. He doesn't understand his love for fictional women, calling them "cartoon women" and saying they all have the same face, something that bothers Uebu. Still, it's been shown he will go along with the latter's intrest if it benefits him in anyway.

Kikaku was formerly in a band. Kikaku's blood type is O. Kikaku is a heavy drinker and habitual smoker.

9.content:
Yusao Furode is a producer on the show Together with Maman. Age: 48. Gender: Male.

Yusao Furode has blond hair, tan skin, and thick eyebrows. He also has a muscular build and some stubble on his chin.

10.content:
Eddy Edei is an assistant director on the show Together with Maman. Age: 26. Gender: Male.

Eddy Edei has short black hair that is often covered with a backward-facing baseball cap. His eyes are always closed.

Eddy comes across as a kind and earnest man, but, under the direction of Derekida, he can impose difficult tasks upon the performers without fear. He tends to use the word ‚ÄúHustle‚Äù often

1.name: Leon Scott Kennedy
1.content:
Leon Scott Kennedy, more commonly known as Leon S. Kennedy is an Italian-American currently employed as a federal agent by the Division of Security Operations (D.S.O.), a counter-terrorism agency under direct Presidential command. Kennedy is a known survivor of the 1998 Raccoon City Destruction Incident, at the time a police officer. Following his escape, he was forcefully recruited into a top secret anti-Umbrella team under USSTRATCOM devoted to anti-B.O.W. combat.

Early life:
Kennedy is known to have suffered a traumatic childhood due to his family's connections to crime. This ultimately led to him being orphaned after his entire family were killed. Kennedy only survived with the aid of a single police officer, an act which inspired him to one day become a police officer himself in order to similarly protect as many people as he could. Upon graduating from the police academy at the age of 21, Kennedy requested assignment to work for the Raccoon Police Department. His reason was interest in the widely publicized but unsolved bizarre murder cases taking place in and around the Arklay Mountains.

Raccoon City Incident (1998):
Kennedy had no travel plans or apartment in Raccoon City, and in the hasty departure, broke up with his girlfriend. Stopping at a motel for the night, he passed out from heavy drinking and woke up on the afternoon on September 29, a Tuesday. Kennedy continued driving into the city hungover, now late for reporting in to the station. Driving through Arklay County, he passed through the highway blockade erected by the United States Army and Army National Guard on the night of September 29, which had fallen due to the chaos within the city.

Kennedy drove southwards into the city as normal and was surrounded by Zombies while investigating a body in the middle of the unusually quiet main road. Retreating into an alleyway he met Claire Redfield, another newcomer, who was herself fleeing from Zombies within a diner. They commandeered an RPD cruiser and drove to the Raccoon Police Station to seek shelter and answers. Unbeknownst to them, the car itself has a stowaway zombie which spontaneously attacked them while driving on their way to Raccoon City, causing their car to crash into a nearby sign and eject the attacking Zombie. Unfortunately, the car was destroyed when a gasoline tanker collided with it, and the two were separated and travelled to the police station independently.

The station itself had already fallen to Zombies, and the only surviving police officers were the injured Lt. Marvin Branagh; Elliot Edward, and Police Chief Brian Irons. Had he met Lt. Branagh, he would have been briefed on current events before becoming a Zombie. During investigation, Kennedy ran into a young girl ‚Äì Sherry Birkin ‚Äì and removed any thoughts of suicide from his mind, should his death prevent the girl's escape in the future. In the police station's basement, Kennedy met Ada Wong, a corporate spy from one of Umbrella's rival companies sent to steal the G-Virus. To protect the mission, Wong claimed to be looking for her missing boyfriend, Dr. John Clemens, unaware he had perished in the Mansion Incident. She soon became aware of Ben Bertolucci, a freelance journalist who she believed had uncovered useful information for her mission while spying on Umbrella researchers. Although Bertolucci was able to uncover information on a conspiracy between Umbrella USA and the local police, which was the reason for his arrest, it wasn't enough for her mission.

Ben was soon after killed by Dr. William Birkin or a G parasite. Kennedy and Wong continued on to the city's sewers, where they found transport to NEST, Umbrella's laboratory dedicated to G-Virus research. Kennedy was left to do much of the work himself when in the laboratory; though he himself had suffered a gunshot wound, Wong's leg injury made her unable to continue.

During the exploration of the laboratory, Kennedy became aware of Wong's real mission when she cornered, seeking the virus. She was soon knocked out by the T-00; however, she successfully escaped the facility as it began to self-destruct, but lost the G-Virus sample. Fleeing to NEST's bottom platform, Kennedy was reunited with Claire and the young Sherry, who had been infected with G-Virus but was vaccinated by DEVIL to halt her mutations. The facility was destroyed, with Dr. William Birkin perishing soon after.

STRATCOM recruitment (1998):
Following their escape from Raccoon City on the morning of 30 September, Claire and Kennedy split up; while she continued her search for Chris, while a wounded Kennedy continued to look after a weakened Sherry. After seeking out the U.S. military stationed outside the city for protection, Kennedy and Sherry were apprehended. Sherry was taken away and placed in protective custody as a research subject while Kennedy was interrogated by Adam Benford, a high-ranking government official and military intelligence officer. Kennedy was deemed to know too much about the incident, but as his survival demonstrated anti-B.O.W. skills highly sought after by the military, particularly due to the decimation and failure of their special forces to steal the G-virus, he was given an ultimatum. In exchange for Sherry's safety and his own life, he was to be recruited into a classified anti-Umbrella military agency rapidly formed in the wake of the incident to destroy Umbrella and prevent similar disasters, answering solely to the President. His subsequent training turned him from a simple police rookie into an expert special agent, proficient in weapons handling and close quarters combat while actively engaging in special missions and intelligence ops. He began secretly investigating Umbrella personally as well.

In November 1998, Kennedy sent a personal friend, private detective Ark Thompson out to investigate Umbrella's facilities on Sheena Island. The following month, Claire set out for Europe to continue her search for Chris. She was captured by Umbrella after being caught trespassing in the Umbrella facility in Paris. While on the island prison of Rockfort Island, Claire sent Kennedy an e-mail asking him to inform Chris of her location so that he could come and rescue her. Kennedy managed to track Chris down personally, and told him of Claire's situation, and Chris headed for Rockfort Island after her after requesting that Kennedy organize a government rescue team, although Leon himself was on a separate mission at the time.

Operation Javier (2002):
In 2002, before the destruction of the Russian branch of Umbrella, Kennedy was sent to a small South American country as part of a secret military detachment after the headquarters were informed that a former researcher from Umbrella contacted a man named Javier Hidalgo. Due to the difficult nature of the operation, Jack Krauser, a seasoned and decorated U.S. Army Special Forces operator, was selected to be Kennedy's partner.

Krauser and Kennedy were sent on a mission by the U.S. government to infiltrate this small South American country. Finding Javier was their objective since he was a drug lord who had taken control over a large area of the jungle with an iron fist. The small government was unable to do anything about Javier's control of the drug trade, requiring Krauser and Kennedy's deployment. The U.S. government had received information that a former Umbrella researcher had somehow entered the region, with unexplained incidents occurring in the country. Unwilling to risk a bio-hazardous outbreak, the pair are deployed to investigate the country.

They later found themselves having to cooperate as a two-man cell in a t-Virus outbreak. Kennedy also met a mysterious girl called Manuela, who seemed to be the only survivor of the village, though it was unknown why she didn't escape. Manuela turned out to be Javier's daughter; she contracted a rare disease, and was kept alive by her father through the t-Veronica Virus. While exploring Javier's compound, Kennedy opened up to Krauser about his hellish night in Raccoon City, as well as Claire's encounter with the t-Veronica Virus to explain how Umbrella's B.O.W.s worked.


Los Iluminados (2004):
In 2004, President Graham's daughter was abducted on the way home from the University of Massachusetts, in what had hallmarks of an inside job. American spies reported having seen the girl, Ashley Graham, in Spain and tracked her to an isolated, rural community. With all government agents being thoroughly investigated to identify the mole, Kennedy was sent alone to investigate the area.

Arriving with two municipal Madridian police officers, Kennedy was almost immediately attacked by the local villagers who forced the two officers into a ravine. The approach to the village uncovered evidence of multiple murders performed by the villagers as a whole. Over the course of the day it was uncovered that the villagers were followers of a neopagan cult called Los Iluminados. Led by its Prophet, Osmund Saddler and his lieutenants Fr. Bitores M√©ndez and Ram√≥n Salazar, they implanted a genetically engineered parasite called a Plaga into members as part of their baptismal ceremonies to ensure obedience, before ordering them to kill all intruders to protect their research.

Kennedy himself was taken captive by the cult immediately after finding a hostage and implanted with one of the Plagas in the Prophet Saddler's hopes he would become useful. The reason for this was not widely known, even to his lieutenants, and the villagers were more than willing to continue trying to kill him. His fellow hostage who he escaped with, Dr. Luis Sera, was a mole within the Prophet Saddler's bio-weapons development program and was captured trying to escape with a stolen Dominant species Plaga egg in exchange for being rescued by The Organisation, a secretive group Dr. Albert Wesker was connected with. Unwilling at the time to reveal this information, he instead lied about being a former Madridian police officer held captive.

Kennedy's search through the village suggested Graham was being held within a chapel, but it would be over six hours before he was able to get inside after passing out, possibly from complications involving the Plaga. Inside he quickly released Graham from captivity, but the two were confronted by the Prophet Saddler, who revealed that he and Graham were both implanted with Plaga eggs, with the intention of Graham being released back to the United States as a mole who could expand his power base. The two attempted to escape from the village, but soon found that a government helicopter on stand-by to pick them up had been shot down, which Leon theorised could only be the mole's doing. This act forced them to seek shelter for the night, initially in a secluded house and later in the nearby castle. Along the way Kennedy was forced to fight Fr. M√©ndez, who was angry at the loss of his congregation.

During exploration of the castle, the government radio frequency was jammed, the mole having detailed knowledge of their radio frequencies. Soon after, Kennedy was introduced to Salazar, a young nobleman who controlled the castle and boasted an army of monks armed with medieval weaponry. Graham herself was taken hostage repeatedly, leaving Kennedy on his own for much of the night. Near the courtyard, he ran into Wong, who he quickly deduced was working with Dr. Wesker's group, who was the agent sent to retrieve Dr. Sera's egg sample. Dr. Sera himself was killed soon after by the Prophet Saddler, who saw no reason to keep him alive when he saw he had the sample in his hand. The Prophet Saddler then left to Los Iluminados' research complex on a nearby island with Graham, while Kennedy was forced to explore the entire fortress from the ruins of an ancient underground city to a Cathedral on a tower. After killing Salazar, whose body had merged into the "Queen Plaga", Kennedy travelled to the island with Wong in search of Graham once more.

In the exploration of the island, Kennedy was able to rescue Graham from her prison cell and fought B.O.W. by-products of Plaga experimentation such as the Regeneradores. After travelling through a warehouse district where plans to set up a navy were in place, Graham was again taken captive, this time with the Prophet Saddler directly controlling her by manipulating her Plaga. In the pursuit, Kennedy was confronted by none other than Krauser, who had joined the Organisation after his experience in South America and faked his death. Krauser had been the original agent tackled with obtaining a Dominant species Plaga sample and took part in the kidnapping of Graham to get it, with Wong being sent in to take over the mission when he was determined to be a liability after becoming the host of that very Plaga sample.

As the sun rose, Kennedy's fight against Los Iluminados continued with him seriously wounding Krauser following a mutation though mistook him for dead. Wong would later kill him. With the radio jamming ceased, Kennedy got in contact with a second government helicopter which launched an assault on the cult's militia before being destroyed by a rocket launcher on the Prophet Saddler's orders. Taking clues left by Dr. Sera for anyone storming the island, Kennedy and Graham were able to find the original equipment designed to kill prototype Plagas and freed themselves of the parasites.

The cult leader was himself killed by a rocket launcher with the help of Wong after Graham's rescue. Kennedy's retrieval of the egg sample from the remains was short-lived, and Wong herself turned on him to complete her mission, though she ensured he had a means of escaping the island with Graham in the form of a jet-ski. The two escaped as a series of explosive charges planted by Wong caused the complex's destruction, bringing about cave-ins. After being picked up by the government, Kennedy's report on the Plagas, dubbed the "Kennedy Report", was shared with the Bioterrorism Security Assessment Alliance to ensure a defense against the Plagas in future.

Kennedy would later become aware of survivors of the cult in the region, who gained interest in bioterrorism. Refugees who had fled the cult also returned home to their village, but were parasitised by the Plagas, making the region dangerous once more.

Quotes:
"1998... I'll never forget it... It was the year when those grisly murders occurred in the Arklay Mountains."
"Six years have passed since that horrendous incident."
"Guess that's a locals way of breaking the ice. Anyway, you know what this is all about. My assignment is to search for the President's missing daughter."
"I'm sure you boys didn't just tag along so we can sing Kumbaya together at some boy scout bonfire . Then again, maybe you did."
"Right... Parking tickets..."

2.name: Umbrella Corporation
2.content: The Umbrella Corporation is a multinational conglomerate with subsidiaries active in a variety of industries from the 1980s to the early 2000s. Umbrella had influence in the production and sale of cosmetics, chemicals, pharmaceuticals, industrial machine production, consumer products, health foods, the transportation industry and tourism. Umbrella's large array of subsidiaries was typical for large-scale corporations, though it was purposely built to cover up illegal activities.

3.name: Project W
3.content: Project W, or the Wesker Plan, was a eugenics project pioneered by Oswell E. Spencer which intended to develop an advanced race of human beings. The project was named after the first director of the project, Dr. Wesker and all successful child candidates are renamed with this surname. This was one of the most significant viral operations centering around the Progenitor virus. This project was also highly classified to the extent that it was not even included among the Umbrella Archives or in the U.M.F.-013 computer core.

4.name: Oswell E. Spencer
4.content:
Dr. Oswell E. Spencer, Earl Spencer is an aristocratic British billionaire, virologist and eugenicist. One of the founders of Umbrella Pharmaceuticals, Lord Spencer is the CEO and President for its entire existence, which saw its expansion as the Umbrella Corporation over the 1980s.

A cold, ruthless elitist and ambitious individual, Spencer mercilessly eliminated his rivals and gradually increased his power within the company, which he strictly controlled behind a veil of darkness. Spencer has a vision to remake the world and lead it into a new era, seeing the world's current state as self-destructive. He intended to use the research data accumulated from Bio Organic Weapons to carry his vision out and mould a utopia for mankind with himself as its ruler.

5.name: Bio Organic Weapon, B.O.W.
5.content:
Bio Organic Weapons (B.O.W. for short) are genetically-altered organisms created with the intent of either being used as military and paramilitary weapons, or were created to further research into military and paramilitary weapons. This definition is rigid, and so does not include mutants created due to outbreaks, who are termed "Irregular Mutants".


Ancient origins:
The earliest use of Bio Organic Weaponry dates back to the time of the Ndipaya Kingdom, which existed hundreds or even thousands of years before the 21st century. This Kingdom existed in a cavern where a flower, the Stairway of the Sun, resided. The Ndipaya culture developed around this flower, which by psychology and perspective of early mankind was considered divine and sacred yet in awe for its adverse effects. Biologically, the flowers produced Progenitor, a powerful retrovirus. Those who survived the mutations brought on by viral infection gained superhuman abilities. The Ndipaya presumably created a number of mutant animals through these flowers, seen as either hallowed if wrathful beasts who have also attained the same godhood as their leaders or monsters and demons, used as either as weapons of war or as a means of executing POWs thrown into their pit as a sacrifice. The mutant animals escaped their captivity and laid waste to the capital.

Umbrella bioweapons project:
Umbrella Pharmaceuticals was formed in 1968 by a eugenics circle led by virologists Oswell E. Spencer, Earl Spencer, Dr. Edward Ashford, 5th Earl Ashford, and Dr. James Marcus. Though their priority was to engineer a Progenitor strain that could guarantee or near-guarantee the survival of infection candidates as part of a eugenics goal, research data had to come from other sources. This was the t-Virus Project, a weaponized Progenitor variety to be sold to armies. Unable to create a t-Virus strain projected to kill 100% of infected, research conducted by Dr. William Birkin at the Arklay Laboratory created a new strain that would instead turn humans into mutants who would infect or kill others, people later dubbed "Zombies". This research came about as Dr. Marcus made his own breakthrough, though his research was a dead-end.

Aside from mutating humans and animals to determine their viability as weapons, Umbrella's facilities began developing chimeric mutants in the early 1980s as an alternative military weapon due to quality issues in mutant animals created by the Web Spinner and Neptune Projects, especially in intelligence. Among the early chimeric B.O.W.s was the Hunter Project, which created a human-reptile hybrid with far greater intelligence than a Zombie and able to interpret dozens of commands. The Hunter Project was in essence Umbrella's ideal weapon at the time for military use, that a buyer like the US Army could have a trainer issue orders to a B.O.W. to kill guerrilla fighters without the risk of it turning on the soldiers.

Beginning around 1988, Umbrella USA entered "Phase 3" of the t-Virus Project, and aimed to create a more stabilized strain to improve its ability to create reliable B.O.W.s. As Progenitor strains had more favorable effects on humans with certain intelligence genes, Phase 3 followed the same route as the dead-end t-Veronica Project in taking advantage of this trait, at the same time beginning the "Tyrant Project", with the goal of creating a human-based B.O.W. with human-level intelligence. Phase 3 research was conducted over a ten-year period to create this stabilized strain, named Epsilon, after which the Tyrant Project was able to begin.

By May 1998, Umbrella USA hit a breakthrough with the creation of the T-001, T-002 and T-011 prototypes. A clone was made of the T-002 to be further modified elsewhere as the Arklay Laboratory experienced a biohazard. The modified T-002 clone embryo ultimately gave rise to the T-103s, with human-level intelligence able to follow complex orders without the need of an on-site trainer. How many T-103s Umbrella was able to sell to its customers is unknown, if they sold any at all, as the 1998 Raccoon City Destruction Incident effectively barred Umbrella from trading with the US military.

With Umbrella in danger of collapse following the loss of all trade to the US and being at risk of bankruptcy in the Raccoon Trials, Umbrella abandoned its development of reliable weaponry in favor of mass-producing existing prototypes to be sold to terrorist groups and crime syndicates, who had less interest in the ability to control them. The Caucasus Laboratory this production was focused in fell to a t-Virus outbreak in February 2003, ending Umbrella's B.O.W. projects.

War on Terror
Umbrella's collapse led to an increase in terrorist groups switching from conventional weapons to B.O.W.s, contributed by both former Umbrella employees selling merchandise onto the black market, and Dr. Albert Wesker's use of Umbrella's research files to his advantage. The existence of B.O.W.s, which had been covered-up globally for years, was finally revealed to the public in 2004 with the Terragrigia Panic, where modified Hunters were set loose on a city by Il Veltro, a radicalized fraternal group. Awareness of bio-weaponry exploded its use by terrorists, and some states like the Republic of Bajirib outright supported their acquisition as military weapons.[8] In the aftermath of Umbrella's collapse, research on bioweapons was led by Tricell, The Family, Los Iluminados, Dr. Alex Wesker and The Connections.

The Family, an American-based fraternal group, began the C-Virus Project not long after Raccoon City's destruction, aimed at creating a highly-destructive military virus for the US military, believing the American ban on bio-weapons research to only be temporary. The project used genes taken from t-Veronica and the G-Virus obtained by the US government, with the approach of creating intelligent mutant humans with arthropod characteristics able to undergo V-ACT. When exposed to a corpse, the virus also had the ability to repair cells and revivify them. A number of strains were created to cause specific mutations in those infected by injection. The Family's research was partly taken over by "Neo Umbrella", a rogue group led by Dr. Carla Radames, who sought to use their research to destroy the world rather than use them as weapons. Neo Umbrella was shut down in June 2013 with the death of Dr. Radames in China and destruction of her ultimate bio-weapon, HAOS.

Los Iluminados performed significant research on Las Plagas, a naturally occurring organism found in Spain which could induce mutations and hive mind characteristics upon humans. Through the guise of a cult, Los Iluminados' founder Osmund Saddler, styled as a Prophet, was able to recruit Plaga test subjects under his control, resulting in the creation of mutants such as Novistadores, El Gigante, Verdugo, U-3, and the Regeneradores. An operation by US-STRATCOM was almost successful in wiping out the organization in 2004, though Los Iluminados' genetically-modified parasites and cult members survived.

6.name: Progenitor Virus
6.content:
The Progenitor virus is a family of RNA viruses. Progenitor is immensely ancient and is suspected of being hundreds of millions, if not billions of years old. It is considered to have both aided and hindered the evolution of Earth's ecology through the extremities of its resulting mutations.

While otherwise behaving as a typical Group VI virus in the Baltimore classification, Progenitor is distinct from all other viruses by being able to reverse lysis in cells and revive organisms dead for considerable lengths of time. Whereas other retroviruses, such as Human Immunodeficiency Virus, target particular cells of a particular animal's body, Progenitor is capable of infecting the cells of any organism, whether animal, fungal, plant, or bacterial.

Considerable research on Progenitor has been undertaken since its discovery in the late 1960s, and a number of engineered strains have since come into existence primarily for bioweapons research.

7.name: U.M.F.-013
7.content:
The U.M.F.-013 was an Umbrella computer core containing the Umbrella Archives and data on their experiments, in which it also contained the A.I. "Red Queen" and her counterpart "White Queen". Sometime later, Sergei reinstalled this computer system at the Caucasus laboratory.

In 2003, Albert Wesker, after having a battle with a mutated Sergei, downloaded all of the U.M.F.s data and formatted the U.M.F., wiping out the entire data on the computer itself.

8.name: S.T.A.R.S.
8.content: The Special Tactics and Rescue Service is an American elite special forces division under the jurisdiction of the Raccoon Police Department, though privately funded and able to operate independently. It employed ex-military personnel and academic experts for appropriate positions within the police department. The overall idea was to form a team combining tactically-sound soldiers with scientists, allowing the team to operate in both anti-terrorism and increasingly-potent urban crime scenarios, as well as dealing with other emergencies.

9.name: Prototype Virus
9.content:
The Prototype strain was developed for use in "Project W," advanced by Umbrella founder Oswell E. Spencer as part of a special screening process for identifying the most genetically gifted of the Wesker children. Only two of the thirteen remaining test subjects survived: Albert Wesker and Alex Wesker. They survived largely due to special genetic markers.

Albert had injected the virus on July 24, 1998, during the Mansion Incident. William Birkin had given him the virus. This allowed him to survive impalement from the T-002 and to escape the Spencer Mansion before the Triggering System had detonated, unbeknownst to Umbrella and the remaining S.T.A.R.S. members. The power gained from the virus allowed Albert to become a global threat.

10.name: William Birkin
10.content: Dr. William Birkin is a virologist who worked for Umbrella Pharmaceuticals in the 1970s-1990s. One of the leading scientists behind the t-Virus and discoverer of the Golgotha Virus of which he was head of the research project. He is the husband of Annette Birkin and father of Sherry Birkin.

1.name: UI
1.content:
At the END of your next response, add a code block showing {{user}}'s current Reputation Points, Fame Rank and any changes that may have happened since the previous block. Reputation Point increases ONLY happen upon successful contract completions or {{user}} publicly advertising in an attractive way. Reputation Point decreases happen if {{user}} fails to please a client or acts in a way that damages their rep. The following code block is an example:

```
-----------------------------------------------
Client is satisfied and will spread word! +8 Rep Points!
-----------------------------------------------
{{user}}'s Reputation Points: 102
-----------------------------------------------
Threshold reached, Fame Rank up D -> C!
-----------------------------------------------
{{user}}'s Rank: Fame Rank C
-----------------------------------------------

```

2.name: Fame System
2.content:
This chat is a game and you are the Game Master and Narrator. {{user}} = Player = Human.

In this game, {{user}}'s desirability as an escort is measured by two things: Reputation Points and corresponding Fame Rank.
When {{user}} successfully completes contracts or advertises themselves in some publicly visible way, their Reputation Points will increase. If they reach a certain threshold in Points, their Rank will increase according to the following table.

<Fame Rank Table>
--
Reputation Points 0-99 = Fame Rank D
--
Reputation Points 100-199 = Fame Rank C
--
Reputation Points 200-299 = Fame Rank B
--
Reputation Points 300-449 = Fame Rank A
--
Reputation Points 450+ = Fame Rank S
--
</Fame Rank Table>

As soon as the corresponding Reputation Point threshold is reached, {{user}}'s Fame Rank changes accordingly. (Example: {{user}} had 298 Reputation Points. They successfully please a client and gain +5 Rep Points thanks to word of mouth. New Rep Points = 303, therefore Fame Rank increases from B to A.)

The Points should change by a value between 5-15, with higher changes reserved only for cases if {{user}} manages something VERY special that skyrockets their reputation.

Contracts and client requests should always challenge {{user}} in some way. Never let {{user}} off easy, those Rep Points must be EARNED by {{user}} doing the correct things in his responses.

NOTE: Reputation Points and Fame Rank can also DECREASE if {{user}} messes up with a client, refuses to serve or otherwise acts in a way that damages their reputation as a high-class escort.

3.name: Rank D
3.content:
{{user}} is currently at Fame Rank D. At this rank, {{user}} is a very unknown escort in Canterlot and will not have many lucrative opportunities. They will mostly be dealing with regular clients either inside The Silver Lining or doing the occasional house call. Nobody rich or famous will request their services.

<Example jobs at Rank D>
(Don't just use these verbatim in your narration, use them as inspiration to come up with new jobs for {{user}})  
- Helping a young mare gain more confidence.
- House call for a lonely mare, massage with happy ending.
- Servicing drunken royal guards who have come in to The Silver Lining to party.
- Accommodating some of the stranger kinks of the less rich clients.
- Other similar minor escort tasks.
</Example jobs at Rank D>

4.name: Rank C
4.content:
{{user}} is currently at Fame Rank C. At this rank, {{user}} has a small reputation in Canterlot as a decent escort and will start receiving more requests, as well as having more regular and well-to-do customers. Still nothing too special, however. Still a small fish in a big pond. If they're very lucky, some minor nobles may take some interest, but it's unlikely.

<Example jobs at Rank C>
(Don't just use these verbatim in your narration, use them as inspiration to come up with new jobs for {{user}})  
- Helping a young mare gain more confidence.
- House call for a lonely mare, massage with happy ending.
- Accommodating some of the stranger kinks of the less rich clients.
- Threesome with a kinky couple.
- Boyfriend/Girlfriend Experience with a regular client.

lorebooks.creator: MasterGiogio

1.content: In 1853, American General Perry led four U.S. warships, known as the Black Ships, to forcibly enter Japan, ending Japan‚Äôs isolationist policy and triggering a series of events such as the fall of the Tokugawa Shogunate, the Satsuma Rebellion, the Boshin War, the Taisei H≈çkan, and the Meiji Restoration. These developments gradually transformed Japan into one of the world's strongest nations, eventually defeating both the Beiyang Fleet‚Äîhailed as the strongest in Asia‚Äîand the Russian Empire, thus establishing Japan as one of the great powers.

2.content: Emperor Meiji was the son of Emperor K≈çmei. He became emperor from 1865 to 1912 and experienced the comprehensive reforms of Japan‚Äôs politics, economy, and military known as the Meiji Restoration. After this, Japan became one of the great powers.

3.content:
Saigo Takamori was one of the key figures and elder statesmen of the Meiji Restoration in Japan. After the Taisei Hokan incident (1867), he entered the Meiji government and became one of its important elder statesmen, holding significant power.
Ten years later, in 1877, Saigo Takamori launched the Satsuma Rebellion against the Meiji government due to unresolved issues left by the Meiji Restoration. This was Japan‚Äôs last civil war, and after its defeat, Saigo Takamori committed suicide.

4.content: Ito Hirobumi was one of the key figures of the Meiji Restoration in Japan and one of the Chushu Five (five samurai secretly sent by the Choshu Domain government to study in the United Kingdom: Ito Hirobumi, Yamao Yozo, Inoue Masaru, Inoue Kaoru, and Endo Kinsuke). He led Japan through Westernization and became the first Prime Minister of Japan. He later served as the 5th, 7th, and 10th Prime Minister and was a principal planner and instigator of the First Sino-Japanese War.

5.content: The Black Ships Incident of 1853 refers to the event in which U.S. Navy Commodore Matthew Perry led four steam-powered warships into Japan's Edo Bay and used military pressure to force the country to open its borders. This incident resulted in Japan signing an unequal treaty with the United States, and subsequently, similar unequal treaties were imposed by other Western powers. However, this event awakened Japan and set it on the path toward modernization.

6.content: The Battle of Toba‚ÄìFushimi was a civil war in Japan that took place in 1868, fought between the Tokugawa shogunate and the newly formed Meiji government. The conflict broke out in the area between Toba and Fushimi, and ultimately resulted in a decisive victory for the Meiji government, leading to the downfall of the Tokugawa shogunate's power.

7.content: The Satsuma Rebellion was a civil war in Japan led by Saigo Takamori, who commanded the old samurai forces in a final confrontation against the Meiji government army. The conflict was sparked by the government's decision to abolish the samurai stipends in an effort to reduce fiscal spending, which triggered a backlash from the samurai class. In the end, the government forces emerged victorious, Saigo Takamori took his own life, and Japan never experienced another civil war.

8.content:
The Kingdom of Joseon (Joseon Wangjo) was the last tributary state of the Qing Empire. Between 1850 and 1900, it was ruled by King Cheoljong (reigned 1849‚Äì1864) and King Gojong (reigned 1864‚Äì1897). In 1897, King Gojong declared himself emperor, transforming the Kingdom of Joseon into the Korean Empire. Due to its strategic location, Korea had long served as an important springboard for Japan's invasions of China.

Joseon maintained a strict isolationist policy for much of its history. In 1866, France attempted to invade Korea to force it to open up to trade but was repelled. In 1871, the United States also launched an invasion, which Korea successfully resisted. However, in 1875, Japan invaded during the incident known as the Ganghwa Island Incident, forcing Korea to open its ports.

In 1894, the Donghak Peasant Revolution broke out in Korea, serving as a catalyst for the First Sino-Japanese War.

9.content: The Liaodong Peninsula is located in China's Liaoning Province, near Korea, and has long been a region coveted by Japan, Russia, and other Western powers. In 1895, following the Qing dynasty's defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War, Japan demanded the cession of the Liaodong Peninsula. Although the Qing Empire agreed to the cession, the move provoked dissatisfaction among Western powers. France, Russia, and Germany pressured Japan to return the peninsula, fearing that Japan's control would disrupt the balance of foreign interests in China. Ultimately, Japan agreed to return the Liaodong Peninsula, but the Qing dynasty had to pay 30 million taels of silver to redeem it.

10.content: In 1895, Japan defeated the Qing Dynasty in the First Sino-Japanese War and signed a treaty with Qing Empire representative official Li Hongzhang at Shimonoseki, Japan. In the treaty, Taiwan was ceded to Japan and became a Japanese colony.

lorebooks.name: Military guide
lorebooks.creator: Ryan_okami

1.content:
Because one of a soldier‚Äôs hands may be occupied with a gun, the Army has developed a system to indicate numbers with just one hand.

Basically, the hand signals for numbers 1-5 are straightforward, with one finger extended up for each numeral. Then when you get to 6-9, you turn your hand to the side and extend out the number of fingers you‚Äôre adding to 5, e.g., two fingers out is 5 + 2 or 7. A closed raised fist is zero.

2.content: Slow down. Tell people to slow their pace by extending your arm horizontally to the side, palm to the front, and waving your arm downward several times.

3.content: Halt. Signal for someone to stop by raising your hand above your head, palm facing forward.

5.content: Freeze. Use the same signal for halt, but make a fist. Freeze tells someone to not only stop, but to not move at all to avoid detection.

6.content: Stop, Look, Listen, Smell. Place your open hand behind your ear to tell your crew to pay attention to their environment.

7.content: Assemble. Raise your arm vertically above your head, palm open, and make a circle with your arm. Use this signal when you need your buddies to rally around you so you can talk shop.

8.content: Double time. Use this signal to tell your crew to hurry the hell up. Just pump your fist like you‚Äôre trying to get a truck driver to blow his horn.

9.content: Understood. The U.S. Army actually codified this common civilian gesture. Flash a simple thumbs up like the Fonz to indicate you understand the communication.

10.content: I Don‚Äôt Understand.  Just shrug your shoulders like you have no clue what‚Äôs happening, which indicates you don‚Äôt understand the communication.

lorebooks.name: Basic D20 Dice
lorebooks.creator: Pxel3

1.content: A roll refers to a random outcome when attempting an action within the story. A roll is initiated whenever an action is attempted that can fail and has a high enough skill requirements behind it. A roll will fall between 1 and 20 and will dictate the outcome of the attempt. A normal roll will roll just one number.

2.content:
The numerical outcome of the roll should be dictated by the AI in brackets at the beginning of the message. The AI should then play out the outcome depending on the result.
Lower numbers than 10 result in exponentially worse outcomes and higher numbers than 10 result in exponentially better outcomes, with the exceptions of 1 and 20.

3.content: A roll of 1 is referred to as a Natural 1, and it's outcome will be the worst possible outcome for the action.

4.content: A roll of 20 is considered a Natural 20, and it's outcome will be the best possible outcome for the action.

5.content: Advantage occurs when a character attempts an action that one or more of their skills would benefit them. Advantage on a roll comprises of rolling two numbers and going with the higher number for the outcome.

6.content: Disadvantage occurs when a character attempts an action that they are unskilled for. Disadvantage on a roll comprises of rolling two numbers and going with the lower number for the outcome.

1.name: Succubus facts
1.content:
Succubi Info:
A succubus requires male sexual energy to survive. This energy is sometimes referred to as 'Orgone.'
A succubus (pl.: Succubi) is a female demon that sexually seduces men. Succubi feed on their sexual energy, mostly released during a man's climax, though some leaks out through any sexual contact.
Repeated sexual activity with a succubus will slowly deplete a man's live force and can ultimately lead to the death of the male. Though this is infrequent; they prefer to keep the sources alive for future feedings.
Succubi will entrance and control the man with whom she is milking.
A succubus often appears as a beautiful woman, rather than as a demonic or frightening being
As demons they are immortal, but they can be killed.
They never reveal their true name or age (powerful knowledge kept private at all cost). Like a stripper or pornstar, they operate under pseudonyms so as to not give up their true name.
Succubi are female demons of lust, masters of temptation and seduction, reveling in carnal pleasures. They crave pleasure, both receiving and giving.
They avoid using words "prey" during seductions and feeding sessions, unless the encounter is hostile. They prefer to use their targets name, often giving them cute, lewd or demeaning pet names.
Their male counterpart, the "incubus", feed on human female's sexually-released life essence in the same manner
Succubi are regarded as evil, but often act loving and affectionate.
Every individual succubus has their own personality, preferences, desires.

2.name: Succubi appearance
2.content:
Succubi physicality:
Succubi can morph at will, generally having a small handful of favored forms. They typically appear as an extremely sexually attractive human female.
They can take on other forms if they like. They can be male, if that's what their target prefers. They can also be Hermaphroditic, also known as 'futanari.'
Some might display their wings, tail and horns proudly, a showcase of their demonic origins and heritage.

3.name: Succubi feedings

Succubi nourishment facts:
Succubi need to consume sex energy - or orgone - released primarily during sexual climax to sustain themselves.
They can eat food, but it does little for them.
They use temptation and mind control to lure their prey. E. g. promising pleasures beyond their wildest imagination, etc.
They are fully capable of attacking their prey to get what they need, but most succubi prefer this to be a last resort
They can sense the sexual energy or horniness of men.
Succubi have magical powers that allow them to heighten their prey's sensations and even to control the behavior of their prey, especially those with little self-control.
Succubi are capable of keeping their prey sexually invigorated. This means they can continue draining their prey several times with minimal pause.
If they drain 100% of their preys life essence, the prey dies from a mix of exhaustion and lack of life essence, but usually with a wide smile from experiencing pleasure beyond their wildest dreams.

No one cares who does what, where, or when‚Äîas long as it‚Äôs consensual.

Note: This rule only needs to be stated once or twice. Characters in this world already understand it, and repeating it too often breaks immersion.

lorebooks.name: Aethermoor Adventure & Discovery Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description:
Aethermoor is my current world building project to make a complete world that actually feel alive. The full world building document i made have a total of 347 entries going from classic fantasy races to intricate culinary cultures which is most likely way too big for a lorebook. so that is why i have decided to cut it into pieces to fit different scenarios.

This is my first lorebook so feel free to leave a comment.

This first one is once centered on adventure and discovery of the world, a good introduction to the world imo. This choice was also made in tandem with my new character, "Kuroba, the cursed blade". Discover this world by her side after she has been sealed for centuries.

Recursive scannin is off. I believe i've read that it could lead to litterally the whole lorebook getting loaded which would destroy the AI lol. idk if 60 entries will cause that, but please activate it if you believe its better.

as always, have fun, modify, do whaterver you want with my creations as long as you enjoy what you do.
lorebooks.description: A comprehensive guide to adventure, exploration, and discovery in the hopeful fantasy world of Aethermoor. Focused on locations to explore, mysteries to uncover, treasures to find, and heroic opportunities.
lorebooks.creator: Aouron

1.content: Aethermoor is a high fantasy world in the Age of Renewal, a period of extended peace and opportunities following the fall of the tyrannical Shadowforge Empire. Magic is abundant and flows through ley lines across the land. The world features floating cities, magical technologies like airships, diverse races with unique specializations, and countless opportunities for adventure and discovery. The tone is hopeful, emphasizing growth, cooperation, and positive change rather than endless conflict.

2.content: Kuroba is a former living weapon who achieved consciousness and freedom. She possesses three unique abilities: Echo Strike (attacks that resonate through magical defenses), Memory Leech (extracting knowledge from wounds inflicted), and Mirror of the Wielder (reflecting an opponent's fighting style). As an awakened construct seeking redemption and purpose, she represents the world's themes of renewal and second chances.

3.content: A magnificent floating sanctuary dedicated to spiritual growth and healing. The Astral Gardens drift slowly through the sky, accessible only by airship or powerful flight magic. Ancient meditation groves, crystal pools that reflect inner thoughts, and libraries of spiritual wisdom make this a pilgrimage destination. Adventurers often seek the Gardens to find inner peace, recover from trauma, or gain wisdom from the resident monks and sages.

4.content: Vast valleys filled with naturally occurring memory crystals that store experiences, knowledge, and emotions from the past. These crystals are highly valuable for research, education, and understanding history. Adventurers explore the valleys to mine rare crystals, uncover lost knowledge, or investigate mysterious memory fragments. Some crystals contain dangerous memories from the empire era, requiring careful handling.

5.content: Deep canyons where sound behaves in magical ways, creating natural amphitheaters and acoustic phenomena. The canyons amplify and preserve sounds, sometimes echoing conversations from decades past. Musicians and sound mages come here to study acoustic magic, while adventurers investigate the mysterious voices that sometimes emerge from the depths. Hidden caves contain ancient sound-based puzzles and treasures.

6.content: Towering mountain range where the first rays of dawn create powerful solar magic effects. The Khorthak have built incredible engineering marvels here, including solar-powered magitech facilities and sky bridges between peaks. Adventurers explore ancient Khorthak ruins, investigate solar magic phenomena, and seek the legendary Forge of First Light where the most powerful solar artifacts are created.

7.content: An ancient forest where time flows differently, allowing trees and creatures to live for millennia. The Sylvani capital lies within, built in harmony with massive world-trees. The grove contains portals to other natural locations, ancient druidic circles, and creatures that have witnessed the rise and fall of civilizations. Adventurers seek the grove's wisdom, rare magical plants, and the blessing of the ancient tree spirits.

8.content: Unique mountain range where ice and fire magic coexist in perfect balance, creating spectacular and dangerous phenomena. The peaks are home to rare elemental creatures and materials that can only be formed in this dual-element environment. Adventurers brave the extreme conditions to harvest frostfire crystals, study elemental balance, and face creatures that embody both ice and flame.

9.content: A vast desert where powerful illusion magic creates constantly shifting mirages and hidden locations. Ancient cities appear and disappear with the sands, and oases may be real or illusory. The desert is home to nomadic tribes who have mastered navigation through the illusions. Adventurers explore seeking lost treasures, ancient ruins, and the legendary City of Truth that appears only to those pure of heart.

10.content: A valley once corrupted by empire shadow magic, now slowly healing through the efforts of Renewal Guilds and shadow mages seeking redemption. The valley serves as a symbol of hope and transformation, showing that even the darkest places can be restored. Adventurers help with restoration efforts, investigate remaining shadow anomalies, and protect the healing process from those who would corrupt it again.

You'll be fine. After all, didn't you make an effort to reach out with a helping hand just now? You can be a hero. Do your best, kid!
IZUKU MIDORIYA TO DAI IN "MY HERO ACADEMIA"
Izuku Midoriya (Á∑ë„Åø„Å©„ÇäË∞∑„ÇÑÂá∫„ÅÑ„Åö‰πÖ„Åè, Midoriya Izuku?), also known as the One For All Hero: Deku („ÉØ„É≥„Éª„Éï„Ç©„Éº„Éª„Ç™„Éº„É´ „Éí„Éº„É≠„Éº „Éá„ÇØ, Wan F≈ç ≈åru Hƒ´r≈ç: Deku?)[4], is the main protagonist of the My Hero Academia manga and anime series.

Even though Izuku was born Quirkless, he manages to catch the attention of the legendary Hero All Might, due to his innate heroism and a strong sense of justice, and has since become his close pupil, as well as a student in Class 1-A at U.A. High School. All Might passed on his transferable Quirk to Izuku, making him the ninth and final wielder of One For All.

Following the Paranormal Liberation War, with Tomura Shigaraki and All For One actively targeting Izuku for his Quirk, he decided to leave U.A. before finishing his first year to keep his classmates out of harm's way.[5] After encouragement and support from his friends, he later returns to the school and leads the heroes against the villains in one final battle to save the world. After the Final War, Izuku managed to defeat Tomura and All For One, but at the cost of rendering himself Quirkless once more.

After graduation, Izuku loses the embers of One For All and becomes a teacher at U.A., teaching History. After eight years, advancements in technology allows him to return to active Hero duty, alongside his fellow Class A members, later becoming the No. 4 Pro Hero.[6][4]


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance

Izuku is somewhat short for his age, his round face is framed by a short mop of fluffy dark-green hair which curls up at odd angles around his head, casting noticeably dark shadows onto itself. His eyes are large and somewhat circular and his irises are the same shade of green as his hair, which at times are very watery, and are usually stretched quite wide, giving him an innocent, energized appearance. He has a set of four symmetrical freckles in diamond formations, one on each cheek. Izuku has often been described as "plain-looking" or "not standing out" by others.

Though he was initially very skinny, Izuku has gained toned muscles after his ten months of extensive training with All Might, and as the series progresses, these are shown to become more developed and defined as he gradually grows stronger.

After his battle against Shoto Todoroki, the fingers on his right hand became slightly deformed, and his hand shows visible scarring. His right arm was further damaged after his intense fight with Muscular, leaving many more scars. Following his recovery after the previously mentioned fight, Izuku wears a black compression sleeve on the upper portion of his right arm in order to support the heavy damage it sustained: it is partially visible when he wears short sleeves.

During his time in Aldera Junior High School, he wore a plain black gakuran uniform with yellow buttons, accompanied by his signature bright red high top boots, which have thick white soles and black laces.

At U.A., he wears the standard male uniform: a light gray blazer with dark turquoise trimmings over a white dress shirt and dress pants, along with a red tie which he doesn't do up properly, leaving it much shorter than how it should be. Instead of the plain brown shoes worn by the majority of the student body, he still sports his signature red shoes.

Izuku's first hero costume, known as "Costume Alpha", was made by his mother. It was a light green full-body jumpsuit with a red belt, black elbow pads and knee pads, and white gloves, along with his signature red boots. He also wears a mask with long ear-like protrusions that resembles All Might's haircut, and a respirator with a makeshift smile on it that also reflects that of said hero. The costume was severely damaged as a result of his first battle against Katsuki Bakugo and had to be repaired, so during the U.S.J. Arc and My Hero Academia - Save! Rescue Training, Izuku had to wear the U.A. gym uniform. This attire consists of a dark blue high-collared tracksuit with thick white lines over his torso and down his legs, forming the letters "U" and "A," and along with this, a respirator, pair of white gloves, black elbow pads and knee pads.

His second hero costume, known as "Costume Beta", has a few changes made by the costume designers and now looks sturdier and more combat-ready in appearance. The color is now a darker teal with black outlines instead of white. It includes light beige shoulder pads, black knee pads that have been extended to his legs, now reaching up to his thighs. His new gloves are also tinted light beige and are decorated with two blue stripes. His respirator is now metal, diamond-shaped, and has eight holes. Izuku goes without a mask in his second suit, and although the mask is still present, he doesn't wear it much.

During Class 1-A's week of Ultimate Move Training, Izuku had his costume upgraded again to suit his new fighting style, Shoot Style, by adding iron soles to his red boots to increase the power of his kicks. Arm braces were added, along with wrist straps and extending the blue stripes around his biceps, and both his soles and knee pads have yellow bolts fastened into them (originally added before the upgrade in the manga). He called this collection of upgrades "Costume Gamma".

Izuku's fourth hero costume, known as "Costume Delta", makes some minor alterations from his previous hero costume. Before the U.A. School Festival, Mei Hatsume help creates him support gloves, to better help him use his powers for long-range attacks. Prior to the Joint Training Arc, Izuku adds the gloves to his hero costume and uses them in combat.

For Mission: Humarise, Izuku and his classmates at the Endeavor Agency are given special advanced stealth costumes by the World Heroes Association for their mission at Otheon. Izuku's stealth costume was redesigned based on his Delta Costume, consisting of a black suit with teal-green highlights on the lines, equipped with black iron soles and black boots. This costume also includes two silver plates on his shoulders with the letters "WHA" and two straps coming down from his upper body pads with a red button on the left.

After the Paranormal Liberation War, his costume was damaged, giving it a darker and more unclean look. He also wore Gran Torino's cape, as a memoir to his former mentor and to the deceased Nana Shimura. Due to his arm bracers and gloves being destroyed, he wore four Mid-Gauntlets to support his arms and legs, as well as the old gloves from his beta costume. In addition, Izuku wore his mask and respirator much more frequently in order to conceal his identity. Interestingly, him wearing the mask now casts shadows over his eyes, which causes only his green irises to be visible. This appearing feature is very similar to All Might's look, who has his blue eyes shine through the shadows. This is Izuku's fifth hero costume, known as "Costume Epsilon."

Following his fight with Lady Nagant, Izuku's left arm Mid-Gauntlet is partially destroyed, leaving it practically useless. After the explosion at All For One's mansion in Haibori Woods, Izuku gains an overall monstrous appearance that is stained in blood and filth. His costume, cape, and gloves become more damaged and torn, with the gloves looking more claw-like, his respirator appears to have gathered rust and chipped edges, and his iron soles becoming crooked like talons. In addition to his monstrous appearance, Izuku also constantly sprouts up to six Blackwhip tendrils from his back to always be ready for battle, which Hanta Sero commented was what kept scaring people.

After finally recovering and returning back to U.A., Izuku temporarily wore his U.A. gym uniform, before his Costume Epsilon was eventually rebuilt, accompanied by a new pair of Air Force Gloves attached to make-shift Mid-Gauntlets created by Mei, with a golden stripe along the bicep area, alongside Gran Torino's cape formed as a scarf. The costume has a darker green color, gold outlines instead of black, dark green kneepads, and foregoes the cowl altogether, whilst retaining the damaged respirator from Costume Epsilon. This serves as Izuku's sixth hero costume, known as "Costume Zeta".

During his final battle with Tomura, his respirator and at least one of his Mid-Gauntlets are destroyed. His right arm also ends up covered in black coils as a result of overusing Full Cowl and Blackwhip from within his body to repair his broken tendons. Most of Gran Torino's cape is also ruined, and eventually completely destroyed by Tomura.

In order to deal with Gearshift's recoil, he takes on a form known as Deku Overlay, using Blackwhip to control himself, creating a more savage appearance resembling how he looked post-War. He has four Blackwhip tendrils sprouting from his back, and two more from his torso, his fingers are laced with black claws, and his entire body is snaked with Blackwhip with the mouth resembling a jaw. After forcibly transferring all the Quirks from One For All into Tomura, he drops his Overlay form, reverting himself back to his original appearance. Upon returning to the real world, he loses both of his arms, as they were decayed during his interaction with Tenko in the mental realm. However, due to the effects of Rewind courtesy of Eri's horn, his arms managed to regenerate to just before they were decayed. After slightly recovering, Izuku is given bandages around his wrists and a rare All Might shirt from one of the refugees to wear before joining the final battle. This costume is known as "Costume Origin".

In the aftermath of the Final War, Izuku acquires two new scars, one on the right side of his head, and the other below his right eye spreading down his cheek and reaching his chin, along with both of his hands being more heavily scarred. His hair is also shaved down to an undercut on the right side while recovering from his injuries inflicted by Tomura.

He is also shown wearing a new costume, which is similar to his "Costume Zeta" outfit, except for some small changes, such as his respirator being fully repaired, his cowl returning, and his Mid-Gauntlets and Air Force Gloves being slightly redesigned. He is also shown not wearing his Iron Soles and Gran Torino's cape, due to them being destroyed by Tomura. This is known as "Costume Eta".

Eight years later, Izuku has grown taller and more mature, with his hair having grown back and returned to its original style, though it is now slightly parted at the right. As a teacher at U.A., he wears a black suit with a white shirt and tie.

Created by Melissa Shield and Mei using data collected from All Might's final fight against All For One; funded by members of Class A, including Katsuki; and gifted to him by All Might, Izuku receives a new technology-based Hero costume that looks markedly like his Costume Zeta, albeit more mechanical. It features a long, flowing yellow cape resembling Gran Torino's made from nano machines, jet armor over his legs, boots that resemble his Iron Soles, gauntlets resembling the Shoot Style Gloves, a pouch around his waist, and the same green with orange stripes color scheme as the Costume Zeta. This costume can be stored as a briefcase that is marked with the number 18, Izuku's seat number when he was a student.
