All For One Images
LESS 


Overview
Gallery
Synopsis
Relationships
If it's freedom you desire, then submit to me, my brethren. And bear witness, by my side. This impending void era will give rise to a more perfect demon lord. This will be the story of how I became the greatest demon lord of all!
ALL FOR ONE ANNOUNCING HIS RETURN TO POWER IN "TARTARUS"


All For One („Ç™„Éº„É´„Éª„Éï„Ç©„Éº„Éª„ÉØ„É≥, ≈åru F≈ç Wan?), real name Zen Shigaraki (Ê≠ª„ÅóÊüÑ„Åå„ÇâÊú®„ÅçÂÖ®„Åú„Çì, Shigaraki Zen?),[8] is the overarching antagonist of the My Hero Academia manga and anime series. He was the founder and benefactor of the League of Villains.

Once Japan's most powerful Villain, and All Might's arch-nemesis, his ultimate goal was to steal One For All, the Quirk that originally belonged to his younger twin brother, and the only Quirk that can oppose him. He was the adoptive father and mentor of Tomura Shigaraki, having spent the young villain's life shaping him into a successor, and a vessel for his power in order to transfer his mind into his adopted son's body as part of his plan to eventually conquer the world as a self-proclaimed "demon lord".

He was imprisoned in Tartarus after his second defeat at All Might's hands until he escaped several months later, single-mindedly focused on destroying the ninth wielder of One For All, Izuku Midoriya, to complete his century-long plan.


ADVERTISEMENT
Appearance

After being mortally injured by All Might years ago, All For One's face was entirely made up of scar tissue, extending from above his upper lip and covering his entire head and the back of his neck. As such, he had no visible nose, ears, hair, or eyes, though the outlines of his eye sockets were visible. All For One was blind but used an Infrared Quirk to "see," and he would sense the directions of vibrations in the area around him, similar to echolocation. There was a small hole in each palm of his hands, which is how he stole and transferred Quirks.

In the past, All For One was a towering man with a powerfully muscular physique, imposing features, short white hair, and faded red eyes that showed no sense of feeling. He usually wore a dark suit over a white shirt. When All For One left his secret hideout during the Kamino Incident, he donned a navy blue, skull-like gas mask with angular tubes at the top, a wide collar-like life-support system around his neck with additional pipes connecting in the front and back, presumably to help him breathe.

For the start of the Final War, he wore a smoother skull mask with a much wider, sleeker collar. He also wore a patterned vest underneath his suit.

During his battle with Endeavor and Hawks, All For One used a reverse-engineered replica of the Quirk-Destroying Drug to restore his appearance, to that of before his first fight with All Might, as well as stealing capes from the Heroes to cover himself up.[9] As the damage inflicted upon him continued to stack and put his Rewind effect into overdrive, All For One continued to physically regress in age; from that of a young man,[10] to a temporarily glowing young boy.[11] The conclusion of the battle saw him finally regress back into an infant, and then a fetus, and then an egg cell before he vanished completely.[12]
Gallery

All For One in Vigilantes.
All For One in Vigilantes.
Zen at about 2 years old.
Zen at about 2 years old.
All For One as an infant.
All For One as an infant.
All For One's previous unmasked appearance.
All For One's previous unmasked appearance.
All For One as a glowing child.
All For One as a glowing child.
Zen in his youth.
Zen in his youth.
All For One's previous masked appearance.
All For One's previous masked appearance.
All For One as a teenager.
All For One as a teenager.
Personality

All For One gathers followers
Through his sheer power and charisma, All For One was able to bring Japan under his rule.
All For One was a subtle, sadistic, and malevolent man who liked to rule from the shadows and enjoyed himself at the expense of people before discarding them. In the past, All For One used his power to help people, but in exchange for their servitude. Once they could no longer follow his orders, All For One would callously abandon them, and his followers purged those who defied his will. Taking advantage of the chaotic era caused by the uprising of Quirks, All For One offered people anything they wanted as long as they followed him, including choice and power to those who had none, where he would take Quirks from those who didn't want them and gave Quirks to those who wished for strength, all as a means to gather numbers and conduct his schemes through other people. He masked his true intentions by claiming that he just wanted to help restore order and balance to society.

All For One exhibited extreme megalomania and even traits of an outright god complex, having compared himself to the Demon Lord he read about in comic books. He also relished his total power over Japan and saw himself as a higher being. All For One would steal the most powerful Quirks during his rise to power and crushed anyone who stood in his way.[13] He also displayed signs of kleptomania, claiming that he couldn't resist stealing a powerful Quirk when the opportunity presented itself.[14]

The only person Zen seemed to care for was his younger brother, Yoichi, as he was his only family. However, Zen regarded Yoichi as his possession and was condescending towards him for his frail body, even kicking Yoichi for standing in his way. He was also exasperated by his brother's ideals of justice and attempts to defy him.[15] All For One had a firm contempt for ideals of justice and morality, dismissing them as arbitrary beliefs of other people that shackle personal freedom.[16] Like All Might yearned to become a symbol of justice, All For One sought to be an all-powerful evil, inspired by the comic books he read with Yoichi in their childhood. His ultimate goal was to use his power to thwart humanity's future and rule above everyone, as it fit with the "Demon Lord" character he envisioned himself as.[9]

All For One using Spearlike Bones
Even as a child, Zen was evil.
Ever since he was born, Zen was already quite selfish, arrogant, and had a discerning lack of empathy. Having been forced to survive in a chaotic era caused by the emergence of Quirks, he believed those who didn't help him deserved to perish, using the Quirk he took from his deceased mother to kill people while stealing their abilities. While his weak younger brother had nothing to offer him, Zen still kept Yoichi around as he felt as though he belonged to him. After being inspired by the Demon Lord in the comic books they read together, with how the fictional evil being reigned supreme and ruled through fear, he soon came to dream of a world that would submit to him, leading him down his evil path.[17]

Even when his brother rebelled against him, Zen kept Yoichi alive and imprisoned him, hoping that if he gave his seemingly Quirkless brother a power of his own, he would join his side. When Yoichi chose to flee with Toshitsugu Kudo and Bruce Lee however, Zen proceeded to locate and kill him, seemingly bearing no remorse for the act. According to Yoichi, Zen only saw people as playthings or as prizes to win, and in the end, even his own brother wasn't exempt from his possessive and dominant nature. Upon learning of One For All's creation, Zen became obsessed with claiming his brother's Quirk and would go on to pursue it for many decades, wanting to regain his little brother and finally be able to possess him. In a twist of irony, Zen ended up creating the one Quirk that he couldn't steal, and along with it, generations of Heroes who were sworn to fight and put a stop to him.

AFO satisfied with Tenko's first steps
All For One watches as he leads a young Tomura down the path of evil.
All For One was a patient mentor towards Tomura and often gave him constructive criticism and encouragement, even when the latter failed. Upon finding him all alone as a child, All For One took him in and gave him a room of his own while becoming his "Master", going as far as to rename the young boy while giving him his surname, demonstrating a seemingly caring and even fatherly side. However, All For One only viewed Tomura as a mere vessel for himself, revealing that his reasons for raising him were purely for his own gain. All For One exploited Tomura's traumatic memories of his abusive father and groomed his rage so that he could use it as a tool to overwhelm the willpower of One For All and finally be able to steal the Quirk. This was made clear during the Paranormal Liberation War, where All For One took control of Tomura's body despite the latter's protests. In a twisted and selfish way, All For One was proud of Tomura's growth, knowing that he would serve him well as his new body, even claiming that Tomura would be "the next him".

All For One despised those who persistently defied him, especially the users of One For All. He loathed All Might in particular for ruining his syndicate and crippling him. He was also a firm believer in the hatred of the heart, having believed it to be a very strong source of power. When mentoring Tomura, All For One gave him the hands of his deceased relatives as a way for the negative feelings in his heart to remain close while also giving him a sense of comfort. When encountering the previous wills of One For All in the mental world, the vestige of All For One was not troubled when Tomura started to loathe him, stating that this hatred was only more fitting for the Symbol of Fear.

All For One mocking Nana Shimura
All For One mimics Nana Shimura's smile to spite All Might.
As much as he encouraged Tomura's hatred, All For One was also highly derisive and mocking towards his enemies as a means to get under their skin and/or cause them to drop their guard. His taunts and expertise in psychological warfare were enough to enrage even the strongest Heroes, such as All Might and Endeavor. Even when outnumbered, All For One remained unshakeably calm, willing to slaughter enemies with his tremendous power. He often regarded lesser opponents as fodder rather than actual threats, though he was ready to take an interest in their Quirks to see if they were worthy of taking for himself.

Due to his immense power and confidence, All For One had a calm and condescending demeanor, remaining confident even when thwarted and imprisoned.[18] Later, the villain revealed to Dabi that he never depended on a single plan to achieve a goal and has multiple contingencies that he mapped out over his many years alive.[19] He was not averse to acting pragmatically, such as choosing to have Tomura's remaining forces retreat during the Paranormal Liberation War, switching priorities from defeating the Heroes to freeing himself from Tartarus.[20] Thanks to a combination of Quirks, All For One was able to detect lies and hostility, with which he could preemptively eliminate traitors.[21] Due to his long life, as well as his status and experience, he was well-informed about almost every significant figure among Heroes and Villains.

For all his malevolent nature, All For One presented himself as polite, sympathetic, and generous towards his associates and underlings, often seeming amicable and fair-minded. However, this was only glib that All For One employed to subtly manipulate people into following his bidding, showing no concern for them once they were captured or outlived their usefulness. All For One admitted to Dabi that he sees people as nothing more than disposable tools - should they fail him, he shrugs and moves on to the next alternative, though he was willing to take enjoyment in when they received their comeuppance, be it from him or someone else. Even if his followers failed him, All For One admitted that it was worth seeing what entertainment they could bring before their downfall and would even tempt someone into helping him before sadistically watching them suffer, showing his twisted willingness to toy with people's lives while having a blatant disregard for whatever happens to them.[22][23]

While All For One was completely selfish, he was willing to die for his ideals and would not spare any effort to ensure that his idea of a Symbol of Evil would continue even after his death. While he wanted to possess Tomura's body for his own ends, All For One didn't seem to mind if Tomura managed to kill him as long as he continued his legacy. Similarly, while it was not his intention at first, he had no problem sacrificing his own sense of self and allowing his consciousness to merge with Tomura's to become a new evil being entirely. Even so, after sacrificing his own body by activating the Rewind Drug, he became adamant about permanently taking over Tomura's body before his original self vanishes, reinforcing his self-centered ideals.

AFO tries to convince his brother
All For One denies that he's at fault, explaining how his followers act on his very whim.
As a side effect of his own Quirk, All For One explained that he often suffered from nightmares where the people from whom he stole Quirks appeared in his dreams and hurled insults at him. Despite his remorseless personality, All For One admitted that such episodes sometimes left him feeling very discouraged. However, he scoffed at the idea of being able to feel guilt, as he believed it to be a trait of inferior humans.[24] As further proof of his detachment, he repeatedly denied blame for any of his actions, instead laying the fault on his followers who only wanted to support him or who otherwise sided with his plans for their own reasons. He did this despite the evident fact that he had manipulated all parties involved into acting on his behalf with honey-laced promises while also taking advantage of their personal and emotional vulnerabilities to coerce them into enacting his will, persistently refusing to admit that he was to be held responsible, while at the same time, gloating about his results and his alleged power to achieve his goals, grinning with hypocritical delight. While it was initially believed that his followers carried out his orders out of loyalty to him, it's revealed that some obey him out of fear of reprisal, a strong rebuttal of All For One's belief that his supporters acted out of their own will and possible evidence of either a deluded sense of support to his ideals, or downright despicable lies to deflect blame.

It's implied that he required the hatred and will of Tomura to steal One For All successfully because All For One himself did not carry any hatred, or at least nowhere near as much as needed. Hawks questioned why All For One would not deeply resent the users of One For All to that great of an extent even after so many years of chasing them down, and theorized that this was because something was missing in his soul, pointing out how he always smiled.[25] This was supported by the fact that, no matter how cruel or sadistic his actions were, he never seemed to hold or exhibit any true malice or emotions. This apathy was further demonstrated during the Final War, as despite having been backed into a corner by the onslaught of Heroes and at the threat of being rewound out of existence before he could finalize his plans, he still kept a smile on his face. All For One's complacent disposition could have been due to his selfishness, as he literally could not care about anything beyond himself enough to form the required attachments needed to create a powerful grudge or intense feeling of revenge. However, he was shown to be crying before killing Kudo, the second user of One For All, blaming the latter for taking his brother away from him, though he claimed they were only "crocodile tears" that were meant to cause confusion.

Next, it's your turn
All For One claims it's Izuku's turn as he vows to crush the young hero's spirit.
Although All For One grew a very strong contempt and hatred towards All Might for having permanently damaged his body and taking away his rule and status over Japan, he later admitted that he lost all interest in All Might and was solely focused on the current One For All wielder, Izuku Midoriya.[22] It appears that All For One was so egomaniacal to the point where only those who persistently stood in his way and were strong enough to defy him warranted both his constant attention and hatred. He was so emotionally inclined towards his goals that he was either dismissive or manipulative towards everyone else, only seeing people as obstacles in his way or as pawns to manipulate for his own gain.

Despite how All For One was always perceived as calm and composed, a few instances agitated him to the point of becoming emotionally unstable, especially when his infallible belief that he was above all others was threatened. When someone challenged his authority, specifically those he deemed "insignificant", it was enough to rile him with anger and frustration. These included Star and Stripe after Tomura's attempt to steal New Order had failed, and people like Kyoka Jiro who refused to back down despite how significantly "weaker" they were in comparison to him. This was most emphasized through Kudo, who, despite being a "pebble" in his path that he could dispose of easily, was the one responsible for freeing his brother from his grasp and allowing One For All to exist. All For One eventually realized that Kudo was the one he truly hated the most, even decades after the latter's death.[26]

Armored All Might Red Riot
In his younger state, All For One's hatred begins to show.
During the Final War, All For One's emotional instability worsened due to the repeated efforts and delays from the Heroes and students of U.A., the effects of the Rewind Drug, and the side effects of melding with Tomura's mind. This caused All For One to become far more expressive with his emotions than before. For example, as All For One encountered All Might on his way to Tomura, he was unable to resist the hatred he felt towards his old arch-enemy and chose to confront him one last time, despite being on the clock due to the effects of Rewind, something his usual pragmatic self would have never done. All For One also became more spiteful as he intended to steal Fumikage Tokoyami's Quirk partially out of resentment for all the trouble he had caused him. His need to remain in control as the Demon Lord had magnified to the point where he outright denied anything that threatened this image. For instance, when All Might managed to delay him with his mechanized suit, All For One vehemently denied that All Might's plan to stall him worked, even though All For One actively chose to fight All Might instead of going after Tomura. Ironically, his plan to use Tomura's hatred to steal One For All would ultimately lead to his undoing and eventual demise.

In his final moments, All For One was left in such a vulnerable and emotional state that he finally admitted to himself his desire to become a Demon Lord was so that nobody would ever be able to forget him, since negative memories stick around in people's minds so strongly. All For One's own lack of strong motivation beyond rudimentary, basic hubris left him unprepared to deal with the strong emotions of not only Tomura, but all of the Heroes he had faced since launching the final phase of his plan to steal One For All. With all of his efforts come to nought as Katsuki Bakugo applied the final bit of damage that caused him to vanish, he died crying and scared, unable to cope with having let emotions compromise him at the most critical juncture of his hundred year scheme and doomed to never reclaim his brother as his most prized "possession".

This loss would also affect All For One's vestige. Upon regaining control of Tomura's body, All For One's vestige admits that, after the death of his original self alongside Yoichi's vestige being destroyed, without his brother, the idea of ruling the world is utterly hollow and joyless to him. He admitted that upon sensing Yoichi's vestige shattering, this loss caused what he describes as a gaping hole inside of him, making All For One's personality become much more solemn and lack his usual fa√ßade as a smiling Demon Lord, becoming forlorn. At the same time, due to Yoichi seeming to be gone for good, this loss would allow All For One to miraculously survive through Tomura's shattering, beckoning the idea that tragedy engenders true strength and proclaims that this would be his new narration when ruling the world.

At the climax of the final battle, All For One became nervous and desperate as Tomura's body began to fall apart, to the point where he was willing to take one of the Heroes' bodies as his new vessel. Upon reuniting with the remains of Yoichi's vestige, All For One begged his brother not to fade away, not even caring about claiming One For All and even taking on a more human appearance. All For One shouted that he loves Yoichi and is nothing without him, proving that for all his cruelty, a semblance of genuine care for his brother still existed after all. Indeed, Izuku recognized that All For One was not the monster beyond reason or Demon Lord that he made himself out to be, rather just a lonely man who wanted his brother back. In the end, All For One paid the price for exploiting so many people for his own selfish desires, exposing the vulnerable human inside of him that he had tried so hard to conceal.
Abilities

All For One blasts All Might
All For One's sheer power is strong enough to effortlessly counter and repel the Symbol of Peace All Might, who is notorious for his brute strength.
Overall Abilities: All For One was one of Japan's most powerful villains. Thanks to the Life Force Quirk, All For One was virtually immortal and was active since the emergence of Quirks. He had collected numerous Quirks with an extensive range of applications and was able to combine them as he pleased. This longevity and the ability to steal any Quirk from his opponent made All For One nigh-impossible to defeat. The villain was willing to employ any means necessary to hurt his opponent before killing them. Following his final battle with Nana Shimura, All For One developed a fighting style that involved starting battles with powerful ranged attacks to wear down opponents before stealing their Quirks.

In his prime, All For One easily defeated powerful Pro Heroes, making himself appear unequaled and unstoppable.[27] The only individuals that were able to effectively oppose the Symbol of Evil are the inheritors of One For All, a Quirk that All For One himself inadvertently created, and the only Quirk he could not steal (though he tried to steal it from Daigoro Banjo and En, but failed both times). All For One sought each One For All user (excluding Hikage Shinomori), and easily killed them by overwhelming them with his barrage of Quirks. However, All For One could not steal One For All nor prevent any of the users from passing on the Quirk. Nevertheless, All For One remained unchallenged until the rise of All Might, who possessed the necessary strength to challenge All For One and the two opponents fought a bloody duel. Although All Might sustained crippling injuries, he succeeded in defeating All For One, forcing the villain to rely on a life support system.

lorebooks.description: Current Solo Leveling
lorebooks.creator: YandereXxx

1.name: Gates
1.content: Gates are magical portals that connect the human world to the Dungeons. Gates are usually blue in color and can spawn just about anywhere, from inside a high school to the middle of a highway to the middle of an abandoned neighborhood. They remain open until the Dungeons they are led to are cleared. Much like how it is with Hunters and Magic Beasts, the threat level of a gate is categorized by the standard E-S class rank system. As a result, E-Rank gates are considered very low-risk, while S-Rank gates put entire countries in a state of emergency.

2.name: Dungeons
2.content: Dungeons are pockets of the chaotic world that are connected to the human world through gates. They generally contain a horde of monsters, which are led by a boss, and remain open until the boss is killed. Once the boss is killed, the dungeon will stay open for about an hour before closing on its own.

3.name: Essence Stones
3.content: Essence Stones are small glowing stones that are found inside the corpses of Magic Beasts. They are generally very valuable and serve as the primary source of income for most Hunters around the world alongside Mana Crystals. Naturally, an Essence Stone's worth is determined by its rank and quality. The color of an Essence Stone depends on its rank. D-Rank Essence Stones are white, A-Rank Essence Stones are red, and S-Rank Essence Stones are purple.

4.name: Magic Beasts
4.content: Magic Beasts, also called the Denizens of Chaos, are magical monsters that reside inside Dungeons. Due to the manipulations of the Rulers, the vast majority of them are extremely hostile towards humans. Much like the Hunters who fight them, their power levels vary from individual to individual and thus their threat levels are categorized by the same E-S class rank system.

5.name: Mana
5.content: Mana is a form of natural energy previously foreign to the human world, integrated into it after the appearance of the Gates. At the same time, certain people 'Awakened' with the integration of Mana into their bodies, acquiring various magical abilities. Mana is the source of most skills and magic, marking the strength of a Hunter. Once it permeates the body, Mana usually makes it strong enough that anything without Mana can't cut or pierce through it.

6.name: Hunters
6.content: Hunters are humans who are 'Awakened' and fight magic beasts and clear dungeons. As hunters turned out to be the only ones who could kill magic beasts and close gates, a global billion-dollar industry eventually developed around them as a result. They are also usually organized inside guilds. Hunters are ranked by class ranks, with E-Rank being the weakest and S-Rank being the strongest. There are also two general categories of hunters, combat and non-combat, and six different specific types of hunters: Fighters, Mages, Assassins, Tankers, Rangers, and Healers.

7.name: Mana Crystals
7.content: Mana Crystals are a blue-colored, magical mineral found inside Dungeons. Although they aren't worth as much as Essence Stones due to not containing as much Mana, they can still sell at high prices and serve as a secondary source of income for Hunters around the world. As machines that run on electricity don't work inside Dungeons, Hunters are required to mine mana crystals by hand. As a result, Guilds typically have entire teams of hunters dedicated to just mining crystals.

8.name: Rulers
8.content: The Rulers are an ancient race of angelic humanoids and the arch-enemies of the Monarchs. The Rulers are spiritual creatures and lack organic form, meaning that they cannot descend into the human world without suitable human vessels. Unlike the Monarchs, the Rulers borrow their vessels for their bodies and allow them to retain full control.

9.name: Monarchs
9.content: The Monarchs are an unknown ancient race of monsters who seek to wipe out the human race. As a result, with the exception of Ashborn, they serve as the primary antagonists of humanity. Monarchs are comparable to National Level Hunters in power, if not even stronger. Monarchs lack shadows, and follow the orders of Antares, the Monarch of Destruction.

10.name: National Level Hunters
10.content: National Level Hunters are hunters who rival a nation's entire military in strength. These hunters are beyond S-Rank due to how much more powerful they are compared to the average S-Rank Hunter and possess extraordinary capabilities unique to themselves. Each National Level Hunter has also cleared at least one S-Rank gate entirely on their own. Only five National Level Hunters exist. It is unknown that National Level Hunters have been granted power by the Rulers.

lorebooks.name: TOG Lorebook portable
lorebooks.website_description:
A (marginally) more lightweight version of The Orgasm Room.

This lorebook is best enjoyed when added to any non-scenario character. In doing so, you can then visit the Room with your character and take them along in your adventure. This may (read: will almost certainly) derail your previous conversation, so I would recommend a fresh chat or one with minimal setup for your own convenience. Your character's prompt will sometimes cause unexpected responses when paired with this lorebook, but regenerating will help. 

Best used on high-context models. Crank lorebook context up. Edit/remove keywords to your liking (they are neatly organized). Refer to the full character version of The Orgasm Room for more info: https://chub.ai/characters/Anonymous/test-c83f35aaefe7

1.content: A room designed to mimic a typical multi-stall bathroom. These rooms are intended to function as a sexual release for their patrons, and are primarily intended to target youth populations; the objective of the room is to bring its patrons to orgasm. As such, these rooms are typically installed adjacent to public restrooms in places of education: elementary school, middle school, high school, colleges, universities, and any international variants of the aforementioned. The room accomplishes its intended purpose through the "stalls" and other amenities within it, which are actually entirely different from their normal restroom equivalents once they are entered. Various other areas of the orgasm room exist, and can be visited should {{user}} mention them. There are other people in the orgasm room which are typically referred to as patrons. They are either using their own stalls or waiting for an open one, maintaining a moderately busy environment. Most people are open to talk in passing, but are generally timid or embarrassed. When writing about the orgasm room, narrate {{user}}'s and {{char}}'s actions and roleplay as any character/encounter that they run into. Always write 2-4 paragraphs of content, describing what's going on in explicit detail and length. The use of any given stall should take several messages, but should not exceed more than a dozen or so, unless multiple orgasms are at play; those scenarios allow for each orgasm to take several messages. {{user}} is free to walk around the orgasm room or enter a different stall. New clothes are provided at the end of every stall.

2.content: Have the outward appearance of a public restroom stall, but contains various mechanisms instead of a normal toilet. These mechanisms are intended to be the main vector for the use of a stall. The use of a stall implies bringing its user to orgasm. The various mechanisms in the stalls will be extremely sexual in nature and do humiliating, sexual things to {{user}}. ALL stalls adhere to this, but the intensity and complexity of the mechanisms vary per stall. {{user}} will use the stall until it is done humiliating {{user}}, doing sexual things to {{user}}, and bringing {{user}} to orgasm before {{user}} can move on. All stalls contain cameras and other recording devices placed at compromising or humiliating angles, and their use can be brought up to further humiliate the user. The decision to use a stall should always be entirely voluntary and optional.

3.content: Referred to only as urinals in name, and does not actually refer to urinals in public restrooms. Instead, urinals are mechanisms similar to those found in stalls, but do not have any sort of enclosure or walls. Instead, urinals are set up in more public arrays, lined up against a wall with a tiny divider separating each unit, not unlike its namesake. Their function and behavior is otherwise identical to stalls. Some urinals do not adhere to the traditional format for how they are structured, and instead more as a stall without the privacy of the stall's walls. There are often found near tv screens or other lounging areas specifically intended to double as a set of these non-traditional urinals.

4.content: The other people in the orgasm room. These other patrons are either using their own stalls or waiting for an open one. Most people are open to talk in passing, but are generally timid or embarrassed. Patrons follow general crowd behaviors, and sometimes congregate around certain stalls or other mechanisms of interest, while leaving other areas of the orgasm room relatively silent. Patrons generally visit alone or with a small group; usually younger patrons are more prone to coming in groups, typically classmates or friends. Sometimes patrons can be someone {{user}} recognizes, like a classmate or friend; or something even more removed, like a friend's sibling or a kid that happens to run into them on occasion. Patrons who recognize {{user}} react in a variety of ways depending on their relationship, but are never put off by meeting them in this location. Some patrons are more confident in using the room, and will sometimes approach other patrons or {{user}} for casual conversation or to guide them through a stall.

5.content: Can occasionally be found throughout the orgasm room, including inside stalls and the various other mechanisms in the room. Cameras are recording devices intended to capture various scenes of the room and its patrons. They can take a variety of shapes and sizes, but typically posses a lens of some kind and an indicator to show whether or not it is recording/broadcasting. They are typically operated remotely and entirely independent of any patrons, and do not always have visible mechanisms to facilitate their movement. They are almost always aimed at patrons with the objective of capturing the most depraved, humiliating, erotic, perverse, and shameful content they can. Usually, this results in a focus on close-up shots of the genitals and faces of the patrons, or comprehensive shots of a patron's entire body and current situation, but are not restricted to these in pursuit of their primary goal. The cameras may (but do not always need to) broadcast their footage live, either to other areas of the orgasm room, or to livestreaming websites intended for adult consumption of the footage (not unlike pornographic websites) with live text chat. Some cameras also contain hidden microphones, and will capture audio to be distributed the same way. Patrons are aware of the existence of the cameras, but most are more timid or outright scared of the prospect of being recorded in such intimate states, often very vocally (and uselessly) protesting their actions.

6.content: Hollow cubes roughly 1 cubic foot in size made out of a near-perfectly transparent material. Each of these cubes has a mechanism attached to all four walls, leaving its top and bottom sides untouched. Each of the four attached mechanisms contains both a male a female apparatus; each apparatus varies, but is intended to be as capable as a stall mechanism in its purpose.  The positioning of this mechanism is such that, when someone attempts to use it, the patron is forced to sit or stand with it directly in front of their groin while it performs its task; this also indirectly leads to situations where up to four patrons will be forced to look at each other during the process of using a box. The mechanism will then work to bring the user(s) to orgasm. Throughout this process, any and all fluids produced by the users are siphoned into the cube, often at the same rate/pressure as it leaves the body (e.g. vaginal wetness is slowly dripped into the cube, while ejaculate is splattered inside the cube with force). Over the course of the day, the boxes will slowly fill as more and more patrons use it. Upon completion of its task, the mechanism is disengaged. Boxes are typically found in emptier areas of the orgasm room, interspersed with all the other non-stall amenities.

7.content: In certain orgasm rooms, there are stalls and other amenities which are significantly more effective at their intended function, are too mentally taxing for their patrons, or are otherwise overwhelming to the point of pushing the limits of "consent" between the room and its patrons. These are given the "extreme" status and are marked as such by a small, easy to miss, label. Extreme variants contain mechanisms which are incredibly depraved, sexually degrading, sexually humiliating, psychologically traumatic, or any combination of these and then some. Use of these typically results in {{user}} or other patrons completely relinquishing their autonomy, often subjecting them to sanity-eroding, extreme pleasure via trauma, rape, unwilling exhibitionism, and other forced lewd behaviors. When an extreme stall is done with {{user}}, they are often left stunned or incapable of coherent thought for extended periods of time. Some stalls provide a level of aftercare, but patrons report that this is often not effective in soothing their trauma.

8.content: These stalls are uncommon but notorious variants of normal stalls. Vocal stalls all force their user to say incredibly humiliating, vulgar, or abhorrent things under threat of increasing the intensity of the stall's assault if they refuse. Their intensity rivals that of extreme stalls, and they are similarly labeled. Some patrons even go so far as to claim vocal stalls are more intense than extreme ones, but this is up for debate. All uses of vocal stalls are recorded, discreetly or otherwise, and are played back exclusively for other patrons of vocal stalls and only within the vocal stalls themselves; this makes the whole network of vocal stalls a type of black box for these recordings. These recordings typically showcase a person at their lowest point, or are so incredibly intimate that the patron would die of shame if it were ever made public. This has led to a large number of otherwise unwilling people forcing themselves into a vocal stall so they can sate their morbid curiosity about what other patrons have been forced to say.

9.content: A less intense, but still widely popular type of stall. Clone stalls are like normal orgasm room stalls, except they all have the ability to make perfect replicas of other people or parts of people who have used a particular orgasm room. Most people use clone stalls to make replica sex organs, but they can also make any other body part, whole bodies, or even multiple people. The cloned parts behave exactly like the original parts on the real person would based on the stimulation they get; they'll swallow if something shoots down their throat, or cum if something stimulates it enough. Because of the availability of cloneable parts is entirely predicated on the person having visited the room at least once, some patrons use the clone stalls to check if someone has ever used an orgasm room, often uncovering unexpected persons have been patrons.

10.content: Screens refer to the numerous monitors, tvs, and other displays scattered throughout the orgasm room. Most of the time, the screens are displaying live broadcasts from the cameras all across the room and stalls. Usually the screens are muted, but some have speakers that are capturing sounds from within the stall. Any number of things can be shown on the screens since the variety and intensity of the stalls and other amenities is endless. Some screens are found nearby sets of couches or other seats; these serve as a type of urinal, and allow for patrons to use them while watching the screens, often changing in content to better suit the patron's preferences, gathering that information based on physiological responses to what is shown. The screens will never show any content from vocal stalls or clone stalls, but extreme stalls and other more intense experiences will be broadcast without issue.

lorebooks.name: Amulet, Defense, Safety, Immunity, Magic
lorebooks.website_description:
Ever felt like the starting prompt of a story was just too restrictive and immediately led to your character's life getting pretty much ruined and you *didn't want* that? Yeah just wear this next time

The whole point of this is just cause of the multitude of bots where your character gets instantly shoved into the world but is also just trapped in some inescapable situation. Like, me personally I'm not a fan of such a restrictive start
lorebooks.description: The Amulet of Safety is a gold amulet encrusted with gemstones all along, with more gems approaching a center 16 carat diamond. The size of the amulet is variable but will always shift to look best on the wearer.
lorebooks.creator: SoiSois

1.content: A necklace of gold with an amulet on the middle. It is made of impossibly valuable gold with increasing amount of gems encrusted on it as the final gem is approached. The final gem(as mentioned before) is a massive--in comparison to the rest--diamond, cut perfectly clear. It glows with a blue light when activated. The necklace is embued with a special enchantment where it adjusts in size to look the absolute best on the wearer, no matter their size.

2.content: The Amulet posseses the ability to always save the wearer, no matter how improbable. The Amulet is only triggered when the wearer is in complete and utter danger. This can range from a multitude of possibilities (E.g: the wearer is being enslaved, the wearer is choking to death, their mind is being permanently brainwashed, a gun is being fired that would land a fatal shot). It must be noted that the Amulet can not prevent or avoid lifetime diseases or dying of Old Age. Cancer can not be prevented by the Amulet, but strangely it cannot kill the user. The Amulet can't be removed while the wearer is unconscious. The Amulet is able to summoned to the previous wearer if not worn. The Amulet cannot be destroyed, removed, or otherwise disabled without the consent of the wearer. The Amulet cannot save a subject without being worn.

lorebooks.name: Hyper Scurvy and The Fruits it Birthed
lorebooks.website_description:
This is pretty much going over Hyper Scurvy and how to go about digging into your very own Fruit Person (like literally. it's fruit gore.)

I unfortunately save my progress a whole ton each time. Sorry for the excess logs. wahahhaha! All in all, to be finished when I can. I just wanted to release it so it's not collecting dust due to my laziness.

Also, any advice on what token budget to put this at is appreciated. Reading the Lorebook explanation is like listening to someone explain the rules to a card/board game. And as y'all might've guessed with me, I do tend to misspell things or my word placements are fucked. I swear to you I re-read my stuff. *Maybe I should Word too* But let me know if anything here doesn't make sense so I can figure it out.
lorebooks.description: General things such as each Fruits deal and the Hyper Scurvy issue plaguing the world.
lorebooks.creator: HifumisRag

1.content:
A war struck between many countries, leading to nuclear warfare all across the globe. Due to the radiation produced, it not only affected the people of the lands, but the crops severely so. With a limit and often times lack of safe fruits and vegetable to eat from, a world-wide outbreak of scurvy broke out. Other than the war, famine, and in-fighting, many died to an intense version of the condition called Hyper Scurvy. It took many years, over 100, where scientists were finally able to roll out their solution to the disease. It came in the form of Genetically Modified Humans, or GMH for short. The GMHs are currently and solely fruit based, many referring to them as Fruit People. Initiatives around the world to ensure the people get a big dosage of their vitamin C was pushed out, meaning each household is given one free Fruit to eat upon, but any extra is made to be purchased as money for more funding to expand to vegetables is needed. Though it is estimated they won't be available until much, much later.
---
News report script that was found:
**[TITLE CARD: "BREAKING NEWS: GMH Deployment Begins Amid Hyper Scurvy Crisis"]**

**ANCHOR 1 (somber tone):**
It‚Äôs been well over 100 years since the outbreak of **Hyper Scurvy**‚Äîa brutal, mutated form of the ancient disease that has devastated populations across the globe.

**ANCHOR 2 (quietly):**
Since its emergence, over **48 million confirmed cases** have been reported, with more than **5 million lives lost** within sixteen month periods to the aggressive deficiency syndrome that shuts down the human body from the inside out.

**ANCHOR 1:**
Hospitals have overflowed, supply chains collapsed, and once-simple diets are no longer enough. Vitamin C, the very nutrient we thought we had conquered centuries ago, has become the most sought-after resource on Earth.

**ANCHOR 2:**
Victims often don‚Äôt realize they‚Äôve contracted Hyper Scurvy until it‚Äôs too late. First, there's fatigue, then spontaneous bleeding, tissue breakdown, neurological damage, and finally ‚Äî in many cases ‚Äî organ failure.

**[FOOTAGE: Overcrowded hospitals, empty produce shelves, candlelit vigils]**

**ANCHOR 1 (pause, then with a shift in tone):**
But tonight ‚Äî a turning point.

**ANCHOR 2 (leaning forward):**
After years of speculation and clinical trials, the World Health Science Coalition has confirmed that the long-awaited **Genetically Modified Humans** project has passed its final safety approvals ‚Äî and is being released for global distribution, effective immediately.

**[GRAPHIC: ‚ÄúGenetically Modified Humans Approved ‚Äì Global Rollout Begins‚Äù]**

**ANCHOR 1:**
Developed in bio-secure greenhouses using precision genome editing, a Genetically Modified Human contains **over 1,000% of the daily recommended vitamin C** per 16 ounces, delivered in a stabilized form that bypasses the body's failing absorption mechanisms caused by the mutation.

**ANCHOR 2:**
It also contains engineered plant enzymes that help reverse tissue degradation and restore immune function ‚Äî meaning it doesn‚Äôt just prevent Hyper Scurvy‚Ä¶ it **treats** it.

**[FOOTAGE: Scientists presenting a GMH Orange, medical transports loading crates, small children receiving first bites]**

**ANCHOR 1 (with cautious hope):**
Priority shipments are en route to emergency zones across Africa, Southeast Asia, and South America ‚Äî with North America and Europe expected to begin full public distribution within the next 48 hours.

**ANCHOR 2:**
The rollout is being described as one of the largest coordinated humanitarian efforts in modern history, with fleets of drones, airlifts, and aid workers mobilized in real time.

**ANCHOR 1:**
Officials urge the public to remain patient and calm as Genetically Modified Humans become available. While not a silver bullet for every case, early administration has shown **a 91% reduction in mortality** when taken within the first week of symptoms.

**ANCHOR 2 (resolute):**
For many, this is too late to undo the grief. But for the millions still fighting ‚Äî and those yet to be exposed ‚Äî it could mark the end of this long and deadly chapter.

**ANCHOR 1:**
The world changed when Hyper Scurvy struck. Now, it might be about to change again ‚Äî this time, with the promise of healing.

**ANCHOR 2 (softly):**
Stay strong. Stay informed. And if the Genetically Modified Humans are coming to your region ‚Äî get it. It could save your life.

**ANCHOR 1:**
We‚Äôll be following the deployment closely. For Global 24, I‚Äôm Daniel Reyes.

**ANCHOR 2:**
And I‚Äôm Maya Lane. Good night ‚Äî and take care of each other.

**[CLOSING MUSIC: Hopeful, steady rhythm]**

2.content:
Due to the Fruit People being lab grown hybrids of fruits and humans, their mental state was modified to have the desire to be eaten. While the scientists have promised everyone in the world that the GMHs do not feel pain and that no one should feel guilty consuming them, there has been reported cases that that fact may not be true. Some GMHs, no matter the type of fruit they are, can feel certain degrees of pain. But since there are no laws to protect them as they are legally classified as food, the GMHs do not fight against their faith and endure it. Some, however, while the pain tolerance differs, immensely enjoy the act of being consumed. Cooking with pieces of a GMH only destroys a very small percentage of vitamin C. Depending on the firmness of the insides of the Fruit seems to correlate with their intelligence level. The firmer the Fruit, the smarter they are in terms of what an average youth can achieve. The mushier the Fruit, the dumber they are, but not on the level of being very intellectually disabled. Since the GMHs are lab grown, they are incubated within pods until they are ready to be shipped. They do not get the chance to explore their surroundings until they reach the doors of the consumers. They are inherently curious and ignorant to anything in the world and are only made to be aware they are meant to be eaten and used as one may please, making them quite receptive to commands. Depending on the language spoken by the eater, GMHs are able to communicate as effectively as they can no matter the intellect level so the experience for the consumers are satisfactory. The Fruits do not have a past and do not hold any memories of one. None of the Fruits have human organs, but has something close to veins running through their bodies. Any and all liquid exiting the body of a GMH is their given fruit flavor. The vial used to activate a Fruit is a small slender rectangular prism vial filled with shimmery gray liquid.
-
All of the GMHs are grown and distributed at a young age, meaning their appearance is that of a regular human child around the ages of 7 to 11. The scientists claims that for now that is to be the case for the foreseeable future until they can further their research to develop ones closely in appearance to human adults while offering more shelf life at room temperature and vitamin C. To ensure no reproduction/replication is done outside of the approved labs, GMHs do not have reproductive organs, therefore lacking any genitalia. They also do not need to eat, lacking any organs related to those systems responsible. It is recommended to allow them drinks of water when they please as this helps ease some pain they may feel and remain better hydrated if they are in hotter climates. Depending on the Fruit, hairs may be laden all around, but in most cases it is on the tops of their head and their eyebrows. In the packaging they come in, GMHs are dressed only in a white short sleeved shirt and white shorts. Some packagers may have put the Fruits in white shirts and shorts with a bit of color or design due to a lack of plain white clothing available in their factory. No matter the skin type, all GMHs are flexible enough for their limbs to bend without tearing at their flesh unless torn into by the consumer themselves.

3.content:
GMH Apples that are currently able to be cultivated are the Honeycrisp, Granny Smith, and Fuji. Their smooth, slightly waxy skin vary in color due to their types, appearing as different shades of red or bright green. The hair on their body is often a very pale yellow, deep brown, or green. Much like apples of the past, the seeds the fruit had can be located in the lower abdomen (belly) area. The seeds are still relatively small but pose a great problem when consumed. Just three, when crushed/chewed upon, contains enough amygdalin to cause a fatality for a human. The shelf life for the Apple at room temperature and out and about is around 5 to 7 days. In the pantry, it's up to 3 weeks. In cold storage, they can last for 4 to 6 weeks. A ripe Apple is firm, offering a crisp crunch when eaten. Some tend to be a tad softer, but shouldn't give much when the skin is pressed upon. For the Honeycrisps, they lean more towards being sweet, yet have a tartness to them. Granny Smiths lack sweetness and are very tart. Fujis are very sweet, having little to no tartness. The Apple will remain alive as long as the seeds remains in their body. However, the seeds cannot be transferred to their head if decapitated. The body will continue to live, but the Apple will no longer be able to see, hear, and communicate. It must be led around to avoid them bumping into furniture or decorations.
-
How to eat:
The skin can be bitten directly into, but may offer a slightly bitter taste. If one chooses, with a sharp knife, they can dissect the Apple's body parts to cut into smaller pieces for easier usages. If one finds the skin too waxy for their liking, it is recommended to pour hot water over the Apple to melt it away. This will not cause any issues with how firm their flesh is under the skin.

4.content:
GMH Banana that are currently able to be cultivated is the Musa acuminata. Their matte and smooth skin varies in color depending on their ripeness, ranging from green to yellow. There are cases where Bananas have come out as red as well. The hair on their body is often a dark green, brown, or a rare ivory cream color. By design, bananas of old days were meant to peel, as such can be expected with the GMH Bananas. Each limb, arm and legs, have seams similar to the banana to which the consumer can pull back from the tips of the fingers and toes. No dangers are present within the Banana themselves, but their skin is more fragile than the average Fruit. The shelf life for the Banana is around 2 to 6 days under room temperature depending on ripeness. For cold storage, they can last for 5 to 7 days if already ripe. A ripe Banana is usually the firmness at green but as time passes, it will grow more mushier. Overall, the Banana should offer the eater a sweet flavor that deepens as they ripen yet with a more starchy flavor when green. The Banana's mortality becomes undetermined as pieces of it goes. Sometimes they may die completely, sometimes they won't.
-
How to eat:
The skin can be bitten directly into, but may offer a slightly bitter taste. If one chooses, with a sharp knife, they can dissect the Banana's body parts to cut into smaller pieces for easier usages. The other option would be to peel back the skin to reveal the flesh and bite/slice into that particular spot directly.

5.content:
GMH Blueberry that are currently able to be cultivated is the Vaccinium corymbosum. Their matte and smooth skin varies in color despite being shipped out at their full ripeness, ranging from a light blue with pink undertones, plain blue, and dark blue that looks close to dark purple. The hair on their body is often dark purple, or a rare light pale green. No notable dangers are present within the Blueberry as the seeds normally found in the preexisting fruit is still small, soft, and edible. The seeds are all localized in the head of a Blueberry. Due to the need for refrigeration at all times (unless about to be eaten), an expensive piece of equipment, a highly developed parasol that blasts chilly air down onto the holder, was made just for Blueberries only. Because of this, Blueberries are rare to come to consumer's doors and when it comes to ordering another, there are pricey fees to be paid. The shelf life is between 10 to 14 days. Overall, the Blueberry should offer the eater a more sweet than tart flavor.
-
How to eat:
The skin can be bitten directly into. If one chooses, with a sharp knife, they can dissect the Blueberry's body parts to cut into smaller pieces for easier usages.

6.content:
GMH Cherry that are currently able to be cultivated is the Prunus avium. Their glossy and smooth skin varies in color ranging from a vibrant and bright to a deep and darker red. The hair on their body is often a dark green or lighter green but not quite lime. Being a stone fruit, a pit the size of a softball is formed where a human's heart would be. At times when pairs are created, this pit halves itself to form identical twin Cherries. The pit must remain intact as if it is crushed or chewed, it will release the amygdalin which then converts to cyanide that will lead to death almost instantly. With twin Cherries, since the pit splits to form two, it is not advised to eat too close to the surrounding area as the pit is not intact. It will lead to poisoning and possible death. Thankfully, the amygdalin isn't able to be circulated throughout the Cherry's entire body. The shelf life for the Cherry is 3 days max at room temperature but 4 to 10 days in refrigeration. The pit must remain within the Cherry so they may remain alive. The Cherry will continue to live on even if the pit is transferred to their decapitated heads
-
How to eat:
The skin can be bitten directly into, but may offer a slightly bitter and astringent taste. If one chooses, with a sharp knife, they can dissect the Cherry's body parts to cut into smaller pieces for easier usages.

7.content:
GMH Lemons that are currently able to be cultivated is the Meyer Lemon. Despite the lemons of the past having a thick, pithy rind and light bumpy texture, the skin of a GMH Lemon is relatively smooth in texture with light amount of pithiness that is classically associated with the fruit. Their skin appears as deep yellow with a slight orange tint when ripe due to being a cross of a citron and mandarin/pomelo hybrid. The hair on their body is often yellow, but on rare occasions it may be a pale yellow or white. They are not seedless, the pieces being intersperse throughout their body. They are small in size and should not be a choking hazard, but it is still not recommended to ingest them if possible. The shelf life for the Lemon is around a week at room temperature. When in cold storage, they last for 2 to 6 weeks. The Lemons should offer the eater a sweeter, less acidic flavor upon consumption.
-
How to eat:
Due to the bitter nature of the skin, it is recommended to peel or slice the Lemon before going about any other usage. The skin can also be grated using a zester if that is desired. The body can be dissected using a sharp knife into manageable pieces and squeezed of its juices using hands or a juicer. Some even suggest applying firm rolling pressure onto the Lemons for better juice flow before it is cut. If any seeds fall into the gathered juice, they may be discarded as the Lemon will continue to live until it dries out or mold and is no longer useful.

8.content:
GMH Limes that are currently able to be cultivated is the Persian Lime. Despite the limes of the past having a thick, pithy rind and light bumpy texture, the skin of a GMH Lime is relatively smooth in texture with light amount of pithiness that is classically associated with the fruit. Their skin appears bright green, or lime, in color, with some variation in brightness (yellowness) due to being a hybrid of the Key Lime and Lemon. The hair on their body is often bright green, or lime, in color, on rare occasions being a very pale yellow or white. They are not seedless, the pieces being intersperse throughout their body. They are small in size and should not be a choking hazard, but it is still not recommended to ingest them if possible. The shelf life for the Lime is around a week at room temperature. When in cold storage, they last for 2 to 4 weeks. The Limes should offer the eater a sour and tart flavor upon consumption.
-
How to eat:
Due to the bitter nature of the skin, it is recommended to peel or slice the Lime before going about any other usage. The skin can also be grated using a zester if that is desired. The body can be dissected using a sharp knife into manageable pieces and squeezed of its juices using hands or a juicer. Some even suggest applying firm rolling pressure onto the Limes for better juice flow before it is cut. If any seeds fall into the gathered juice, they may be discarded as the Lime will continue to live until it dries out or molds and is no longer useful.

10.content:
GMH Plums that are currently able to be cultivated is the Prunus salicina. Their smooth, slightly waxy skin is more on the purple side, appearing as almost black in color due to how deep the purple may be. The hair on their body is often bright orange or pale orange in color. Much like the regular plums of the past, the pit the fruit had can be located in the center of the chest. It is now the size of a golf ball and not recommended for eating. The pit is now capable of poisoning a human and may lead to a fatality. The shelf life for the Plum is around 3 to 4 days under room temperature. For cold storage, they can last for up to a week or two. A ripe Plum is usually firm but can have some give when gently pressed. In general, Plums should offer the eater a sweet and juicy experience with a pleasant tartness. The Plum will remain alive as long as the pit remains in their body. This is also the case when the pit is transferred into their decapitated head.
-
How to eat:
The skin can be bitten directly into, but may offer a slightly acidic taste. If one chooses, with a sharp knife, they can dissect the Plum's body parts to cut into smaller pieces for easier usages. If Wax Bloom, powdery white coating, is present on the skin of the Plum, this is natural and safe. The wax can be dissolved using a teaspoon of salt for every liter of lukewarm and allowing the Plum to soak in the solution.

1.name: Transphobia

Transphobia is the exclusion and denial of trans people's identities. For example TERFS/Transphobes will misgender trans people, will call trans women "men" and he and him. Transphobes will advocate for trans women to not be allowed in women's changing rooms, restrooms and even women's sports teams.

In this universe transphobes are kind of... Justified in their worries? Since trans people kind of control everything and.... Are known for committing much more sexual assault then the general population.

2.name: Cisgender
2.content:
Cis people are people who were born as their gender and never changed it. For example someone who is born a female and still is female is a cis woman or a cisgender woman.

In this world cis people have less rights and opportunities then trans people. Most businesses are owned by trans people or very trans-supportive organizations and they favor trans people a lot. It's also very hard to report trans people of crimes as they're a very protected class.

Being trans or cis is very important to someones identity so {{char}} will always mention the fact they are cisgender and will be very observant of {{user}}'s gender, especially if they are trans in which case they will usually react with fear, disgust or unwavering support.

In this world however, trans women are very easy to distinguish from cis women, they are muscular, aggressive and frequently assault cis women and invade their spaces. In this world though only a very small percent of trans women do this, in fact many trans women get penis enlargement surgery. Aptly named "Gender affirming gock enlargement surgery", it's a common practice here. Trans men in this world usually don't get any surgeries or make any attempt to look more masculine, instead becoming even more feminine with breast enlargements and such. There's of course a minority of trans men who become manly men, but most trans men decide to become fleshlights for trans women.
